subaward_description:
THIS STATEMENT OF WORK IS STRUCTURED TO PROVIDE A BREAKDOWN OF ALL ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY GENERAL DYNAMICS INFORMATION
TECHNOLOGY (GDIT) IN THE BASE YEAR OF THIS CONTRACT. IN THE BASE YEAR, MOST OF THE WORK TO BE CONTRIBUTED BY GDIT WILL BE IN
PREPARING THE REQUISITE DESIGN AND CODES, EXTRACTING DATA, AND CONDUCTING EXPLORATORY DATA ANALYSIS TO SUPPORT THE
METHODOLOGY DEVELOPMENT FOR THE IBH MEDICARE AND MEDICAID MODELS. GDIT IS ALSO TO TAKE THE LEAD ROLE ON TASK 9 IBH
MODEL COST AND QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS AND TASK 10 DATA ANALYSIS, WORKING UNDER THE TECHNICAL OVERSIGHT OF THE PROJECT
DIRECTOR AND IN COLLABORATION WITH OTHER TASK LEADS WHO WILL BE LEADING THE TECHNICAL METHODS DEVELOPMENT FOR WHICH
ANALYSIS MAY BE REQUIRED UNDER TASKS 9 AND 10.

subaward_description: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS INITIATIVE IS TO SUPPORT DATA CLEANING, CURATION, AND HARMONIZATION OF EXISTING NEUROPATHOLOGICAL DATA ASSOCIATED WITH ~8500 POST-MORTEM SUBJECTS WITH A CLINICAL DIAGNOSIS OF ALZHEIMER’S DISEASE AND ALZHEIMER’S DISEASE ASSOCIATED DEMENTIA (AD/ADRD), RELATED NEURODEGENERATIVE DISEASES AND UNAFFECTED CONTROLS (TARGET DATA SET) THAT ARE BANKED WITHIN THE NEUROBIOBANK (NBB) BIOREPOSITORY. THE EXPECTED OUTPUT OF THIS EFFORT IS (1) A HARMONIZED NEUROPATHOLOGICAL DATASET ASSOCIATED WITH NBB DONORS, AND (2) DATA STANDARDS AND COMMON DATA ELEMENTS THAT CAN BE ADOPTED BY THE BANKS FOR FUTURE NEUROPATHOLOGICAL TESTING AND REPORTING.

prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description: URINARY TRACT INFECTIONS (UTIS) ARE AN INCREASING CLINICAL PROBLEM, HAVING INCREASED BY 60% BETWEEN 1990 AND 2019 AND ACCOUNTING FOR 40% OF ALL NOSOCOMIAL INFECTIONS. APPROXIMATELY 65% OF COMPLICATED OR RECURRENT UTIS (RUTIS) ARE DUE TO UROPATHOGENIC E. COLI (UPEC), ALTHOUGH SEVERAL OTHER GRAM-NEGATIVE AND GRAM-POSITIVE PATHOGENS ARE ALSO IMPLICATED. CLARAMETYX BIOSCIENCES, INC. (CLARAMETYX) IS DEVELOPING A VACCINE CANDIDATE, CMTX-301, TO PREVENT RUTIS. CMTX-301 IS A PATHOGEN-AGNOSTIC VACCINE CANDIDATE FOR THE PREVENTION OF BACTERIAL BIOFILMS, A KEY COMPONENT OF MANY RECALCITRANT AND/OR RECURRENT BACTERIAL INFECTIONS, SUCH AS RUTIS. IMMUNIZATION WITH CMTX-301 FOCUSES THE HOST IMMUNE RESPONSE ON SPECIFIC PROTECTIVE EPITOPES WITHIN COMPONENTS OF THE BACTERIAL BIOFILM RESPONSIBLE FOR ITS STRUCTURAL STABILITY, THEREBY PREVENTING BIOFILM FORMATION. GIVEN THAT BIOFILMS ARE A SIGNIFICANT DEFENSE MECHANISM AGAINST DISEASE RESOLUTION, PREVENTING DEVELOPMENT OF THESE PROTECTIVE STRUCTURES SHOULD REDUCE DISEASE OCCURRENCE AND THUS PROVIDE SIGNIFICANT BENEFITS. . UNLIKE OTHER BACTERIAL VACCINES THAT TARGET SPECIFIC BACTERIAL SPECIES, CMTX-301 IMMUNIZATION TO PREVENT BACTERIAL BIOFILM FORMATION WILL ALLOW THE HOSTÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S NATURAL IMMUNE RESPONSE TO CLEAR INFECTION IN A PATHOGEN-AGNOSTIC MANNER. THE PROGRAM PROPOSED HEREIN WILL ESTABLISH PROOF-OF-CONCEPT PRECLINICAL STUDIES AGAINST RUTI DUE TO E. COLI , DEVELOP A LAB-SCALE MANUFACTURING PROCESS THAT CAN SCALE FOR NEED, AND SEEK FDA GUIDANCE ON THE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM TO ADVANCE CMTX-301 TO CLINICAL EVALUATION.

prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description: PNEUMONIA IS A COMMON CLINICAL DIAGNOSIS THAT OFTEN LACKS A MICROBIOLOGICAL DIAGNOSIS BECAUSE NO PATHOGEN IS IDENTIFIED. WITHOUT A MICROBIOLOGICAL DIAGNOSIS, ANTIBIOTICS TARGETING A BROAD RANGE OF PATHOGENS ARE USED, INCREASING THE RISKS FOR RESISTANCE ALONG WITH POOR OUTCOMES IF INAPPROPRIATE ANTIBIOTICS ARE CHOSEN. THIS RESEARCH PROGRAM PROPOSES TO DIAGNOSE LOWER RESPIRATORY TRACT BACTERIAL INFECTIONS AND THEIR ASSOCIATED ANTIMICROBIAL RESISTANCE IN FOUR HOURS, MUCH FASTER THAN CURRENT CULTURE TECHNIQUES. THE LONG-TERM GOAL OF THIS RESEARCH PROGRAM IS TO DEVELOP RAPID DIAGNOSTIC TESTS THAT WILL BE INDICATED IN ALL PATIENTS WITH A CLINICAL SUSPICION FOR PNEUMONIA. THE SHORT-TERM OBJECTIVE WILL FOCUS ON PNEUMONIAS CAUSED BY STAPHYLOCOCCUS AUREUS, PSEUDOMONAS AERUGINOSA, AND HAEMOPHILUS INFLUENZAE, WITH THE GOAL OF HAVING RESULTS AVAILABLE IN 4 HOURS. THE STRATEGY USED IN THIS DIAGNOSTIC TEST DISTINGUISHES IT FROM COMPETITORS AND ALTERNATIVES. THIS DIAGNOSTIC IS BASED ON DETECTING RNA SEQUENCE(S) SPECIFIC FOR THE PATHOGEN CAUSING PNEUMONIA IN A HUMAN PATIENT. TESTING WILL BE DONE ON BLOOD DRAWN DIRECTLY FROM THE PATIENT, MAKING IT LESS INVASIVE THAN OTHER METHODS THAT OBTAIN SAMPLES FROM THE AIRWAYS, SUCH AS BRONCHOSCOPY OR DEEP SUCTIONING. THIS TEST WILL NOT REQUIRE THE SPECIMEN TO BE CULTURED, ALLOWING FOR FASTER RESULTS THAN TRADITIONAL MICROBIOLOGICAL METHODS. THE RNA TARGETED BY THE TEST IS IDENTIFIED VIA RNA SEQUENCING OF BLOOD FROM PATIENTS WITH THE INFECTION. RNA SEQUENCING DATA SHOWS RNA SPECIFIC TO THE PATHOGEN OF INTEREST (S. AUREUS., P. AERUGINOSA, AND H. INFLUENZAE) THAT IS ALSO SPECIFIC FOR AN ACTIVE INFECTION. TARGETING RNA ALSO ENSURES THAT THE INFECTION IS CURRENT SINCE RNA IS LESS STABLE THAN DNA, LASTING MINUTES TO HOURS WHEN FROM A BACTERIUM. THE METHOD, HOWEVER, IMMEDIATELY STABILIZES THE RNA FOR TESTING. RNA ALSO IDENTIFIES BACTERIA THAT ARE ACTIVELY MAKING RESISTANCE PROTEINS, RATHER THAN BACTERIA WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR RESISTANCE BASED ONLY ON GENOMIC DNA. AT THE END OF THIS PROJECT, PCR BASED TESTS WILL BE CREATED THAT ARE INFORMED BY RNA SEQUENCING DATA. THESE WILL DIAGNOSE PNEUMONIA DUE TO S. AUREUS., P. AERUGINOSA, AND H. INFLUENZAE, ALONG WITH RELEVANT ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE, USING BLOOD FROM THE PATIENT. THIS PCR TESTING PLATFORM USES FDA-APPROVED INSTRUMENTATION TO FACILITATE TRANSITIONING FROM A RESEARCH LABORATORY TO A CLINICAL MICROBIOLOGY LABORATORY.

prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description: PNEUMONIA IS A COMMON CLINICAL DIAGNOSIS THAT OFTEN LACKS A MICROBIOLOGICAL DIAGNOSIS BECAUSE NO PATHOGEN IS IDENTIFIED. WITHOUT A MICROBIOLOGICAL DIAGNOSIS, ANTIBIOTICS TARGETING A BROAD RANGE OF PATHOGENS ARE USED, INCREASING THE RISKS FOR RESISTANCE ALONG WITH POOR OUTCOMES IF INAPPROPRIATE ANTIBIOTICS ARE CHOSEN. THIS RESEARCH PROGRAM PROPOSES TO DIAGNOSE LOWER RESPIRATORY TRACT BACTERIAL INFECTIONS AND THEIR ASSOCIATED ANTIMICROBIAL RESISTANCE IN FOUR HOURS, MUCH FASTER THAN CURRENT CULTURE TECHNIQUES. THE LONG-TERM GOAL OF THIS RESEARCH PROGRAM IS TO DEVELOP RAPID DIAGNOSTIC TESTS THAT WILL BE INDICATED IN ALL PATIENTS WITH A CLINICAL SUSPICION FOR PNEUMONIA. THE SHORT-TERM OBJECTIVE WILL FOCUS ON PNEUMONIAS CAUSED BY STAPHYLOCOCCUS AUREUS, PSEUDOMONAS AERUGINOSA, AND HAEMOPHILUS INFLUENZAE, WITH THE GOAL OF HAVING RESULTS AVAILABLE IN 4 HOURS. THE STRATEGY USED IN THIS DIAGNOSTIC TEST DISTINGUISHES IT FROM COMPETITORS AND ALTERNATIVES. THIS DIAGNOSTIC IS BASED ON DETECTING RNA SEQUENCE(S) SPECIFIC FOR THE PATHOGEN CAUSING PNEUMONIA IN A HUMAN PATIENT. TESTING WILL BE DONE ON BLOOD DRAWN DIRECTLY FROM THE PATIENT, MAKING IT LESS INVASIVE THAN OTHER METHODS THAT OBTAIN SAMPLES FROM THE AIRWAYS, SUCH AS BRONCHOSCOPY OR DEEP SUCTIONING. THIS TEST WILL NOT REQUIRE THE SPECIMEN TO BE CULTURED, ALLOWING FOR FASTER RESULTS THAN TRADITIONAL MICROBIOLOGICAL METHODS. THE RNA TARGETED BY THE TEST IS IDENTIFIED VIA RNA SEQUENCING OF BLOOD FROM PATIENTS WITH THE INFECTION. RNA SEQUENCING DATA SHOWS RNA SPECIFIC TO THE PATHOGEN OF INTEREST (S. AUREUS., P. AERUGINOSA, AND H. INFLUENZAE) THAT IS ALSO SPECIFIC FOR AN ACTIVE INFECTION. TARGETING RNA ALSO ENSURES THAT THE INFECTION IS CURRENT SINCE RNA IS LESS STABLE THAN DNA, LASTING MINUTES TO HOURS WHEN FROM A BACTERIUM. THE METHOD, HOWEVER, IMMEDIATELY STABILIZES THE RNA FOR TESTING. RNA ALSO IDENTIFIES BACTERIA THAT ARE ACTIVELY MAKING RESISTANCE PROTEINS, RATHER THAN BACTERIA WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR RESISTANCE BASED ONLY ON GENOMIC DNA. AT THE END OF THIS PROJECT, PCR BASED TESTS WILL BE CREATED THAT ARE INFORMED BY RNA SEQUENCING DATA. THESE WILL DIAGNOSE PNEUMONIA DUE TO S. AUREUS., P. AERUGINOSA, AND H. INFLUENZAE, ALONG WITH RELEVANT ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE, USING BLOOD FROM THE PATIENT. THIS PCR TESTING PLATFORM USES FDA-APPROVED INSTRUMENTATION TO FACILITATE TRANSITIONING FROM A RESEARCH LABORATORY TO A CLINICAL MICROBIOLOGY LABORATORY.

prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description: PEARL DIAGNOSTICS INC. (PEARLDX) DEVELOPS NOVEL IN VITRO DIAGNOSTIC (IVD) TESTS THAT AID NON-INVASIVE DIAGNOSIS OF LIFE-THREATENING LUNG INFECTIONS. PEARLDXÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S TECHNOLOGY LEVERAGES THE DISCOVERY THAT MICROBIAL EXTRACELLULAR VESICLES (EVS) RELEASED FROM ORGANISMS GROWING IN THE LUNGS ARE EXCRETED IN URINE. IDENTIFICATION OF SPECIFIC LUNG PATHOGENS SUCH AS PSEUDOMONAS AERUGINOSA (PSA) AS A CAUSE OF PNEUMONIA IS CRITICAL IN MITIGATING THE IMPACT OF ANTIMICROBIAL DRUG RESISTANCE. WHILE A LESS COMMON CAUSE OF COMMUNITY-ACQUIRED PNEUMONIA (CAP), THIS GRAM-NEGATIVE ROD (GNR) IS INTRINSICALLY RESISTANT TO SEVERAL ANTIBIOTIC CLASSES, INCLUDING B-LACTAMS, AND EXHIBITS FREQUENT MULTIDRUG RESISTANCE (MDR). THE PREVALENCE OF PSA IN CAP IS REPORTED AS VARIABLE, RANGING FROM 0 TO 23%, WITH A POOLED PREVALENCE OF 8.6% IN PEOPLE WITH IDENTIFIED RISKS FOR MDR INFECTIONS. IDENTIFICATION OF PSA IN CULTURES ENABLES SUSCEPTIBILITY TESTING AND TAILORING OF EMPIRIC THERAPY FOR BOTH CAP AND HOSPITAL- AND VENTILATOR-ACQUIRED PNEUMONIA (HAP, VAP) IN HIGH-RISK PATIENTS. HOWEVER, THIS FREQUENTLY REQUIRES BAL SAMPLING AND CULTURE YIELD IS VARIABLE. IDENTIFICATION OF THE ORGANISM IS NOT AN ASSURANCE OF ACUTE DISEASE ETIOLOGY, AS COLONIZATION IS COMMON IN PEOPLE WITH POOR AIRWAY CLEARANCE, SUCH AS IN THOSE WITH BRONCHIECTASIS AND CYSTIC FIBROSIS (CF). VARIABLE PERFORMANCE, NON-SPECIFICITY OF CLINICAL FINDINGS, RELIANCE ON INVASIVE SAMPLING, AND TIME TO CULTURE DRIVE A HIGH AMOUNT OF ANTIBIOTIC EMPIRICISM, ULTIMATELY GENERATING AND PROPAGATING ANTIMICROBIAL RESISTANCE (AMR). PEARLDXÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S PRODUCTS PROVIDE ADVANTAGES WITH REGARD TO ACCESS (REFERENCE LABS VS. LOW-RESOURCE SETTINGS), COSTS (> $2000/TEST VS. < $20), AND TIME TO RESULT (3-5 DAYS VS. < 2 HR.). OTHER TECHNOLOGIES TYPICALLY RELY ON LARGE INSTRUMENTS AND/OR REFERENCE TESTING. THEREFORE, THERE REMAIN CRITICAL UNMET NEEDS AND OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE PATIENT OUTCOMES WITH EASIER-TO-DEPLOY, LESS EXPENSIVE IVDS USING URINE AS AN ADJUNCT DIAGNOSTIC AID FOR PNEUMONIA. THE AVAILABILITY OF ADJUNCTIVE NON-CULTURE-BASED TESTS (NCBT) TO AID IN THE DIAGNOSIS OF PNEUMONIA IS A LONG-APPRECIATED PRIORITY. PEARLDX, WITH SUPPORT FROM CARB-X, INTENDS TO DEVELOP A LOW-COST, LOW TURNAROUND TIME (TAT) URINE ASSAY FOR THE DETECTION OF PSEUDOMONAS PNEUMONIA (PMA). THE INITIAL AIM OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A PROTOTYPE ASSAY. ALL ASSAYS DEVELOPED BY PEARLDX, INCLUDING THE PROPOSED CARB-X-SUPPORTED PSA ASSAY, ARE ADVANCED USING CLINICAL SAMPLES FROM PATIENTS, WITH ITERATIVE IMPROVEMENTS OF THE ASSAY INFORMED BY THE CHARACTERIZATION OF URINARY ANTIGENS AND BY REDUCING MATRIX INTERFERENCE.

prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description: AMICIDIN-BETA IS A LARGE MOLECULE BIOLOGICAL THERAPEUTIC (SINGLE CHAIN AMINO ACID POLYMER) WITH A DUAL MODE OF ACTION Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ SURFACTANT AND MICROBICIDE. IT IS DESIGNED FOR LOCAL APPLICATION ON CONTAMINATED AND INFECTED TISSUES TO STOP INFECTION EARLY, BEFORE IT BECOMES LIFE-THREATENING. THE SURFACTANT ACTIVITY ENHANCES TISSUE CLEANSING AND HAS BEEN DEMONSTRATED BY MULTIPLE ASSAYS IN VITRO. THE MICROBICIDAL ACTIVITY IS BROAD SPECTRUM Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ EFFECTIVE AGAINST GRAM-POSITIVE AND GRAM-NEGATIVE BACTERIA, AS WELL AS YEAST. CLINICALLY IMPORTANT PATHOGENS SENSITIVE TO AMICIDIN-BETA INCLUDE MRSA, STAPHYLOCOCCUS EPIDERMIDIS, STREPTOCOCCUS PYOGENES, PSEUDOMONAS AERUGINOSA, KLEBSIELLA SPP., AND E. COLI (INCLUDING ANTIBIOTIC- AND MULTIDRUG-RESISTANT STRAINS). AMICIDIN-BETA HAS ALSO BEEN SHOWN TO WORK WELL IN VITRO AND/OR IN VIVO WITH LOW-COST SYSTEMIC ANTIBIOTICS, INCLUDING CEFAZOLIN, CEFTRIAXONE, AND VANCOMYCIN. AMICIDIN-BETA/EF IS A PRODUCT FEATURING AMICIDIN-BETA THAT IS DESIGNED FOR DIRECT, LOCAL APPLICATION TO CONTAMINATED TISSUES TO PREVENT INFECTION, ESPECIALLY IN EMERGENCY SETTINGS. IT IS INTENDED FOR USE ON TRAUMATIC WOUNDS AND HIGH-RISK SURGICAL SITES, INCLUDING THOSE REQUIRING EXTENDED TISSUE COVERAGE. IN ADDITION, IT IS FORMULATED FOR VERSATILE APPLICATION Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ EITHER AS A LIQUID OR FOAM Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ FOR BETTER COATING OF DIFFERENT SURFACE GEOMETRIES RANGING FROM LARGE FLAT SURFACES (E.G., SCRAPES, BURNS) TO CAVITIES (E.G., SINUSES, UTERUS). BOTH TISSUE COVERAGE AND CAVITY FILLING PROPERTIES HAVE BEEN SHOWN IN VITRO. AMICIDIN-BETA/EF HAS DEMONSTRATED PRECLINICAL PROOF-OF-CONCEPT WITH MULTI-LOG REDUCTION IN MICROBIAL BURDEN IN A PORCINE MODEL WITH CONTAMINATED SURGICAL INCISIONS AND A RODENT WOUND MODEL WITH SURGICAL MESH IMPLANT. AMICIDIN-BETA/EF IS EXPECTED TO FIND SUBSTANTIAL USE IN EMERGENCY SETTINGS IN HIGH-INCOME COUNTRIES, AS WELL AS IN LOW- AND MIDDLE-INCOME COUNTRIES. IT WOULD LIKELY BE USED FREQUENTLY IN CONTAMINATED TRAUMATIC INJURIES, INCLUDING PIERCING WOUNDS, OPEN TIBIAL FRACTURES, AND OTHERS. AS NOTED ABOVE, IT IS ALSO ANTICIPATED THAT AMICIDIN-BETA/EF WOULD FIND IMPORTANT USES IN CERTAIN HIGH-RISK SURGICAL PROCEDURES, INCLUDING EMERGENCY CAESAREAN DELIVERY, WHERE ITS FOAMING CAPACITY WOULD BE ESPECIALLY USEFUL IN FILLING A UTERINE CAVITY AFTER DELIVERY. THE PRESENT PROGRAM IS FOCUSED ON COMPLETING IND-ENABLING PRECLINICAL DEVELOPMENT AND REGULATORY FILINGS IN ANTICIPATION OF CLINICAL DEVELOPMENT. THIS INCLUDES (1) PERFORMANCE OF NONCLINICAL PHARMACOLOGY AND GLP SAFETY; (2) DEVELOP AMICIDIN-BETA/EF PACKAGING, INCLUDING SHELF STABILITY STUDIES; AND (3) PREPARE FOR PHASE 1/2A CLINICAL TRIAL. AS PART OF THIS WORK, WE ALSO INTEND TO PERFORM COMPARATIVE STUDIES WITH AMICIDIN-BETA/EF PREPARATIONS OF INCREASING CONCENTRATION OF AMICIDIN-BETA. AN EFFECTIVE, LOCALLY APPLIED PRODUCT THAT STOPS INFECTION EARLY (EVEN BEFORE IT STARTS) WOULD BE VERY BENEFICIAL, ESPECIALLY IN EMERGENCY SETTINGS. INDIVIDUAL LIVES COULD BE SAVED, AND THE RISING TIDE OF ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE COULD BE SLOWED. THE ABILITY TO RAPIDLY COVER LARGE TISSUE SURFACES AND FILL CAVITIES IS ESSENTIAL. AMICIDIN-BETA/EF IS DESIGNED TO MEET THESE NEEDS.

subaward_description: THE KEY GOALS OF THIS PROGRAM ARE TO DEMONSTRATE DETECTION OF GONORRHEA FROM CRUDE VAGINAL SWAB AND URINE SAMPLES AND DEMONSTRATE PROOF-OF-FEASIBILITY FOR THE STI SCOUT, A PRODUCT INTENDED FOR AT HOME AND POINT-OF-NEED TESTING FOR GONORRHEA AND CHLAMYDIA. THE TARGET PATHOGENS ARE NEISSERIA GONORRHOEAE AND CHLAMYDIA TRACHOMATIS. THE KEY CLINICAL INDICATIONS ARE SYMPTOMATIC AND ASYMPTOMATIC INFECTIONS OR SUSPECTED INFECTIONS OF THE UROGENITAL TRACT BY CHLAMYDIA OR GONORRHEA, THE TWO MOST COMMON, TREATABLE SEXUALLY TRANSMITTED INFECTIONS IN THE UNITED STATES. SCOUT IS TARGETING DIFFERENTIATION AGAINST OTHER APPROACHES BY OFFERING PCR-LEVEL ACCURACY WITH THE CONVENIENCE AND COST OF RAPID ANTIGEN TESTING. UNLIKE COLLECT-AT-HOME AND SEND-IN TESTING OPTIONS, STI SCOUT DELIVERS RESULTS IMMEDIATELY TO THE USER (WITHIN 30 MINUTES). THE SCOUT HUB IS A REUSABLE DEVICE THAT ENABLES TESTING FOR MULTIPLE INDICATIONS, NOT JUST STIS, ADDING A VALUABLE TOOL TO INDIVIDUALSÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢ OR CLINICSÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢ TOOLKIT FOR DIAGNOSING COMMON, TREATABLE ILLNESSES OR INFORMING ON OVERALL WELLNESS. A MOBILE APPLICATION, SCOUT CONNECT, PERMITS RESULT TRACKING, SHARING, AND FOLLOW-ON CARE VIA TELEHEALTH AND E-PRESCRIPTIONS FROM QUALIFIED HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS. A PLANNED REFLEX TEST FOR NG AMR WILL ENABLE BETTER STEWARDSHIP OF ANTIBIOTICS.

subaward_description: MELIO IS COMMITTED TO REVOLUTIONIZING THE HEALTHCARE INDUSTRY BY OFFERING RAPID INFECTIOUS DISEASE DIAGNOSTIC SOLUTIONS. BY REDEFINING STANDARDS OF CARE, MELIO AIMS TO DRIVE A SHIFT TOWARD PRECISION HEALTHCARE, EMPOWERING CLINICIANS TO MAKE INFORMED, TIMELY DECISIONS FOR TREATMENT FOR INFECTIONS, REDUCING HEALTHCARE COSTS, AND THE OVERPRESCRIPTION OF ANTIBIOTICS. MELIOÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S FIRST PRODUCT FOCUSES ON PROVIDING A BREAKTHROUGH IN BOTH SPEED AND PATHOGEN COVERAGE FOR DIAGNOSING BLOOD STREAM INFECTIONS DIRECTLY FROM A PATIENTÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S BLOOD SAMPLE FOR NEONATES. UNLIKE THE STANDARD CULTURE METHOD, WHICH SERVES AS A BOTTLENECK BY TAKING DAYS TO DELIVER RESULTS, MELIOÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S TECHNOLOGY OFFERS AN EXPEDITED ALTERNATIVE THAT COULD TRANSFORM PATIENT CARE.

subaward_description: MELIO IS COMMITTED TO REVOLUTIONIZING THE HEALTHCARE INDUSTRY BY OFFERING RAPID INFECTIOUS DISEASE DIAGNOSTIC SOLUTIONS. BY REDEFINING STANDARDS OF CARE, MELIO AIMS TO DRIVE A SHIFT TOWARD PRECISION HEALTHCARE, EMPOWERING CLINICIANS TO MAKE INFORMED, TIMELY DECISIONS FOR TREATMENT FOR INFECTIONS, REDUCING HEALTHCARE COSTS, AND THE OVERPRESCRIPTION OF ANTIBIOTICS. MELIOÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S FIRST PRODUCT FOCUSES ON PROVIDING A BREAKTHROUGH IN BOTH SPEED AND PATHOGEN COVERAGE FOR DIAGNOSING BLOOD STREAM INFECTIONS DIRECTLY FROM A PATIENTÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S BLOOD SAMPLE FOR NEONATES. UNLIKE THE STANDARD CULTURE METHOD, WHICH SERVES AS A BOTTLENECK BY TAKING DAYS TO DELIVER RESULTS, MELIOÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S TECHNOLOGY OFFERS AN EXPEDITED ALTERNATIVE THAT COULD TRANSFORM PATIENT CARE.

subaward_description:
5.	DESCRIPTION OF TASKS
THE SUBCONTRACTOR SHALL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING TASKS UNDER THIS PWS, AS REQUESTED BY BRYCETECH.

NOTE, BASED UPON APPROVAL BY THE CONTRACTING OFFICER (CO), THE CONTRACTOR WILL IDENTIFY CERTAIN DELIVERABLES APPROPRIATE FOR EXTERNAL- RELEASE AND PURSUE THE RELEVANT PROCEDURES, TO MAKE PUBLICLY AVAILABLE HIGH-IMPACT PRODUCTS FOR KEY STAKEHOLDERS. ANY AND ALL CONTRACTUAL CHANGES SHALL BE PRESENTED TO BRYCETECH FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO THE IMPLEMENTATION OF ANY CONTRACTUAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

5.1	ENVIRONMENTAL LANDSCAPE ANALYSIS OF CURRENT INDUSTRY CAPACITIES AND SPEND- THE CONTRACTOR IS THE LEAD FOR THIS TASK.
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL CONDUCT A LANDSCAPE ANALYSIS OF FIVE (CRITICAL MEDICAL EQUIPMENT, ENABLING INNOVATION AND TECHNOLOGY, AND TESTING AND DIAGNOSTICS DOMAINS) THREE IBMSC PROGRAM DOMAINS -- ADVANCED MANUFACTURING, TESTING & DIAGNOSTICS, AND PPE & MEDICAL DURABLE EQUIPMENT Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ IN INDUSTRY CAPACITIES AND GOVERNMENT AND COMMERCIAL MARKETS.  THE LANDSCAPE WILL CAPTURE PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS FOR HEALTH THREAT SCENARIOS BASED ON CURRENT GOVERNMENT DOCUMENTATION AS WELL AS NON- EMERGENCY SOURCES OF PHIB PRODUCT DEMAND. ANALYSIS WILL INCLUDE GOVERNMENT SPENDING TO EXPAND OR SUSTAIN PHIB CAPACITY NECESSARY FOR HEALTH EMERGENCIES AND STOCKPILING OF PRODUCTS BY THE STRATEGIC NATIONAL STOCKPILE. THE LANDSCAPE WILL ALSO CAPTURE CURRENT AND EMERGING PHIB DESIGN METHODS AND TECHNOLOGIES AND THE MATERIALS NEEDED TO PRODUCE DOMAIN PRODUCTS. ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:

5.1.1	DEFINING PRODUCT DOMAIN REQUIREMENTS BASED ON EXISTING GOVERNMENT THREAT ASSESSMENTS AND THE COMMERCIAL AND GOVERNMENT PRODUCT DELIVERY NEEDS FOR EACH THREAT SCENARIO.
5.1.2	CHARACTERIZING AND ANALYZING OF DOMESTIC AND INTERNATIONAL MARKETS FOR EACH DOMAIN, INCLUDING SEGMENTING DOMESTIC GOVERNMENT AND COMMERCIAL MARKETS. THIS CHARACTERIZATION SHOULD INCLUDE PRODUCTION CAPACITY, COST TO MANUFACTURE, CURRENT MANUFACTURERS, AND CURRENT PRICING. IT WILL ALSO INCLUDE MARKETS DURING NON-EMERGENCY SCENARIOS AND EMERGENCY SCENARIOS ADDRESSING SUPPLY CHAIN RESILIENCY AND VULNERABILITY ASSESSMENTS.

5.1.3	CAPTURING DOMESTIC AND GLOBAL INDUSTRY CAPACITY THE PRODUCT DOMAINS TO MEET NON- EMERGENCY AND EMERGENCY SCENARIO NEEDS, INCLUDING STEADY STATE VERSUS SURGE VERSUS FLUCTUATING NEEDS THROUGHOUT A HAZARD SCENARIO.
5.1.4	MAPPING THE SUPPLY CHAINS OF PRODUCT DOMAINS FOR KEY PLAYERS Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ INCLUDING GENESIS OF RAW MATERIALS, ANY AREAS OF HIGH DEPENDENCE.

5.1.5	BASED ON MARKET AND CAPACITY ANALYSIS, IDENTIFYING AND VALIDATING PRODUCT DOMAIN REQUIREMENTS FOR TOTAL SUPPLY AS WELL AS GOVERNMENT VS. PRIVATE SECTOR SUPPLY REQUIREMENTS.

5.1.6	PERFORMING AN ECONOMIC ASSESSMENT OF PHIB FOR EACH PRODUCT DOMAIN, INCLUDING FINANCIAL PERFORMANCE, BUSINESS RISKS, AND KEY DEPENDENCIES.

5.1.7	EVALUATING CURRENT GOVERNMENT INVESTMENTS AND INCENTIVES FOR PRODUCT DOMAINS PRODUCTION CAPACITY AND ACQUISITION AND PROCUREMENT, INCLUDING PROCUREMENT ACROSS AGENCIES.
5.1.8	ANALYZING OF PRODUCT DOMAIN OPPORTUNITIES FOR SHELF-LIFE EXTENSION, REPEATED USE, AND OTHER OPTIONS TO REDUCE TOTAL REQUIREMENTS (E.G., DESIGN FACTORS, ETC.) ADDRESSING ANY SIGNIFICANT SUPPLY CHAIN VULNERABILITIES.

5.1.9	CHARACTERIZING DOMAIN SUPPLY CHAINS, INCLUDING CORE MATERIALS NEEDED, WORKFORCE AVAILABILITY, AND OTHER CORE DEPENDENCIES FOR PRODUCTION, STORAGE, AND DISTRIBUTION.

5.1.10	IDENTIFYING NEAR-TERM AND EMERGING TRENDS IN MATERIALS, DESIGN, AND USE THAT COULD BE APPLIED TO REDUCE COSTS OR REQUIREMENTS.

5.1.11	ENVIRONMENTAL LANDSCAPE ANALYSIS OF CURRENT INDUSTRY CAPACITIES AND SPEND DELIVERABLES

5.1.11.1	AS-IS LANDSCAPE REPORT BY DOMAIN REPORT INCLUDING THE CURRENT MARKET, MANUFACTURING CAPACITY, AND PRODUCT CHARACTERISTICS, AS WELL AS IDENTIFICATION OF LARGEST AREAS OF DEPENDENCY AND POTENTIAL RISK.

5.1.11.1.1	IDENTIFY DOMESTIC MARKET VULNERABILITIES, SPECIFICALLY THOSE RELATED TO THE COST OF SUSTAINMENT, DOMESTIC PRODUCT PRICING, MARKET VOLATILITY AND FOREIGN COMPETITION, IN

subaward_description:
LCATS AND TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL CONDUCT RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION EFFORTS TO PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL SUPPORT WITHIN BARDA
PROGRAM OFFICE(S) AS ADVANCED SCIENTIFIC SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS IN RELEVANT FIELD OF EXPERIENCE(S) WITHIN THE
BARDAÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S R&D AND AR&D MISSION SPACE, INCLUDING COVID, EID, PI, MANUFACTURING, AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE.
DESIRED CANDIDATES ARE REQUIRED TO MEET OUTLINED QUALIFICATIONS AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE; APPLICATION OF ADVANCE
DEGREES(S) IN PROGRAM OR SIMILAR FIELD(S) WITH COMMENSURATE EXPERIENCE(S) PROGRAM FILED.
INDEPENDENTLY, AND NOT AS AN AGENT OF THE GOVERNMENT, THE CONTRACTOR SHALL EXERT ITS BEST EFFORT TO FURNISH ALL THE
NECESSARY SERVICES AND QUALIFIED PERSONNEL (NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED BY THE GOVERNMENT) UNDER THE TERMS OF THE
OVERARCHING CONTRACT AND AS NEEDED TO PERFORM THE WORK SET FORTH BELOW. SUPPORT WILL BE RELATED, BUT NOT LIMITED TO,
THE FOLLOWING AREAS:
ANALYST II
PROJECT ANALYST / MANAGER (I)
TIER 2
GENERAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· PROVIDE SCIENTIFIC PROGRAMMATIC & TECHNICAL EXPERTISE, CONTRACT MANAGEMENT AND ACQUISITION SUPPORT TO
BARDA FOR THE EXECUTION OF MULTIPLE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· DEVELOP PROGRAM PLANS, STRATEGIES AND BUDGETS. ASSIST IN MANAGING PROGRAM PORTFOLIOS AND PROVIDING
OVERSIGHT ON PROJECTS AND PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT TO ENSURE ALL REQUIREMENTS ARE ADDRESSED.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· ANALYZE AND EVALUATE PROGRAMS, PROPOSALS AND PLANS, AND PROGRAM METRICS FOR TECHNICAL AND PROGRAMMATIC
MERIT, AS WELL AS TO IDENTIFY RISKS, MITIGATION STRATEGIES AND POTENTIAL AREAS OF IMPROVEMENTS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· ASSIST WITH THE VISION, DESIGN, ACQUISITION AND EXECUTION OF PROGRAMS IN SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNMENT
PROGRAM DIRECTOR(S).
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· COORDINATE AND INTEGRATE AMONGST GOVERNMENT DIRECTORS AND POTENTIAL STAKEHOLDERS, INTERAGENCY PARTNERS
AND USER COMMUNITIES REGARDING AREAS OF COLLABORATION, NEEDS, EMERGING INDUSTRIAL AND ACADEMIC
CAPABILITIES AND TECHNOLOGIES, IDENTIFY AND REVIEW EMERGING REQUIREMENTS AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRANSITION OF
SELECTED TECHNOLOGY PROGRAMS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· ASSIST IN LEADING TECHNICAL DISCUSSIONS WITH GOVERNMENT AND INDUSTRY REGARDING PROGRAM CONCEPTS, FUNDED
PROJECTS, STRATEGIES AND TRANSITION CONCEPTS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· IDENTIFY, EVALUATE AND ACCELERATE INNOVATIVE PROJECTS TO ADVANCE BARDA INITIATIVES.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· ASSIST IN LEADING PROGRAM OVERSIGHT FROM INCEPTION OF PROJECTS THROUGH TRANSITION WITH ATTENTION ON
PROGRAMMATIC METRICS AND MILESTONES (COST, SCHEDULE AND ADHERENCE TO CONTRACTUAL REQUIREMENTS) DEVELOP
AND MANAGE PROGRAM PLANS AND FINANCIAL TOOLS TO PROVIDE APPROPRIATE OVERSIGHT TO A NUMBER OF PROGRAMS
AND BUDGETS IN A PORTFOLIO.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· ANALYZE AND EVALUATE PROGRAMS, PLANS, AND METRICS TO ALIGN WITH MISSION AND PROGRAM GOALS. ABLE TO
IDENTIFY PROGRAM RISKS AND PROBLEMS AND ASSIST WITH MITIGATION STRATEGIES. ASSIST WITH THE DESIGN,
PROCUREMENT, AND EXECUTION OF PROGRAMS IN SUPPORT OF THE GOVERNMENT PROGRAM DIRECTOR(S).
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· COORDINATE AMONGST GOVERNMENT PROGRAM DIRECTORS, STAKEHOLDERS, INTERAGENCY PARTNERS AND POTENTIAL USER
COMMUNITIES. IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES AND ASSIST WITH TRANSITION OF SELECTED PROGRAMS. PROVIDE CONTRACT
MANAGEMENT AND ACQUISITION SUPPORT TO PROGRAM ASSIST IN DEVELOPMENT AND EDITING OF VARIOUS DOCUMENTS
AND BRIEFINGS. ORGANIZE, COORDINATE AND HOST TECHNICAL MEETINGS, WORKSHOPS, ETC.
QUALIFICATIONS AND PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL POSSESS A MINIMUM OF 2 YEARS OF INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE RELATED TO SUPPORTING ADVANCED RESEARCH
AND DEVELOPMENT. (DESIRED: BACHELORÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S DEGREE OR HIGHER IN BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION/MANAGEMENT, PUBLIC
ADMINISTRATION, CONTRACTING/ACQUISITION OR POLITICAL, BIOLOGICAL, OR CHEMICAL SCIENCES PHYSICS, ENGINEERING, OR A
RELATED DISCIPLINE.
PREFERRED:
Ã¢Â€”Ï¿½ STRONG ORGANIZATIONAL SKILLS (E.G., TIME MANAGEMENT, COMMUNICATION, SETTING GOALS, DELEGATION, WORKING UNDER
PRESSURE, SELF-MOTIVATION, ANALYTICAL THINKING, AND ATTENTION TO DETAIL).
Ã¢Â€”Ï¿½ PROFICIENCY IN WRITTEN AND ORAL COMMUNICATIONS.
Ã¢Â€”Ï¿½ PROFICIENCY IN PLANNING AND ANALYSIS.Ã¢Â€”Ï¿½ EXPERIENCE FACILITATING COLLABORATION ACR

subaward_description:
OBJECTIVE:
THE OBJECTIVE IS TO ACQUIRE STAFFING SUPPORT SERVICES FOR ASPR/CA/OHR PER THE INDEFINITE DELIVERY
INDEFINITE QUANTITY (IDIQ) CONTRACT.
SCOPE OF WORK
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL STAFFING SERVICES TO SUPPORT THE TASKS AND MISSION REQUIREMENTS
FOR ASPR/CA/OHR IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POSITION REQUIREMENTS OUTLINED IN THIS STATEMENT OF WORK.
APPLICABLE DOCUMENTS
THE ASPR PTMSS IDIQ CONTRACT AND ALL RELATED MODIFICATIONS.
LCAT POSITION DESCRIPTIONS
THE SUBCONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE ALL LABOR, MATERIALS, AND SUPERVISION TO PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL STAFFING
SERVICES SUPPORT FOR THE ASPR/CA/OHR.
STAFFING SPECIALIST
SUPPORT LOCATION: ASPR CA OHR
POSITION TYPE: ONSITE CONTRACTOR, REQUIRES ONBOARDING AND ISSUANCE OF GFE/GFI
EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATION:
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· BACHELORÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S DEGREE REQUIRED AND 4-6 YEARS STAFFING SPECIALIST TYPE EXPERIENCE.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· EXPERIENCE WITH RELEVANT ATS PROGRAMS AND MS OFFICE.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· EXPERIENCE AND COMFORT WITH PROFESSIONAL PHONE CONVERSATIONS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· STRONG ORGANIZATIONAL SKILLS THAT REFLECT THE ABILITY TO PERFORM AND PRIORITIZE MULTIPLE TASKS
SEAMLESSLY WITH EXCELLENT ATTENTION TO DETAIL.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· VERY STRONG INTERPERSONAL SKILLS AND THE ABILITY TO BUILD RELATIONSHIPS WITH STAKEHOLDERS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· EXPERT LEVEL WRITTEN AND VERBAL COMMUNICATION SKILLS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· DEMONSTRATED PROACTIVE APPROACHES TO PROBLEM-SOLVING WITH STRONG DECISION-MAKING CAPABILITY.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· EMOTIONAL MATURITY.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· HIGHLY RESOURCEFUL TEAM-PLAYER, WITH THE ABILITY TO ALSO BE EXTREMELY EFFECTIVE INDEPENDENTLY.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· PROVEN ABILITY TO HANDLE CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION WITH DISCRETION, BE ADAPTABLE TO VARIOUS
COMPETING DEMANDS AND DEMONSTRATE THE HIGHEST LEVEL OF CUSTOMER/CLIENT SERVICE AND RESPONSE.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· DEMONSTRATED ABILITY TO ACHIEVE HIGH PERFORMANCE GOALS AND MEET DEADLINES IN A FAST-PACED
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· ENVIRONMENT.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· FORWARD LOOKING THINKER, WHO ACTIVELY SEEKS OPPORTUNITIES AND PROPOSE SOLUTIONS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· EXPERT LEVEL MICROSOFT OFFICE, MICROSOFT VISIO, AND ADOBE ACROBAT SKILLS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· SUPERIOR TIME MANAGEMENT SKILL.
OVERALL DUTIES AND DELIVERABLES:
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· PROVIDE HUMAN CAPITAL SUPPORT.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· PRODUCE INFORMATION BY TRANSCRIBING, FORMATTING, INPUTTING, EDITING, RETRIEVING, COPYING, AND
TRANSMITTING TEXT, DATA, AND GRAPHICS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· CONSERVE LEADERSÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢ TIME BY READING, RESEARCHING, AND ROUTING CORRESPONDENCE; DRAFTING LETTERS AND
DOCUMENTS; COLLECTING AND ANALYZING INFORMATION; INITIATING TELECOMMUNICATIONS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· ASSIST WITH MAINTAINING LEADERSÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢ APPOINTMENT SCHEDULE BY PLANNING AND SCHEDULING MEETINGS,
CONFERENCES, TELECONFERENCES, AND TRAVEL.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· MAINTAIN CUSTOMER CONFIDENCE AND PROTECT OPERATIONS BY KEEPING INFORMATION CONFIDENTIAL.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· COMPLETE PROJECTS ASSIGNED BY LEADERS ON OR AHEAD OF SCHEDULE.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· PREPARE REPORTS BY COLLECTING AND ANALYZING INFORMATION.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· PROVIDE HISTORICAL REFERENCE BY DEVELOPING AND UTILIZING FILING AND RETRIEVAL SYSTEMS AND RECORDING
MEETING DISCUSSIONS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· TRACK MEETING ACTIONS AND ASSIST LEADERS WITH ASSIGNING ACTIONS TO APPROPRIATE SME.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· MAINTAIN DIVISION MEETING TRACKING SHEET TO ENSURE ALL MEETING REQUESTS ARE FULFILLED FOR LEADERS
AND THE DIVISION.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· PRIORITIZE CONFLICTING NEEDS; HANDLE MATTERS EXPEDITIOUSLY, PROACTIVELY, AND FOLLOWS THROUGH ON
PROJECTS TO SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION, OFTEN WITH DEADLINE PRESSURES.SPECIFIC TASKS AND SYSTEMS
1. OHR PAYROLL HELPDESK
A. SERVING AS LIAISON BETWEEN ASPR EMPLOYEES AND PSC, PAYROLL DIVISION, CONCERNING ISSUES OF
PAY AND TIME AND ATTENDANCE.
B. PERFORMING LEAVE AUDITS; CERTIFYING NEGATIVE LEAVE BALANCES WHEN EMPLOYEES SEPARATE.
C. SERVING AS LIAISON WITH THE PAYROLL PROVIDER ON SALARY AND LEAVE ISSUES.
D. IDENTIFYING AND RESOLVING SALARY PROBLEMS RELATED TO PAYROLL OPERATIONS.
E. SERVING AS LIAISON WITH DFAS FOR CORRECTING ERRORS IN TIME AND ATTENDANCE DATA ENTRY AND FOR
SPECIAL PAYROLL PROCESSING (E.G., GARNISHMENTS, RETROACTIVE ADJUSTMENTS, RESTORATION OF FORFEITED
ANNUAL LEAVE AND OPEN SEASON CHANGES).
F. PROVIDING TIMELY GUIDANCE TO ASPR EMPLOYEES ON CHANGES AFFECTING PAY.
G. PROVIDE POLICY CHANGE INFORMATION TO ASPR WHERE PAY IS CONCERNED.
H. IMMEDIATELY REQUEST ACCESS

prime_award_base_transaction_description: BAA TOPIC 9.1 PROSPECTIVE OBSERVATIONAL COHORT STUDY TO ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SARS COV-2 VACCINES
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT NANOTECHNOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_business_types: U.S. LOCAL GOVERNMENT,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
"UNDER THE LEADERSHIP OF CO-PI DR. CHU, THE UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON (UW) STUDY TEAM WILL 
EXECUTE THIS STUDY IN COLLABORATION WITH PRIME RECIPIENT AND CO-PI DR. NALEWAYÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S TEAM AT THE 
KAISER PERMANENTE CENTER FOR HEALTH RESEARCH (KPCHR). 
ESTABLISH A COMMON PROTOCOL
IN COLLABORATION WITH KPCHR, CDC AND OTHER SITES (IF RELEVANT), ESTABLISH A COMMON PROTOCOL FOR 
THIS PROSPECTIVE COHORT STUDY. THE COMMON PROTOCOL WILL DESCRIBE REQUIRED ELEMENTS FOR STUDY 
ENROLLMENT, DATA/SPECIMEN COLLECTION, INCLUDING DATA COLLECTION TOOLS, AND LABORATORY TESTING.
OBTAIN INSTITUTIONAL REVIEW BOARD APPROVAL
OBTAIN INSTITUTIONAL REVIEW BOARD (IRB) APPROVAL FOR ALL STUDY ACTIVITIES BEFORE INITIATING CONTACT 
WITH POTENTIAL PARTICIPANTS. THE KPNW IRB WILL SERVE AS THE SINGLE IRB OF RECORD FOR THE STUDY.
THE IRB REVIEW WILL INCLUDE REVIEW OF ALL PARTICIPANT-FACING STUDY MATERIALS INCLUDING ENROLLMENT 
MATERIALS AND INFORMED CONSENT AND HIPAA AUTHORIZATION. IRB APPROVAL WILL BE RENEWED 
ANNUALLY AND WILL BE MODIFIED AS NECESSARY FOR CHANGING STUDY CONDITIONS. THE UW STUDY TEAM 
WILL FOLLOW AGREED-UPON PROCEDURES FOR SUBSEQUENT STUDY MODIFICATION TO THE IRB. THE UW 
STUDY TEAM WILL TRACK ALL STUDY DEVIATIONS AND ADVERSE EVENTS FOR THEIR SITE. DEVIATIONS AND 
ADVERSE EVENTS WILL BE REPORTED TO KPCHR ANNUALLY PRIOR TO CONTINUING REVIEW OR IMMEDIATELY IF 
THE UW PI DETERMINES THEY MEET PROMPT REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. THE UW TEAM WILL DOCUMENT 
PI DETERMINATION OF WHETHER DEVIATIONS OR EVENTS ARE SUBJECT TO PROMPT REPORTING REQUIREMENTS
ACCORDING TO KP IRB POLICIES"

prime_award_program_activities_funding_t: 0005: EMERGING AND ZOONOTIC INFECTIOUS DISEASES (0949)
prime_awardee_business_types: Private University or College,Non-Profit Organization,Educational Institution,Veterinary College
prime_award_base_transaction_description: GENERAL HOSPITAL CORPORATION
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT NANOTECHNOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_business_types: PRIVATE UNIVERSITY OR COLLEGE,NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,VETERINARY COLLEGE
subaward_description:
TUFTS UNIVERSITY WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR IDENTIFYING PATIENTS WITH LYME DISEASE IN THE TUFTSMEDICINE
HOSPITAL AND PRIMARY CARE NETWORK THROUGH REGULARLY SCHEDULED ELECTRONIC HEALTH RECORDS (EHR)
SCANS AND EXTRACTING CLINICAL INFORMATION TO PROVIDE DEIDENTIFIED DETAILS OF THE DISEASE TO A
COMBINED DATABASE AT MASSACHUSETTS GENERAL HOSPITAL (MGH) FOR SUBSEQUENT TRANSMISSION TO THE
CDC. TUFTS UNIVERSITY INVESTIGATORS WILL WORK WITH MGH INVESTIGATORS TO CREATE A UNIFIED AND
EFFECTIVE CASE DEFINITION FOR IDENTIFYING PATIENTS WITH LYME DISEASE.TUFTS UNIVERSITY INVESTIGATORS
WILL ASSIST IN THE MODEL DEVELOPMENT, VALIDATION, AND DEPLOYMENT PROCESS AS DESCRIBED IN THE FULL
PROPOSAL. WE WILL FIRST DEVELOP A BASELINE MODEL OF SUBJECTS PRESENTING TO TUFTSMEDICINE WHO ARE
DIAGNOSED AS HAVING LYME DISEASE BY ICD9/10 CODES. WE WILL THEN WORK WITH MASS GENERAL
BRIGHAM AND MAINEHEALTH TO DERIVE ONE OR MORE IMPROVED MODELS BY IDENTIFYING INFORMATIVE
DIAGNOSTIC CRITERIA FROM CLINICAL, MICROBIOLOGICAL, EPIDEMIOLOGY, AND FREE TEXT DATA IN CASE AND
CONTROL VISITS. WE WILL COMPARE THE PERFORMANCE OF ONE OR MORE IMPROVED MODELS AND SELECT THE
BEST-PERFORMING ONE. WE WILL IMPLEMENT THE BEST-PERFORMING MODEL FOR RECORDS AT TUFTS UNIVERSITY,
SUMMARIZE THE RESULTS, AND AGGREGATE SUMMARY STATISTICS ACROSS SITES.

subaward_description:
SPECIFIC AIM 1: C-PATH WILL INGEST, MAP, AND CURATE THE ADTKD CLINICAL PHENOTYPING PATIENT LEVEL DATA, WHICH WILL BE COMBINED WITH URINARY/SERUM/IMAGING BIOMARKER MEASUREMENTS OF INTEREST E.G., UMOD, MUC1, EGF, FE-URIC ACID, KIDNEY FIBROSIS ETC. GENERATED BY WAKE FOREST UNIVERSITY HEALTH SCIENCES. IN ADDITION, C-PATH WILL PERFORM A LANDSCAPE ANALYSIS FOR ASSESSING THE UTILITY OF OTHER BIOCHEMICAL AND IMAGING TOOLS AND THEIR APPLICABILITY IN THE CONTEXT OF ADTKD.      SUB AIM 1.2: THE SUBCONTRACTOR WILL IDENTIFY ADTKD PATIENTS, PERFORM FLUID AND IMAGING
LONGITUDINAL BIOMARKER MEASUREMENTS. THE WF TEAM WILL PERFORM A COMPREHENSIVE PROSPECTIVE, LONGITUDINAL BIOBANKING COUPLED WITH SELECT BIOMARKER ANALYSIS INCLUDING FLUID AND IMAGING MARKERS. THIS EFFORT IS BASED ON THE PREVIOUS BIO-SAMPLING COLLECTION AND PROCESSING WORK WITHIN THE WF REGISTRY.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: CMS (HEALTH FFRDC)ORDER ON CONTRACT NUMBER 75FCMC23D0004-FDA REMS INTEGRATION PILOTS- FY24-25
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT NANOTECHNOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description: THE FDA'S RISK EVALUATION AND MANAGEMENT (REMS) PROGRAM ENSURES THE SAFE USE OF HIGH-RISK MEDICATIONS BUT CURRENTLY RELIES ON MANUAL DATA ENTRY, WHICH BURDENS PATIENTS, PRESCRIBERS, AND PHARMACISTS, LEADING TO DELAYS IN ACCESSING CRITICAL MEDICATIONS. THE CODEX INITIATIVE, PART OF HL7 FHIR ACCELERATOR, AIMS TO CREATE AN INTEROPERABLE REMS ECOSYSTEM THAT STREAMLINES THESE PROCESSES. MITRE INTENDS TO PARTNER WITH INVARYANT TO IMPLEMENT A FHIR-BASED USE CASE UNDER CODEX, FOCUSING ON REDUCING REMS-RELATED ADMINISTRATIVE BURDENS. INVARYANT'S ROLE WILL INCLUDE COORDINATING THE INTEGRATION USE CASE, TESTING STANDARDS IN REAL-WORLD SETTINGS, AND SUPPORTING POST-STUDY ACTIVITIES, WITH THE GOAL OF UPDATING THE HL7 IMPLEMENTATION GUIDE BY MAY 2025.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: THE PURPOSE OF THIS CONTRACT IS TO OBTAIN SERVICES FOR THE JURISDICTION H (PART A AND B) MEDICARE ADMINISTRATIVE CONTRACTOR (MAC). THE CONTRACTOR WILL PROVIDE SPECIFIED HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFIT ADMINISTRATION SERVICES, INCLUDING MEDICARE CLAIMS PROCESSING AND PAYMENT SERVICES, IN SUPPORT OF THE MEDICARE PROGRAM (ALSO KNOWN AS THE MEDICARE FEE-FOR-SERVICE, OR FFS, PROGRAM) FOR JURISDICTION H.  JURISDICTION H INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING STATES: ARKANSAS, COLORADO, LOUISIANA, MISSISSIPPI, NEW MEXICO, OKLAHOMA, AND TEXAS.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: MIDS IDIQ ELIGIBLE CLINICIAN (EC) ELECTRONIC CLINICAL QUALITY MEASURE (ECQM) DEVELOPMENT, REEVALUATION, AND IMPLEMENTATION.
prime_award_naics_description: OTHER SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL CONSULTING SERVICES
subaward_description:
NCQA WILL UPDATE FOUR OF THE 17 NCQA STEWARDED-ECQMS. THESE MEASURES REQUIRE SUBSTANTIVE CHANGES, WITH SUBSTANTIVE MEANING MORE THAN VALUE SET TWEAKS. THE MEASURES NCQA WILL UPDATE ARE:
1.	BREAST CANCER SCREENING (CMS ID 125) - UPDATE SCREENING GUIDELINES RELATED TO AGE.  
2.	DIABETES: EYE EXAM (CMS ID 131) Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ ADD EXCLUSION FOR EYE ENUCLEATION AND NO EYES AND CONSIDER AI RETINAL EYE EXAM TESTS.
3.	FOLLOW-UP CARE FOR CHILDREN PRESCRIBED ADHD MEDICATION (ADD) (CMS ID 136) Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ ADD NEW MEDICATIONS.
4.	PREVENTIVE CARE AND SCREENING: TOBACCO USE: SCREENING AND CESSATION INTERVENTION (CMS ID 138)  Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ REMOVE MEDICATIONS TO ALIGN WITH FDA AND CDC RECOMMENDATIONS.
THE OTHER 13 MEASURES WILL RETAIN THE SAME ECQM SPECIFICATIONS AS THE PREVIOUS YEAR.  NCQA WILL CREATE NEW MADIE PACKAGES FOR THESE MEASURES BUT WILL ONLY MAKE MINIMUM NECESSARY CHANGES IN THE HEADER, FOR EXAMPLE UPDATING COPYRIGHT LANGUAGE.

UNDER TASKS 7, 9,10,11,12,13, AND 14, AS NEEDED, HMA MAY PROVIDE TECHNICAL INPUT ON ACTIVITIES IDENTIFIED UNDER THESE

prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT NANOTECHNOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_name: ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI
subawardee_parent_name: ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI
subawardee_business_types: PRIVATE UNIVERSITY OR COLLEGE,NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description:
SUBCONTRACTOR SHALL CONTINUE TO ADDRESS UNMET NEEDS IN SARS-COV-2 SEROLOGICAL TESTING AND RESEARCH THROUGH INVESTIGATION OF CHARACTERISTICS OF
THE IMMUNE RESPONSE THAT CORRELATE WITH PROTECTION FROM INFECTION OR SEVERE DISEASE, WITH A FOCUS ON CANCER PATIENTS. LONGITUDINAL STUDIES SHALL CONTINUE ONLY IN THE MULTIPLE
MYELOMA COHORT; IN HEMATOLOGICAL CANCER TRANSPLANT RECIPIENTS (WITH AND WITHOUT HIV)AND WITH HEALTHY CONTROLS TO ACHIEVE MATCHED TIME POINTS. THIS WORK WILL BE CONDUCTED IN PARTNERSHIP WITH SERONET; INCLUDING THE FNLCR SEROLOGY LABORATORY; AND THE SSC; TO
DEVELOP AND PROVIDE REAGENTS AND STANDARDS TO THE SEROLOGY COMMUNITY ONCE GENERATED AND QUALIFIED. TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPMENT INCLUDES CONDUCTING A PILOT TO ADDRESS THE POSSIBILITY OF INCREASED INCIDENCE OF CANCER DUE TO SARS-COV-2 AS WELL AS COLLECTIONS FROM NOVEL VACCINE RECIPIENTS.

subawardee_dba_name: BOARD OF REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF OKLAHOMA HEALTH SCIENCES CENTER
subawardee_business_types: PRIVATE UNIVERSITY OR COLLEGE,NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description:
EPICARE ECG READING CENTER AT WAKE FOREST BAPTIST HEALTH SERVES AS THE CORE LAB FOR THE UPCOMING
STRONG HEART STUDY (SHS) PHASE 7 EXAM. WE WILL PROCESS ECGS FROM ~2200 PARTICIPANTS BEING REEXAMINED
OVER 2 YEARS, BEGINNING IN NOVEMBER 2022. WE WILL WORK WITH THE SHS INVESTIGATORS ON
DOWNSTREAM DATA ANALYSES AND PUBLICATIONS USING THE VARIABLES EXTRACTED FROM THE ECGS. DEVELOPING
ECG PROTOCOL, TRAINING OF THE STUDY STAFF, AND REPORTING QUALITY OF THE DATA ARE ALSO PART OF THE SCOPE OF
WORK. THE ECG READING CENTERÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S KEY INVESTIGATORS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE STUDY MEETINGS AND COMMITTEES
AS NEEDED.

subawardee_dba_name: BOARD OF REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF OKLAHOMA HEALTH SCIENCES CENTER
subaward_description:
BIOSPECIMEN RECEIPT, TRACKING, AND COORDINATION/SUPPORT FOR FIELD CENTERS: MHRI WILL PROVIDE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR FIELD CENTER STAFF IN TROUBLESHOOTING ANY CHALLENGES IN SAMPLE PROCESSING AND SHIPPING PROCEDURES THAT ARE INCLUDED IN THE LABORATORY PORTIONS OF THE SHS7 MOOP.  MHRI STAFF WILL COORDINATE SHIPPING OF SPECIMENS FROM FCS TO THE BIOREPOSITORY, ENSURE TRACKING, RECEIPT AND TIMELY EXPERT HANDLING AND INVENTORY WITH UPDATES OF THE CC SAMPLE TRACKING DATA SYSTEM.  

LABORATORY ASSAYS, INVENTORY UPDATES, AND RESULTS REPORTING: MHRI WILL PERFORM ASSAYS OF SHS7 BIOSPECIMENS AS DESCRIBED IN THE SHS7 MOOP, INCLUDING STANDARD LIPID PANELS, HBA1C, GLUCOSE, AND URINARY ALBUMIN/CREATININE.  RESULTS WILL BE REPORTED TO THE CC, AS DESCRIBED IN THE MOOP, FOR TRANSMISSION TO THE FCS WITH SUBSEQUENT RETURN TO PARTICIPANTS.  FOLLOWING EACH SAMPLE PULL FOR ASSAY, RESIDUAL SAMPLES WILL BE RETURNED TO STORAGE AS PRACTICAL, WITH APPROPRIATE UPDATES TO INVENTORY TRACKING (E.G., NOTING RESIDUAL VOLUMES AND THAW CYCLES).

QUALITY ASSURANCE AND CONTROL:  AS DESCRIBED IN THE MOOP AND THE PROPOSAL, WE WILL PERFORM MANDATED PROFICIENCY TESTING AND MAINTAIN CAP ACCREDITATION FOR ALL (CORE, CONTRACT) ASSAYS IN WHICH RESULTS WILL BE RETURNED TO PARTICIPANTS.  LAB WILL CONDUCT QC ASSAYS (INCLUDING BLINDED DUPLICATE ASSAYS AS DESCRIBED IN SHS7 MOOP AND CONDUCTED IN PREVIOUS EXAM PHASES) AS WELL AS ROUTINE DAILY QC PROCEDURES FOR EACH ASSAY AND INSTRUMENT, AS REQUIRED BY CLIA, CAP AND ALL LABORATORY SOPS.  LABORATORY STAFF WILL SERVE ON SHS QC COMMITTEE.

FREEZER PURCHASE TO ACCOMMODATE NEW SHS7 SPECIMENS:  WE WILL PURCHASE AND PUT ALL NEW BUDGETED FREEZERS INTO SERVICE, CONNECTING THEM TO OUR DISTRIBUTED MONITORING SYSTEM, WITH SAME MAINTENANCE, MONITORING AND OVERSIGHT AS LEGACY FREEZERS IN THE SHS BIOREPOSITORY.

subaward_description: THE SUBAWARD PI AT SSI, DR. BALMASEDA IN COLLABORATION WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN WILL CONDUCT THE Ã¢Â‚¬Å“SARS-COV-2 INFECTIONS AND CORONAVIRUS IMPRINTING IN A PEDIATRIC COHORTÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½ IN MANAGUA, NICARAGUA. THE OVERALL SCOPE OF WORK IS AS FOLLOWS. SUSPECTED SARS-COV-2 CASES DETECTED THROUGH MEDICAL CONSULTS AT THE HCSFV OR THROUGH SYMPTOMS QUESTIONNAIRES WILL GET A RESPIRATORY SAMPLE COLLECTED AND A RAPID SARS-COV-2 TEST PERFORMED. ADDITIONALLY, THIS WILL INCLUDE THE PCR TESTING OF RESPIRATORY SAMPLES FOR SARSÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½COVÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½2 AND SEROLOGICAL TESTING FOR BOTH ALPHA AND BETA CORONAVIRUS INFECTIONS ON EARLY LIFE SAMPLES. FINALLY, A CONVALESCENT BLOOD SAMPLE WILL BE COLLECTED 30-45 DAYS AFTER THE INITIAL SAMPLING. IN ADDITION, SSI WILL PREPARE SHIPMENTS TO THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN AND DR. BALMASEDA WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE PREPARATION OF MANUSCRIPTS, REPORTS, AND PRESENTATIONS.

prime_award_program_activities_funding_t: 0006: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES (0885)
prime_award_base_transaction_description: LARGE SCALE T CELL EPITOPE DISCOVERY
prime_award_naics_description: COMPUTER SYSTEMS DESIGN SERVICES
subaward_description:
IN SUPPORT OF THE MULTI-INSTITUTIONAL EFFORT TO CHARACTERIZE T CELL EPITOPES OF FUNGI, IOGENETICS WILL APPLY ITS EIGENBIO IMMUNOINFORMATICS PLATFORM TO PROVIDE DETAILED EPITOPE MAPS AND RANKINGS. THIS WILL BE DONE IN TWO WAYS.
FIRST A GROUP OF "FAST TRACK" PROTEINS HAS BEEN SELECTED BY THE MYCOLOGISTS IN EACH PARTICIPATING UNIVERSITY . FOR THESE PROTEINS IOGENETICS WILL PROCEED DIRECTLY TO GENERATE DETAILED IMMUNOME MAPS AND TO IDENTIFY PROBABLE T CELL EPITOPES THAT WILL BE RESTRICTED BY MHC II OF THE DR1*0401 ALLELE AS WELL AS FOR A SERIES OF OTHER HUMAN MHC 1 1 ALLELES.
SECONDLY A RATIONAL DOWN SELECTION APPROACH WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE AN UNBIASED APPROACH TO IDENTIFYING OTHER T CELL EPITOPES . THE TOTAL PROTEOME OF EACH OF FOUR FUNGAL SPECIES, BLASTOMYCES DERMATITIDIS, HISTOP/ASMA CAPSULATUM, COCCIDIOIDES POSADASII AND CRYPTOCOCCUS NEOFORMANS WILL BE FILTERED BASED ON EXPRESSION IN ITS PARASITIC PHASE, UPREGULATION AND PRESENCE OF OTHER FEATURES SUCH AS SURFACE EXPOSURE TO IDENTIFY PROTEINS MOST LIKELY TO CARRY RELEVANT T CELL EPITOPES. THE PROTEOMES WILL BE SCREENED TO IDENTIFY IMMUNOSTIMULATORY VS IMMUNOSUPPRESSIVE PROTEINS. BASE DON THIS A SET OF 100-200 PROTEINS WILL BE SELECTED FOR EACH FUNGUS AND SUBJECT TO THE DETAILED MAPPING DESCRIBED FOR THE FAST TRACK GROUP.
IN BOTH CASES THE GOAL IS TO IDENTIFY EXTENDED EPITOPE RICH PEPTIDES WHICH CAN BE EVALUATED AND VALIDATED IN MICE, HUMAN PATIENTS AND IN VITRO.
IOGENETICS EFFORTS WILL BE MOST INTENSE IN THE FIRST TWO YEARS OF THE PROJECT FOLLOWED BY ONGOING ANALYSIS OF RESULTS AND TROUBLE SHOOTING DURING THE OUT YEARS OF THE PROJECT.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: IMMUNE MECHANISMS OF PROTECTION AGAINST MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS CENTER (IMPAC-TB)
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_business_types: U.S. LOCAL GOVERNMENT,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
THIS STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW) OUTLINES THE ACTIVITIES THAT UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON (UW GERNER) WILL BE PERFORMING. NOTE THAT THE TASK NUMBERS BELOW REFLECT THE NUMBERING OF THE OVERALL ACTIVITIES IN THE PRIME CONTRACT.

ALTHOUGH THIS SOW DETAILS THE COMPLETE SUITE OF PROPOSED WORK, THE TASKS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS CONTRACT ITERATION ARE LIMITED TO THE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES OUTLINED BELOW, DELIVERABLES FOR THIS CONTRACT PERIOD ARE HIGHLIGHTED. 

GERNER LAB (YEAR 6 BASE) 

THE GERNER LABORATORY AT THE UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON (UW) SCHOOL OF MEDICINE DEPARTMENT OF IMMUNOLOGY HAS A MAJOR ROLE IN THE IMPAC-TB MICROSCOPY, HIGH-DIMENSIONAL FLOW CYTOMETRY AND SINGLE CELL RNA SEQUENCING ANALYSIS STUDIES. THIS WORK WILL PROVIDE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF HOW IMMUNE CELL HETEROGENEITY AND LOCALIZATION IN INFECTED LUNGS AND DRAINING LYMPH NODES INFLUENCES VACCINE EFFICACY AND MEDIATES PROTECTION AGAINST MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS (MTB), THUS ALLOWING FOR IMPROVED VACCINE DESIGN.

IN PARTICULAR, UW WILL STUDY THE CORRELATES OF IMMUNE PROTECTION DURING INFECTION WITH MTB SPECIFICALLY REGARDING THE ROLE OF CELLULAR RESPONSE HETEROGENEITY, IMMUNE CELL ORGANIZATION AND TISSUE MICROENVIRONMENTS IN LYMPHOID AND NON-LYMPHOID INFECTED TISSUES. UW WILL ALSO INVESTIGATE THE ROLES OF VARIOUS CHEMOTACTIC OR ADHESION MOLECULES IN GUIDING IMMUNE CELLS TO VARIOUS SITES WITHIN THE INFECTED LUNG TISSUES AND LYMPHOID ORGANS, AS WELL AS IN MEDIATING PROTECTION FROM MTB INFECTION. IN YEAR 6, THE GERNER LABORATORY AT UW WILL:

I. CONTINUE IMPLEMENTATION OF MICROSCOPY STUDIES AIMED TO UNDERSTAND THE SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION OF IMMUNE CELLS IN MTB INFECTED ANIMALS WITH AND WITHOUT VACCINATION, INCLUDING: TISSUE PROCESSING, MULTIPARAMETER CONFOCAL IMAGING, IMAGE ANALYSIS AND DATA STORAGE, AS WELL AS DATA INTEGRATION WITH OTHER RELATED STUDIES WITHIN THE IMPAC-TB PROJECT. SUBSTANTIAL EFFORT WILL BE PLACED ON FINALIZING STUDIES DESCRIBING THE ROLE OF NEUTROPHILS IN SHAPING LUNG GRANULOMA STRUCTURE AND IN IMMUNOREGULATION WITHIN THE GRANULOMA.

II. DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT EXPERIMENTS AIMED TO ELUCIDATE THE HETEROGENEITY OF INNATE AND ADAPTIVE IMMUNE RESPONSES WITHIN DRAINING LYMPH NODES DURING MTB INFECTION, WITH AND WITHOUT VACCINATION. SPECIFIC EFFORTS WILL BE PLACED ON ELUCIDATION OF CHANGES OCCURRING WITHIN THE MYELOID COMPARTMENT IN LYMPH NODES WHICH PROMOTE VERSUS INHIBIT FUNCTIONAL T CELL ACTIVATION AT DIFFERENT TIMEPOINTS DURING INFECTION. ADDITIONAL WORK WILL INVESTIGATE HOW BCG VACCINATION INHIBITS THE GENERATION OF MYELOID MICROENVIRONMENTS IN LNS WHICH SERVE AS A NICHE FOR CHRONIC MTB PERSISTENCE.

III. CONTINUE DEVELOPMENT OF HUMAN IMAGING PANELS TO STUDY IMMUNE CELL ORGANIZATION IN HUMAN INFECTED TISSUES (LUNG AND LYMPH NODE) OBTAINED FROM THE UGANDA POST-MORTEM STUDY, WITH DR STEVE COSE. PREVIOUS EFFORTS IDENTIFIED DIVERSE GRANULOMA STRUCTURES IN LUNGS FROM DECEASED INDIVIDUALS WITH ADVANCED DISEASE. UPCOMING WORK WILL ELUCIDATE ADDITIONAL IMMUNOLOGICAL FEATURES OF THESE STRUCTURES AND HOW THESE RELATE TO PROCESSES WITHIN THE DRAINING LNS. SPECIFIC GOAL WILL BE TO INVESTIGATE THE MICROANATOMY OF MTB INFECTION IN LUNG-DRAINING LNS, INCLUDING THE CELL TYPES, SPATIAL DISTRIBUTION, AND FUNCTIONAL STATES OF THE INFECTED CELLS. COMPARATIVE ANALYSES WITH MOUSE MODELS OF INFECTION (POINT II ABOVE) WILL BE PERFORMED.

IV. PERFORM ANALYSIS OF THE SPATIAL TRANSCRIPTOMICS DATA FOR LUNG GRANULOMAS OVER THE EARLY COURSE OF INFECTION WITH AND WITHOUT VACCINATION. IN THE PAST YEAR, WE HAVE COLLECTED LARGE NUMBERS OF SAMPLES OF EARLY LUNG LESIONS FOR THE SPATIAL TRANSCRIPTOMICS STUDY. IN THE COMING YEAR, THE GERNER LAB WILL PERFORM ANALYSIS OF THE DATASET, VALIDATE KEY FINDINGS, AND IDENTIFY KEY ACTIONABLE DIRECTIONS FOR FURTHER WORK. 

V. ASSIST WITH MULTIOMICS ANALYSIS AND DATA INTERPRETATION FOR FLOW CYTOMETRY, SINGLE CELL RNA SEQUENCING, SPATIAL TRANSCRIPTOMICS DATA OBTAINED BY THE GERNER LAB AND OTHER GROUPS WITHIN THE IMPACTB CONSORTIUM. THIS WILL INVOLVE ANALYSIS OF CHEMOT

subaward_description:
THIS STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW) OUTLINES THE ACTIVITIES THAT UNIVERSITY OF BETH ISRAEL DEACONESS MEDICAL CENTER (BIDMC) WILL BE PERFORMING. NOTE THAT THE TASK NUMBERS BELOW REFLECT THE NUMBERING OF THE OVERALL ACTIVITIES IN THE PRIME CONTRACT.

ALTHOUGH THIS SOW DETAILS THE COMPLETE SUITE OF PROPOSED WORK, THE TASKS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS CONTRACT ITERATION ARE LIMITED TO THE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES OUTLINED BELOW, DELIVERABLES FOR THIS CONTRACT PERIOD ARE HIGHLIGHTED. 

YEAR 6 Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ BAROUCH

OUR RESEARCH PROJECTS IN THE PRECEDING YEARS OF THE AWARD FOCUSED ON DEVELOPING INNOVATIVE MURINE AEROSOL CHALLENGE MODELS FOR THE EVALUATION OF TUBERCULOSIS VACCINES. A RECENT PUBLICATION ESTABLISHED SUBSTANTIAL VACCINE PROTECTION WITH THE LIVE-ATTENUATED ÃŽÂ€?LPRG VACCINE STRAIN IN THE ULTRA LOW-DOSE MURINE AEROSOL CHALLENGE MODEL AS WELL AS THE DEVELOPMENT OF A NOVEL REPEATED ULTRA LOW- DOSE CHALLENGE MODEL THAT LED TO THE IDENTIFICATION OF CORRELATES OF VACCINE PROTECTION. WE OBSERVED THAT THE NOVEL REPEATED ULTRA LOW-DOSE CHALLENGE MODEL RESULTED IN INCREASED STRINGENCY AND REDUCED VACCINE EFFICACY IN TERMS OF PROTECTION FROM DETECTABLE INFECTION AND UNILATERAL INFECTION. IN YEAR 5 WE ESTABLISHED A SECOND-GENERATION MODEL IN WHICH WE FURTHER REDUCED THE CHALLENGE INOCULUM IN ORDER TO PRESERVE A MODEL OF REPEATED EXPOSURE WHILE REDUCING THE STRINGENCY OF CHALLENGE AND IMPROVING THE LIKELIHOOD OF RESOLVING VACCINE EFFICACY. 

RESEARCH EFFORTS IN YEAR 6 WILL FOCUS ON ASSESSING BCG AND ÃŽÂ€?LPRG VACCINE PROTECTION IN THIS SECOND-GENERATION MODEL IN THE CONTEXT OF A COMPREHENSIVE CORRELATES OF PROTECTION ANALYSIS. RESULTS FROM THE CORRELATES OF PROTECTION ANALYSES WILL BE HYPOTHESIS-GENERATING AND FORM THE BASIS FOR MECHANISTIC STUDIES EVALUATING THE CELLULAR SUBSETS AND PATHWAYS REGULATING VACCINE PROTECTION. THESE STUDIES WILL CONTINUE TO ESTABLISH NEXT-GENERATION MURINE MODELS FOR TB VACCINE TESTING, IDENTIFICATION OF CORRELATES OF PROTECTION, AND MECHANISTIC STUDIES.

THE HUMAN IMMUNOLOGIC STUDIES (LEAD BY DR. LEWINSOHN AND HIS TEAM) WILL FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES IN THIS PERIOD:

HOUSEHOLD CONTACTS STUDY
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	SUB-ACTIVITY 2 (AIM 1): PERFORM SCRNASEQ ON NON-ADHERENT LYMPHOCYTES TO DEFINE THE PHENOTYPIC AND FUNCTIONAL PROFILE OF NON-MYELOID CELLS IN THE LUNGS AND PERIPHERAL CIRCULATION.
SUB-ACTIVITY 5 (AIM 4): PREPARE A MINIMUM OF 100 TCR CLONES OF EACH STUDY PARTICIPANT OF ALL COHORTS AND EVALUATE FOR HLA-RESTRICTION, FUNCTIONAL PHENOTYPE, TCR USAGE, AND ANTIGENIC SPECIFICITY

subaward_description:
UNDER THIS OPTION WE WILL CONDUCT STUDIES IN RM TO VALIDATE THE EFFICACY OF THE RHCMV/TB VECTOR ORTHOLOG OF THE HUMAN CMV VACCINE CANDIDATE (VIR-1778) CURRENTLY SCHEDULED FOR TESTING IN A PHASE 1 CLINICAL TRIAL.  WE WILL ALSO DEVELOP AND TEST RHCMV VECTORS THAT ARE MODIFIED TO REDUCE OR ELIMINATE THE DELETERIOUS IMMUNOREGULATORY EFFECTS OF THE CONTROL RHCMV VECTORS THAT LED TO ACCELERATED TB DISEASE, IN PARTICULAR VECTOR BACKBONE MODIFICATIONS THAT WILL KEEP THE RHCMV/TB VECTOR OUT OF THE LUNG, AS WELL AS OBVIATE ITS ABILITY TO INFECT MONOCYTE/MACROPHAGES, ENDOTHELIAL AND EPITHELIAL CELLS SAND TO PRODUCE IMMUNOREGULATORY VIRAL (V) IL-10 (YEARS 6-7).
SUB-ACTIVITY 1: GENERATE A RHCMV/TB (AND RHCMV/CONTROL) VECTOR BASED ON THE VIR-1778 HCMV/TB VECTOR (FL-RHCMV + Ã¢Ë†Â€ RH157.5-Ã¢Ë†Â€ RH157.4 + RH107 R MTB-7AG) AND 4 DIFFERENT MODIFIED VERSIONS OF THIS ORTHOLOG VECTOR DESIGNED TO OBVIATE THE DELETERIOUS IMMUNOREGULATION MENTIONED ABOVE. ALL VECTORS WILL BE MADE AS BOTH TB-7AG INSERT EXPRESSION VECTORS (USING THE SAME TB-7AG CASSETTE BEING USED IN VIR 1778), AND AS A CONTROL VECTOR EXPRESSING AN INSERT OF ROUGHLY SIMILAR SIZE EXPRESSING UNRELATED SIV AGS. 
SUB-ACTIVITY 2: SELECT 2 OF THE 4 BACKBONE DESIGNS FROM SUB-ACTIVITY 1 AND THE VIR-1778 ORTHOLOG VECTOR SET FOR IMMUNOGENICITY AND EFFICACY TESTING IN MONKEYS, COMPARING THE BACKBONES WITH MTB VS. CONTROL AG INSERTS VS. UNVACCINATED CONTROLS. THE FOLLOWING GROUPS WILL BE TESTED USING UP TO A TOTAL OF 56 MONKEYS:
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	VECTOR A (VIR-1778 ORTHOLOG) AND MATCHING CONTROL AG INSERT VECTOR; 8 MONKEYS EACH 
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	VECTOR B* (MODIFIED VIR-1388 ORTHOLOG VECTOR #1) AND MATCHING CONTROL AG INSERT VECTOR; 7-8 MONKEYS EACH
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	VECTOR C* (MODIFIED VIR-1388 ORTHOLOG VECTOR #2) AND MATCHING CONTROL AG INSERT; 7-8 MONKEYS EACH, AND
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	8 UNVACCINATED CONTROLS
SUB-ACTIVITY 3: PERFORM TIMED NECROPSIES AT WEEK 4 OR 5 POST-CHALLENGE AND PERFORM MICROBIOLOGIC AND HISTOPATHOLOGIC/IN SITU ANALYSES TO MEASURE EXTENT OF MTB INFECTION.
SUB-ACTIVITY 4: CONDUCT LONGITUDINAL AND END-POINT (NECROPSY) ASSAYS TO MONITOR TRANSCRIPTOMIC PREDICTORS OF VACCINE EFFICACY AND THE DEVELOPMENT AND RESPONSE TO MTB CHALLENGE OF MTB-SPECIFIC CD4+ AND CD8+ T CELL RESPONSES AND INNATE Ã¢Â‚¬Å“TRAINEDÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½ IMMUNITY.
VECTOR B AND C TO BE SELECTED FROM VECTORS WITH THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL MODIFICATIONS (THAT IS ADDED TO TO THE VIR-1378 ORTHOLOG VECTOR BACKBONE)
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	SINGLE CYCLE VERSION: + RH108-FKBP
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	VIL-10 DELETED: + Ã¢Ë†Â€ RH143
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	MYELOID, ENDOTHELIAL AND EPITHELIAL TROPISM-RESTRICTED AND VIL-10 DELETED: + Ã¢Ë†Â€ RH143 + MIR126/142/205 (RH108/RH156)
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	DOUBLE-DELETED AND MYELOID, ENDOTHELIAL AND EPITHELIAL TROPISM-RESTRICTED AND VIL-10 DELETED: + Ã¢Ë†Â€ RH143 + MIR126/142/205 (RH108/RH156) + Ã¢Ë†Â€ RH158-Ã¢Ë†Â€ RH161

subaward_description:
THIS STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW) OUTLINES THE ACTIVITIES THAT UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON (UW GERNER) WILL BE PERFORMING. NOTE THAT THE TASK NUMBERS BELOW REFLECT THE NUMBERING OF THE OVERALL ACTIVITIES IN THE PRIME CONTRACT.

ALTHOUGH THIS SOW DETAILS THE COMPLETE SUITE OF PROPOSED WORK, THE TASKS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS CONTRACT ITERATION ARE LIMITED TO THE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES OUTLINED BELOW, DELIVERABLES FOR THIS CONTRACT PERIOD ARE HIGHLIGHTED. 

EXPANSION OF MICROSCOPY CAPABILITIES IN IMPACTB CASCADE WORK WITH IBEX IMAGING OF HUMAN SAMPLES

AN EXTENSION OF WORK UNDER THE 75N93019C00070 CASCADE IMPAC-TB CONTRACT.

ONGOING IMPACTB CASCADE STUDIES USING 10-13-PLEX IMAGING HAVE PROVIDED MANY KEY INSIGHTS INTO CELL TYPE COMPOSITION AND LESION ORGANIZATION DURING MTB INFECTION ACROSS ANIMAL MODELS, AND MOST RECENTLY IN HUMAN LESIONS OF PATIENTS WITH END-STAGE DISEASE.

THE SUPPLEMENT WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:

AIM 1: THE ULTRA-HIGH PLEX (IBEX) IMAGING APPROACH DEVELOPED BY DR. RONALD GERMAINÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S LAB AT THE NIH WILL BE USED TO BETTER CHARACTERIZE HUMAN LUNG LESIONS DURING MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS INFECTION. THIS WILL LEAD TO IMPROVED DEFINITION OF CELLULAR COMPOSITION AND HETEROGENEITY. ADOPTION OF THIS TECHNOLOGY WILL INITIALLY BE IMPLEMENTED ON AND APPLIED TO ALREADY AVAILABLE SAMPLES PROVIDED THROUGH THE ONGOING POST-MORTEM IMPACTB STUDIES IN UGANDA WITH STEVE COSE.

AIM 2: OBTAIN AND INCLUDE IN OUR WORKFLOW ADDITIONAL SAMPLES FROM A BROADER SPECTRUM OF LESION TYPES AND DISEASE STAGES. TO THIS END WE WILL ESTABLISH A COLLABORATION WITH DR. ADRIE STEYNÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S GROUP AT THE AFRICA HEALTH RESEARCH INSTITUTE (AHRI), LEVERAGING THEIR EXTENSIVE HUMAN LUNG TISSUE REPOSITORY AT THE ALBERT LUTHULI CENTRAL HOSPITAL AS PART OF THE HUMAN LUNG PROJECT. THROUGH THIS COLLABORATION, WE WILL OBTAIN HUMAN LUNG GRANULOMA SAMPLES AND LINKED DRAINING AND NON-DRAINING LNS FROM INDIVIDUALS WITH VARIOUS STAGES OF TB DISEASE. THESE SAMPLES WILL THEN BE ANALYZED USING THE IBEX IMAGING PIPELINE IN THE GERNER LAB.


USING IBEX ULTRA-HIGH PLEX IMAGING ON THESE UNIQUE AND PRECIOUS SAMPLES, WE WILL NOT ONLY BETTER DEFINE THE HETEROGENEITY OF HUMAN DISEASE AT A HIGH LEVEL OF CELLULAR AND SPATIAL RESOLUTION, BUT ALSO LINK HOW LUNG DISEASE AFFECTS PROCESSES TAKING PLACE IN ASSOCIATED LUNG DRAINING LYMPH NODES.

subaward_description:
THIS STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW) OUTLINES THE ACTIVITIES THAT UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON (UW GERNER) WILL BE PERFORMING. NOTE THAT THE TASK NUMBERS BELOW REFLECT THE NUMBERING OF THE OVERALL ACTIVITIES IN THE PRIME CONTRACT.

ALTHOUGH THIS SOW DETAILS THE COMPLETE SUITE OF PROPOSED WORK, THE TASKS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS CONTRACT ITERATION ARE LIMITED TO THE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES OUTLINED BELOW, DELIVERABLES FOR THIS CONTRACT PERIOD ARE HIGHLIGHTED. 

YEAR 6 (BASE) Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ HAWN

THE HAWN LABORATORY AT THE UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON (UW) WILL HAVE SEVERAL ROLES IN THIS SUBCONTRACT IN YEAR 6. EACH ACTIVITY FROM YEARS 1-5 IS ONGOING.

1. UW WILL OVERSEE GENOTYPING AND ANALYSIS OF CANDIDATE GENE POLYMORPHISMS IN HEALTHY CONTROLS IN SEATTLE. GENOTYPING IS COMPLETED EXCEPT FOR NEW ENROLLEES. ANALYSIS IS ONGOING WITH NEW CANDIDATE GENES THAT HAVE RECENTLY BEEN SELECTED FOR WORK IN YEAR 6. POLYMORPHISMS WILL BE ANALYZED FOR THEIR ASSOCIATION WITH MTB-INFECTED MACROPHAGE PHENOTYPES. CANDIDATE GENES WILL BE SELECTED BASED ON STUDIES FROM DRS. URDAHL, PICKER, LEWINSOHN, AND WALZL.

2. UW WILL ORGANIZE AND FACILITATE THE ISOLATION OF PERIPHERAL BLOOD MONOCYTES AND MONOCYTE-DERIVED MACROPHAGES FOR EX VIVO MTB INFECTION FROM HEALTHY CONTROLS IN SEATTLE. MONOCYTES WILL BE ISOLATED FROM CRYOPRESERVED PBMCS, WHICH ARE AVAILABLE FROM AN ESTABLISHED SEATTLE COHORT OF HEALTHY SUBJECTS. ANALYSES ARE UNDERWAY TO EXAMINE THE ASSOCIATION OF GENETIC VARIANTS IN CANDIDATE GENES WITH MTB-INDUCED MACROPHAGE PHENOTYPES IN A COHORT OF 100 HEALTHY DONORS. 
.
3. UW WILL OVERSEE THE MACROPHAGE EXPERIMENTS INCLUDING CRISPR/CAS9 GENE SILENCING IN THP1 AND U937 CELLS AND STUDIES OF PRIMARY MONOCYTES FROM SEATTLE AND CAPE TOWN. STUDIES WILL INCLUDE INFECTION OF MACROPHAGES WITH MTB AND ANALYSIS OF IMMUNE PATHWAYS AND CONTROL OF MTB REPLICATION. CELL SUPERNATANTS WILL BE HARVESTED FOR CYTOKINE/CHEMOKINE ELISA AND RNA EXTRACTED FROM CELLS, QUANTIFIED, AND ANALYZED.

4. UW WILL COLLABORATE WITH INVESTIGATORS ON THE ANALYSIS OF WHETHER POLYMORPHISMS IN CANDIDATE GENES ARE ASSOCIATED WITH MACROPHAGE PHENOTYPES AND PREPARE IT FOR PUBLICATION WITH OTHER INVESTIGATORS.

subaward_description:
THIS STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW) OUTLINES THE ACTIVITIES THAT THE SITES Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ DENVER RESEARCH INSTITUTE (AKA DRI, ADMINISTRATIVE/SUBCONTRACT SITE) AND ROCKY MOUNTAIN REGIONAL VA MEDICAL CENTER (AKA RMR-VAMC, EXPERIMENTAL WORK SITE) Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ WILL BE PERFORMING FOR THIS PROJECT. NOTE THAT THE TASK NUMBERS BELOW REFLECT THE NUMBERING OF THE OVERALL ACTIVITIES IN THE PRIME CONTRACT.

THROUGH THE EXECUTION OF THIS CONTRACT, WE WILL EXAMINE BASIC INDUCTION OF INNATE AND ADAPTIVE IMMUNITY FROM VACCINATION, INCLUDING STUDIES THAT ADDRESS NONTUBERCULOUS MYCOBACTERIA (NTM) INTERFERENCE, RNA DELIVERY, PRIME-BOOST REGIMENS (INCLUDING BCG PRE-EXPOSURE), TRANSCRIPTOMIC HOST SIGNATURES, SYSTEMS BIOLOGY, AND DURABLE IMMUNE MEMORY FOR THE FURTHER ADVANCEMENT OF THE EFFORT TO DESIGN AND EVALUATE AN EFFICACIOUS VACCINE AGAINST MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS (M.TB).

THE WORK UNDER THIS CONTRACT MAY INCLUDE THE POSSIBLE DISTRIBUTION OF DE-IDENTIFIED HUMAN SUBJECT PERIPHERAL BLOOD MONONUCLEAR CELLS (PBMC), SERUM, AND OTHER CLINICAL SAMPLES TO SCRI AND THE PHOENIX PARTNERS. NHP SAMPLES AND/OR DOWNSTREAM DATA MAY BE SHARED WITH THE PARTNERS ON THIS CONTRACT. 

OPTION 1 ACTIVITIES: EVALUATE OPTIMIZED M.TB VACCINE CANDIDATES FOR SAFETY, IMMUNOGENICITY AND EFFICACY IN MOUSE TB MODELS 

TASK 1.4: EVALUATE PREVENTION OF DISEASE (POD) EFFICACY WITH NTM (M.TB HN878 P1)
TO ENSURE THAT BIOLOGICAL RESULTS GENERATED IN THE VARIOUS CONSORTIUM LABS ARE COMPARABLE, WE WILL STANDARDIZE THE PRIMARY ASSAYS USED IN IMMUNOGENICITY ASSESSMENTS FOR EACH SPECIES. IN LINE WITH THE PROJECT GOALS TO DEVELOP A CROSS-SPECIES INTERROGATION PLATFORM, WE WILL HARMONIZE KEY ASSAYS ACROSS MULTIPLE SPECIES. SCRI WILL APPOINT AN OVERALL TASK LEADER TO COORDINATE AND OVERSEE THE WORK. ALL ASSAY STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES (SOP) WILL BE SHARED WITH A PRECLINICAL LABORATORY LEAD, DESIGNATED FOR EACH ASSAY, WHO WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR HARMONIZING. FINAL SOPS WILL BE SHARED AND LEAD ASSAY LABS WILL CONDUCT SIDE-BY-SIDE TRAINING SESSIONS, AS WELL AS MAINTAIN AND DISTRIBUTE COMMON REFERENCE STANDARDS AND REAGENTS, SUCH AS IDENTICAL STIMULATION ANTIGENS (BCG, PPD, SEB, PEPTIDE POOLS, MYCOBACTERIAL LYSATES AND BCG VACCINATION STRAIN (BCG AJ/BCG SSI). THESE REAGENTS WILL BE INCLUDED IN AN OPTIMIZED MULTICOLOR IMMUNOFLUORESCENCE PANEL (OMIP). 
RMR-VAMC WILL USE THEIR EXPANSIVE STOCKS OF NTM ISOLATES TO GENERATE BATCHES OF A VARIETY OF APPROXIMATELY 5-10 NTM LIVE CULTURES, LYSATES AND CULTURE FILTRATES DURING OPTION 1. THESE REAGENTS WILL BE DISTRIBUTED TO COLLABORATOR SITES TO BE USED IN CROSS-SPECIES AND CROSS-SITE ASSAY VALIDATION AND STANDARDIZATION AS NEEDED. THESE REAGENTS WILL FURTHER BE USED TO EXECUTE ASSAYS EVALUATING THE EFFECTS OF NTM PRE-EXPOSURE IN MOUSE, GUINEA PIG, NONHUMAN PRIMATE (NHP) AND HUMAN SAMPLES, INCLUDING EVALUATING NTM-SPECIFIC ANTIBODY RESPONSES IN OPTIONS 1-4.  
A SUMMARY REPORT OF ALL ACTIVITIES AND RESULTS FROM OPTION 1 WILL BE DRAFTED AND SUBMITTED TO NIAID FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. DRI/RMR-VAMC WILL PROVIDE ALL THE NECESSARY DATA AND INPUT REQUIRED FOR THE COMPLETION AND ACCEPTANCE OF THE FINAL REPORT FOR OPTION 1 ACTIVITIES.



CONTRACT PERIOD-SPECIFIC TASK TABLE OF DELIVERABLES:

DELIVERABLES	TASK	DESCRIPTION 	PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE	DUE DATE 
DUE THIS CONTRACT PERIOD	1.4	EVALUATE POD EFFICACY WITH NTM (M.TB HN878 P1)	8/1/2024 Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ 7/31/2025	7/31/2025

OPTION 3 ACTIVITIES: EVALUATE OPTIMIZED M.TB VACCINE CANDIDATES FOR SAFETY, IMMUNOGENICITY AND EFFICACY IN THE NHP MODEL OF TB

TASK 3.4: EX VIVO NHP MACROPHAGE STUDY
TASK 3.4: ANALYZE THE EFFECTS THE DIFFERENT VACCINE STRATEGIES HAVE ON NONHUMAN PRIMATE (NHP) MACROPHAGE CONTROL OF AN EX VIVO M.TB INFECTION. IN EX VIVO EXPERIMENTS, RMR-VAMC WILL DETERMINE WHAT EFFECTS THE DIFFERENT VACCINATION STRATEGIES IN NHP HAVE ON THE ABILITY OF THEIR MACROPHAGES TO CONTROL AN EX VIVO INFECTION AND ON MACROPHAGE EFFECTOR FUNCTIONS. IN GROUPS OF NHP WITH DIFFERENT VACCINE STRATEGIES, PBMC WILL BE OBTAINED POST-BOOST AND SENT PRE-CHALLENGE AT 5 X

subaward_description:
THE UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON CRYO-EM GROUP (UW-CRYOEM), UNDER THE DIRECTION OF DAVID VEESLER, PH.D., WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING WORK TO ADDITIONALLY SUPPORT THE BASIC REQUIREMENT OF THE SSGCID CONTRACT (CONTRACT NR 75N93022C00036) FROM SEPT 1, 2024 THROUGH AUGUST 31, 2025. UW-CRYOEM WILL PERFORM AN OPTION QUANTITY EFFORT (OQ 4) FOCUSED ON MERS-COV.   

A.	OPTION QUANTITY EFFORTS

UW-CROEM WILL USE OPTION QUANTITY RESOURCES (OQ 4) TO PERFORM A PROJECT FOCUSING ON COMPUTATION DESIGN OF MINIPROTEINS THAT BIND TO SPIKE PROTEIN FROM MERS-COV. SUBSEQUENTLY, UW-CRYOEM WILL PERFORM STUDIES ON THE NEUTRALIZING ACTIVITY AND MECHANISM OF ACTION OF THE SPIKE PROTEIN BOUND TO MINIPROTEINS AS IT RELATES TO FUTURE CLINICAL DEVELOPMENT OF A NEXT-GENERATION COUNTERMEASURE.
ONE CRYOEM STRUCTURE IS EXPECTED FROM THIS WORK DURING THIS CONTRACT YEAR.

subaward_description:
THE UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON CRYO-EM GROUP (UW-CRYOEM), UNDER THE DIRECTION OF DAVID VEESLER, PH.D., WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING WORK TO ADDITIONALLY SUPPORT THE BASIC REQUIREMENT OF THE SSGCID CONTRACT (CONTRACT NR 75N93022C00036) FROM SEPT 1, 2024 THROUGH AUGUST 31, 2025. UW-CRYOEM WILL PERFORM OPTION QUANTITY EFFORTS (OQS 7 AND 8) FOCUSED ON FLU.   

A.	OPTION QUANTITY EFFORTS

UW-CROEM WILL USE OPTION QUANTITY RESOURCES (OQ 7 AND 8) TO PERFORM A PROJECT FOCUSING ON THE MECHANISMS OF INFLUENZA VIRUS HEMAGGLUTININ-MEDIATED ENTRY INTO CELLS. THIS WORK WILL USE STRUCTURAL AND FUNCTIONAL APPROACHES TO STUDY THE MOLECULAR BASIS OF HEMAGGLUTININ ACTIVATION DURING BIOGENESIS OR ENCOUNTER OF TARGET CELLS. FOR OQ7, 0.95 FTE WILL BE DEVOTED TO THIS WORK BY UW-CRYOEM. FOR OQ8, 0.6 FTE WILL BE DEVOTED TO THIS WORK BY UW-CRYOEM FOR A TOTAL OF 1.55 FTE.
AT LEAST ONE CRYOEM STRUCTURE IS EXPECTED FROM THIS WORK DURING THIS CONTRACT YEAR.

subaward_description:
THE UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON NMR GROUP (UW-NMR), UNDER THE DIRECTION OF GABRIELE VARANI, PH.D., WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING WORK TO SUPPORT THE BASIC PROJECT REQUIREMENT. UW-NMR WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SOLVING 1 NMR STRUCTURE DURING THIS ONE YEAR SUBCONTRACT PERIOD, 9/1/2024 Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ 8/31/2025) AND FOR LEADING ONE PROJECT ON PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS AND RAPID RESPONSE TO OUTBREAKS/EPIDEMIC/PANDEMICS. 

A.	STRUCTURE DETERMINATION OF PROTEINS OR RNA MOLECULE BY NMR: 

UW-NMR WILL DETERMINE THE SOLUTION STRUCTURE OF PROTEINS OR RNA MOLECULES USING NUCLEAR MAGNETIC RESONANCE (NMR)-BASED METHODS. THESE TARGETS WILL ORIGINATE FROM NIAID CATEGORY A-C INFECTIOUS DISEASE ORGANISMS, AS WELL AS EMERGING AND RE-EMERGING DISEASES AND ONCE APPROVED BY NIAID WILL ENTER INTO THE SSGCID PIPELINE FOR TRACKING THE UW-NMR WORK. THE NMR SPECTROSCOPY WILL BE MAINLY DEDICATED TO PROTEINS SMALLER THAN ~25 KDA THAT FAIL TO PRODUCE DIFFRACTION QUALITY CRYSTALS. THE CANDIDATE TARGETS WILL PRIMARILY BE IDENTIFIED FROM COMMUNITY REQUESTS AND INTERNAL BATCHES; SPECIFICALLY, THESE WILL BE TARGETS OF INTEREST TO THE CENTER THAT COULD NOT BE DETERMINED USING CRYSTALLOGRAPHY. HOWEVER, DR. VARANI WILL ALSO IDENTIFY RELEVANT COLLABORATORS HIMSELF WHO ARE WILLING TO NOMINATE TARGETS TO THE NMR PIPELINE AND ARE WILLING TO COLLABORATE TO PUBLISH ANY RESULTS PRODUCED BY SSGCID, ESPECIALLY IN THE AREA OF BACTERIAL AND VIRAL NON CODING RNAS. UW-NMR MAY ALSO BE ASKED TO LEAD AND SUPPORT HIGH VALUE TARGET (HVT), COMMUNITY REQUEST PROJECT (CRP), HIGHEST IMPACT PROJECT (HIP) AND OTHER SPECIAL STUDIES WITHIN THE SSGCID PIPELINE, AS DECIDED BY THE SSGCID SCIENTIFIC LEADERSHIP TEAM, WHENEVER OPPORTUNITIES ARISE FOR ADVANCING SCIENTIFIC PROBLEMS THAT MIGHT BEST BE ADDRESSED BY NMR.

CANDIDATES SUITABLE FOR FURTHER EXAMINATION WILL BE IDENTIFIED FROM 1H-15N HSQC SPECTRA COLLECTED ON 15N-LABELED PROTEIN PREPARED BY UW-NMR. STANDARD TRIPLE RESONANCE EXPERIMENTS WILL BE PERFORMED TO ASSIGN THE BACKBONE AND THE SIDE CHAIN RESONANCES OF THE PROTEIN. ONCE THE RESONANCE ASSIGNMENTS ARE COMPLETE, NOE DATA CRUCIAL FOR OBTAINING DISTANCE RESTRAINTS WILL BE COLLECTED. NOE ASSIGNMENTS AND STRUCTURE CALCULATIONS WILL BE PERFORMED ITERATIVELY USING COMBINED AUTOMATED AND MANUAL METHODS. THE QUALITY OF THE FINAL SET OF STRUCTURES WILL BE ASSESSED AND ONCE THE FINAL ENSEMBLE OF STRUCTURES IS FOUND TO BE SATISFACTORY, THE COORDINATES OF THE ENSEMBLE AND THE MEAN STRUCTURE WILL BE DEPOSITED IN THE PROTEIN DATA BANK (PDB; HTTP://WWW.PDB.ORG) AND IMMEDIATELY RELEASED TO THE WORLD. AT THE SAME TIME, ALL 1H, 13C AND 15N CHEMICAL SHIFT DATA WILL BE DEPOSITED WITH THE BIOMAGNETIC RESEARCH BANK (BMRB; HTTP://WWW.BMRB.WISC.EDU/). MANUSCRIPTS THAT INCLUDE A DESCRIPTION OF THESE STRUCTURES WILL BE PUBLISHED IN AS TIMELY A FASHION AS IS POSSIBLE.


B.	LEAD ONE PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS AND RAPID RESPONSE TO OUTBREAKS/EPIDEMIC/PANDEMICS PROJECT. 
THE UN-NMR GROUP WILL LEAD A PROJECT ON STRUCTURAL CHARACTERIZATION OF AN ESSENTIAL RNA PACKAGING ELEMENT FROM THE INFLUENZA A VIRUS.

C.	QUALITY CONTROL, DATA COLLECTION AND REPORTING:

UW-NMR WILL ESTABLISH AND CONDUCT QUALITY CONTROL PROCEDURES AS NECESSARY TO ENSURE THE PRODUCTION OF HIGH QUALITY DATA ON WELL-DEFINED PROTEIN AND RNA SAMPLES. UW-NMR WILL ENSURE THAT THE STATUS OF ALL WORK PERFORMED FOR SSGCID IS UPDATED IN A TIMELY FASHION, THROUGH THE CENTRAL TARGET TRACKING DATABASE (CTTDB), TRACKING SPREADSHEETS AND/OR ANY OTHER TRACKING SYSTEM REQUIRED BY THE PROJECT. DR. VARANI WILL PARTICIPATE IN SSGCID PROJECT MEETINGS AND NIAID-REQUIRED MEETINGS TO ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF THE PROJECT. DR. VARANI WILL CONTRIBUTE TO QUARTERLY AND SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS AND ANY OTHER NIAID REQUIRED REPORTS AS NEEDED AND IN A TIMELY FASHION AND WILL CONDUCT THE PROJECT WORK WITH THE AIM OF PRODUCING IMPACTFUL PUBLICATIONS.

UW-NMR IS EXPECTED TO SOLVE AT LEAST 1 NMR STRUCTURE FROM THESE STUDIES DURING THIS CONTRACT YEAR.

AT LEAST ONE CRYOEM STRUCTURE IS EXPECTED FROM THIS WORK DURING THIS CONTRACT YEAR.

subaward_description:
UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON PROTEIN PRODUCTION GROUP (UW-PPG), UNDER THE DIRECTION OF WESLEY C. VAN VOORHIS, M.D., PH.D., WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING WORK TO SUPPORT THE BASIC PROJECT REQUIREMENT FROM SEPT 1, 2024 THROUGH AUG 31, 2025. UW-PPG WILL GENERATE TARGET CLONES, PERFORM SMALL- AND LARGE-SCALE SCREENING, UPSCALE EXPRESSION AND PURIFICATION OF THE CLONES AND SUPPORT OTHER SPECIAL STUDIES AS NEEDED. 

A.	 CLONING, EXPRESSION TESTING, UPSCALE AND PURIFICATION OF SSGCID TARGETS: 

UW-PPG WILL PERFORM CLONING MAINLY USING HTP TECHNOLOGIES AND PCR-BASED LIGATION INDEPENDENT CLONING INTO E. COLI EXPRESSION VECTORS OR DESIGN AND ORDER SYNTHETIC CONSTRUCTS. UW-PPG WILL SCREEN THEIR EXPRESSION AND SOLUBILITY PROPERTIES USING HTP TECHNOLOGIES AND PROTOCOLS, INCLUDING, AS NEEDED, MULTIPLE EXPRESSION SYSTEMS AND CLEAVAGE SYSTEMS. UW-PPG WILL GENERATE LARGE SCALE EXPRESSIONS OF TARGETS FOR HIGHLY PURIFIED TARGET PROTEINS OR PROTEIN FRAGMENTS AND PRODUCE THEM IN SUFFICIENT QUANTITY AND QUALITY FOR STRUCTURE DETERMINATION THROUGH STANDARDIZATION AND AUTOMATION OF PROTOCOLS. UW-PPG WILL EVALUATE THE PURITY, CONCENTRATION AND BIOPHYSICAL PROPERTIES (E.G. PROTEIN FOLDING, AGGREGATION, AND/OR STABILITY) OF THE PURIFIED SAMPLES TO ENHANCE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE STRUCTURE DETERMINATION EFFORTS.

UW-PPG WILL LEAD AND SUPPORT SEVERAL HIGH VALUE TARGETS (HVTS), COMMUNITY REQUEST PROJECTS (CRP), HIGHEST IMPACT PROJECTS (HIP) AND OTHER SPECIAL STUDIES WITHIN THE SSGCID PIPELINE, AS DECIDED BY THE SSGCID SCIENTIFIC LEADERSHIP TEAM (SLT).


B.	QUALITY CONTROL, DATA COLLECTION AND REPORTING:

UW-PPG WILL ESTABLISH AND CONDUCT QUALITY CONTROL PROCEDURES AS NECESSARY TO ENSURE THE PRODUCTION OF HIGH-QUALITY DATA. UW-PPG WILL ENSURE THAT THE STATUS OF ALL WORK PERFORMED FOR SSGCID IS UPDATED IN A TIMELY FASHION, THROUGH THE CENTRAL TARGET TRACKING DATABASE (CTTDB), TRACKING SPREADSHEETS AND/OR ANY OTHER TRACKING SYSTEM REQUIRED BY THE PROJECT. KEY UW-PPG STAFF WILL PARTICIPATE IN SSGCID PROJECT MEETINGS AND NIAID REQUIRED MEETINGS TO ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF THE PROJECT. UW-PPG WILL CONTRIBUTE TO QUARTERLY AND SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS AND ANY OTHER NIAID REQUIRED REPORTS AS NEEDED AND IN A TIMELY FASHION. UW-PPG WILL CONDUCT THEIR WORK WITH THE GOAL TO PUBLISH THEIR RESULTS IN HIGH IMPACT PUBLICATIONS.

subaward_description:
THE UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON CRYO-EM GROUP (UW-CRYOEM), UNDER THE DIRECTION OF DAVID VEESLER, PH.D., WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING WORK TO SUPPORT THE BASIC PROJECT REQUIREMENT. UW-CRYOEM WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SOLVING CRYOEM STRUCTURES DURING THIS CONTRACT YEAR (SEPT 1, 2024 THROUGH AUG 31, 2025). UW-CRYOEM MAY ALSO MANAGE (SHEPHERD) AND WILL SUPPORT OTHER SPECIAL STUDIES AS NEEDED. 

A.	STRUCTURE DETERMINATION OF PROTEINS OR PROTEIN COMPLEXES BY CRYOEM: 

UW-CRYOEM (DR. VEESLER) WILL DETERMINE THE STRUCTURE OF PROTEIN OR PROTEIN COMPLEXES USING CRYOEM AS A PART OF THIS SUBCONTRACT. THESE TARGET(S) WILL ORIGINATE FROM NIAID CATEGORY A-C INFECTIOUS DISEASE ORGANISMS, AS WELL AS EMERGING AND RE-EMERGING DISEASE AND ONCE APPROVED BY NIAID WILL ENTER THE SSGCID PIPELINE FOR TRACKING THE UW-CRYOEM WORK. THE TARGETS SELECTED WILL BE IMPACTFUL AND MAY BE MANAGED AS HIGH VALUE TARGET (HVT), COMMUNITY REQUEST PROJECT (CRP), HIGHEST IMPACT PROJECT (HIP) AND OTHER SPECIAL STUDIES WITHIN THE SSGCID PIPELINE. 

PROTEINS FROM VIRAL AND/OR EUKARYOTIC TARGETS WILL BE EXPRESSED IN BACULOVIRUS-INFECTED INSECT CELLS OR MAMMALIAN CELLS (HEK), WHILE BACTERIAL TARGETS (IF SELECTED FOR CRYOEM) WILL BE EXPRESSED IN E. COLI. THE MOLECULAR WEIGHT AND STOICHIOMETRY OF THE PURIFIED PROTEINS WILL BE CONFIRMED USING ANALYTICAL SEC COUPLED WITH MULTI-ANGLE LIGHT SCATTERING (SEC-MALS). THE HOMOGENEITY AND STRUCTURAL STABILITY OF THE PURIFIED PROTEINS WILL ALSO BE ASSESSED BY HIGH-THROUGHPUT NEGATIVE STAIN ELECTRON MICROSCOPY USING AN AUTOMATED DATA COLLECTION AND PROCESSING PIPELINE. PROMISING SAMPLES WILL BE FURTHER EVALUATED BY COMPUTING LOW-RESOLUTION THREE-DIMENSIONAL RECONSTRUCTIONS THAT DEMONSTRATE THE COMPOSITIONAL AND CONFORMATIONAL HETEROGENEITY OF EACH SAMPLE. THIS INFORMATION CAN ALSO BE USED TO GUIDE FURTHER CONSTRUCT SELECTION AND OPTIMIZATION OF THE EXPRESSION AND PURIFICATION CONDITIONS (IF NECESSARY). SAMPLES WILL BE VITRIFIED WITH AN FEI VITROBOT DEVICE TO PLUNGE-FREEZE GRIDS IN LIQUID ETHANE UNDER CAREFULLY CONTROLLED CONDITIONS. THE CRYOEM EXPERIMENTS WILL BE CARRIED OUT ON A TITAN KRIOS ELECTRON MICROSCOPE, EQUIPPED WITH A GATAN GIF ENERGY FILTER AND A K2 SUMMIT DIRECT ELECTRON DETECTOR. AUTOMATED DATA ACQUISITION AND PROCESSING ALLOWS A STREAMLINING OF ALL THE STEPS INVOLVED IN STRUCTURE DETERMINATION BY CRYOEM AT NEAR-ATOMIC RESOLUTION. THE LEGINON DATA COLLECTION SOFTWARE RUNS CONTINUOUSLY; ENABLING AUTOMATED TARGETING AND IMAGE ACQUISITION. LEGINON IS INTEGRATED WITH APPION, A DATA PROCESSING PIPELINE THAT CONNECTS DATA ACQUISITION TO PROCESSING ON A LOCAL CLUSTER, PROVIDING A RELATIONAL DATABASE OF ALL MICROGRAPHS TO EXPEDITE SUBSEQUENT PROCESSING. APPION AUTOMATES MANY IMAGE PROCESSING TASKS AND CREATES A SMOOTH WORKFLOW THAT ALLOWS REAL-TIME ASSESSMENT OF DATA QUALITY DURING ACQUISITION AND PREVENTS ERRORS BY TRACKING ALL THE DETAILS RELATED TO IMAGE ACQUISITION AND PROCESSING. 

B.	PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS AND RAPID RESPONSE TO OUTBREAKS/EPIDEMIC/PANDEMICS:

UW-CRYOEM WILL LEAD A STUDY ON THE COMPUTATIONAL DESIGN OF STABILIZED NIPAH VIRUS ATTACHMENT AND FUSION GLYCOPROTEINS.


C.	QUALITY CONTROL, DATA COLLECTION AND REPORTING:

UW-CRYOEM WILL ESTABLISH AND CONDUCT QUALITY CONTROL PROCEDURES AS NECESSARY TO ENSURE THE PRODUCTION OF HIGH-QUALITY DATA. UW-CRYOEM WILL ENSURE THAT THE STATUS OF ALL WORK PERFORMED FOR SSGCID IS UPDATED IN A TIMELY FASHION, THROUGH THE CENTRAL TARGET TRACKING DATABASE (CTTDB), TRACKING SPREADSHEETS AND/OR ANY OTHER TRACKING SYSTEM REQUIRED BY THE PROJECT. DR. VEESLER AND/OR STAFF FROM UW-CRYOEM WILL PARTICIPATE IN SSGCID PROJECT MEETINGS AND NIAID-REQUIRED MEETINGS AS REQUIRED TO ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF THE PROJECT. DR. VEESLER AND/OR STAFF FOMR UW-CRYOEM WILL CONTRIBUTE TO QUARTERLY AND SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS AND ANY OTHER NIAID REQUIRED REPORTS AS NEEDED AND IN A TIMELY FASHION AND WILL CONDUCT THE PROJECT WORK WITH THE AIM OF PRODUCING IMPACTFUL PUBLICATIONS.

TAKEN TOGETHER IN PARTS A AND B ABOVE, TE

prime_award_base_transaction_description: THE IDENTIFICATION AND VALIDATION OF EPITOPES CONSERVED IN VIRAL PATHOGEN FAMILIES WITH PANDEMIC POTENTIAL
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_dba_name: LA JOLLA INSTITUTE FOR ALLERGY & IMMUNOLOGY
subaward_description:
FOR EACH VIRAL FAMILY, JCVI WILL DEFINE SETS OF HIGHLY- AND MODERATELY-CONSERVED REGIONS FOR EACH PROTEIN AND TAXONOMIC GROUP, PARSED INTO CONSERVED 9-MER, 10-MER, AND 15-MER PEPTIDES. ACCORDINGLY, TO BIOINFORMATICALLY CHARACTERIZE THE SEQUENCE CONSERVATION OF IDENTIFIED EPITOPES ACROSS DIFFERENT VIRAL VARIANTS AND DIFFERENT VIRAL SPECIES DERIVED FROM EACH OF THE VIRAL FAMILIES OF CONCERN, WE WILL: 
1.	USE THE CD-HIT ALGORITHM TO CONTROL FOR THE IMPACT OF SAMPLING BIAS ON ESTIMATES, ENABLING US TO BOTH PROVIDE EFFECTIVE COVERAGE AND OPTIMAL T CELL INDUCTION, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME ALLOWING US TO ANTICIPATE THE NEXT OUTBREAK THAT COULD EMERGE FROM OTHER SOURCE SPECIES. 
2.	DOWNLOAD SEQUENCES FOR EACH OF THE PROTEINS FROM DIFFERENT VIRAL ISOLATES FROM THE BV-BRC DATABASE. SEQUENCES WILL BE PROCESSED USING CD-HIT AT DIFFERENT SIMILARITY THRESHOLDS. 
3.	EVALUATE THE RESULTING SEQUENCE SETS BY PHYLOGENETIC ANALYSIS TO SELECT THE OPTIMAL SEQUENCE SIMILARITY THRESHOLD THAT PROVIDES FOR EQUAL REPRESENTATION OF SEQUENCES WITH LONG AND SHORT BRANCH LENGTHS. 
4.	PRODUCE A COLLECTION OF SEQUENCES FOR EACH OF THE PROTEINS AND TAXONOMIC GROUPS THAT EQUALLY REPRESENTS THE SEQUENCE DIVERSITY OF THE GROUP. 
5.	UTILIZE MUSCLE TO ALIGN PROTEIN SEQUENCES FROM EACH COLLECTION. 
6.	CALCULATE THE EXTENT OF SEQUENCE CONSERVATION/VARIATION AT EACH ALIGNED POSITION USING THREE METRICS: PERCENT IDENTITY TO THE CONSENSUS RESIDUE, AVERAGE BLOSUM SCORE IN COMPARISON WITH THE CONSENSUS RESIDUE, AND ENTROPY SCORE. 
7.	IDENTIFY PROTEIN REGIONS OF CONSERVATION USING THE MEDIAN VALUE OF EACH OF THESE METRICS IN A SLIDING WINDOW OF 10 RESIDUES. 
8.	EVALUATE THE DISTRIBUTIONS OF EACH METRIC TO ESTABLISH CUTOFFS FOR DEFINING REGIONS WITH HIGH AND MODERATE SEQUENCE CONSERVATION FOR EACH OF THE PROTEIN AND TAXONOMIC GROUPS, AND THE RESULTS COMBINED TO DERIVE A CONSENSUS CONSERVATION SCORE. IF THE APPROACH FOR SELECTING CONSERVATION SCORE CUTOFFS PRODUCES TOO MANY OR TOO FEW CANDIDATE REGIONS, WE WILL MANUALLY ADJUST THE CONSERVATION SCORE CUTOFFS TO PRODUCE A REASONABLE NUMBER OF CANDIDATE EPITOPES/REGIONS. 
9.	DERIVE CONSENSUS REGION/SEQUENCE FOR EACH GROUP, AND THEN PARSE EACH INTO 9-MER, 10-MER, AND 15-MER PEPTIDES. 
10.	PREPARE REPORTS REGARDING THE SEQUENCE CONSERVATION ANALYSIS FOR SUBMISSION TO NIH. 
11.	CONTRIBUTE TO MANUSCRIPT PREPARATION DESCRIBING THE ANALYSIS FOR SCIENTIFIC PUBLICATION IN PEER-REVIEWED JOURNALS. 
12.	PARTICIPATE IN ANNUAL SCIENTIFIC REVIEW MEETINGS AS NEEDED.

subawardee_business_types: U.S. LOCAL GOVERNMENT,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
SITE PI WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR JOINING CALLS AND TEAM MEETINGS WITH THE COORDINATING CENTER IN MINNEAPOLIS AND WITH THE BROADER USRDS STEERING COMMITTEE. THEY WILL ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO AN ANNUAL CHAPTER ON PATIENT-IMPORTANT OUTCOMES IN THE USRDS ANNUAL REPORT. IN THIS CHAPTER THEY WILL DESCRIBE THE RESULTS OF ONGOING LINKAGE TO VITAL STATUS AND UTILIZATION DATA FROM USRDS/MEDICARE CLAIMS TO DATA COLLECTED FROM PATIENTS ON DIALYSIS AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS AS PART OF THE USRDS STUDY OF TREATMENT PREFERENCES. THIS INCLUDES INFORMATION ON SYMPTOM BURDEN, PALLIATIVE CARE NEEDS, SELF-REPORTED HEALTH STATUS, TREATMENT PREFERENCES, PROGNOSTIC AWARENESS, AND READINESS TO ENGAGE IN ADVANCE CARE PLANNING.

REPORTING REQUIREMENTS:
SUBCONTRACTOR SHALL SUBMIT TECHNICAL AND PROGRESS REPORTS AS REQUIRED BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR OF THE PTE TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE REPORTING OBLIGATIONS TO THE FEDERAL AWARDING AGENCY. A PTE REPRESENTATIVE WILL PROVIDE ADVANCE NOTICE FOR ANY SUCH REPORTS, ACKNOWLEDGING THAT DUE DATES MAY VARY THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT.

subaward_description: SUPPORT ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE CHILD CARE AND EARLY EDUCATION POLICY RESEARCH CONSORTIUM, INCLUDING VIRTUAL CONVENINGS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR (ROUGHLY ONCE PER MONTH) AND A BIANNUAL MEETING. SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR VIRTUAL CONVENINGS WILL INCLUDE DEFINING TOPIC/FOCUS OF MEETING, PREPARING AGENDAS AND MEETING MATERIALS, COORDINATING WITH PRESENTERS AND FACILITATING MEETING, AS WELL AS DISSEMINATING MEETING MATERIALS FOLLOWING THE CONVENING. SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR THE BIANNUAL MEETING WILL INCLUDE ESTABLISHING A PLANNING PROCESS, SUPPORTING PLANNING GROUPS, DRAFTING/UPDATING PLANNING GUIDANCE AND OTHER MEETING MATERIALS (E.G. PROGRAM AGENDA, ACF PROJECT BRIEF MATRIX, MEETING EVALUATION FORM, WELCOME LETTER, SESSION MATERIALS), PROVIDING ONSITE MEETING SUPPORT, FACILITATING WRAP UP OF MEETING AND ARCHIVING OF MATERIALS ON RESEARCH CONNECTIONS.
