SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR VIRTUAL CONVENINGS WILL INCLUDE DEFINING TOPIC/FOCUS OF MEETING, PREPARING AGENDAS AND MEETING MATERIALS, COORDINATING WITH PRESENTERS AND FACILITATING MEETING, AS WELL AS DISSEMINATING MEETING MATERIALS FOLLOWING THE CONVENING. SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR THE BIANNUAL MEETING WILL INCLUDE ESTABLISHING A PLANNING PROCESS, SUPPORTING PLANNING GROUPS, DRAFTING/UPDATING PLANNING GUIDANCE AND OTHER MEETING MATERIALS (E.G. PROGRAM AGENDA, ACF PROJECT BRIEF MATRIX, MEETING EVALUATION FORM, WELCOME LETTER, SESSION MATERIALS), PROVIDING ONSITE MEETING SUPPORT, FACILITATING WRAP UP OF MEETING AND ARCHIVING OF MATERIALS ON RESEARCH CONNECTIONS.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: STRATEGIC SERVICES IN SUPPORT OF A DATA MANAGEMENT CENTER OF EXCELLENCE (DMCOE)
prime_award_naics_description: ALL OTHER PROFESSIONAL, SCIENTIFIC, AND TECHNICAL SERVICES
subaward_description: THIS STAKEHOLDER RESEARCH WILL SERVE AS A FOUNDATIONAL STEP IN DEVELOPING A COMPREHENSIVE STRATEGIC ENGAGEMENT PLAN AND A THEORY OF CHANGE AIMED AT PROMOTING THE ADOPTION OF FAIR DATA MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, ESPECIALLY WITHIN MINORITY SERVING INSTITUTIONS (MSIS) AND HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES (HBCUS). BY DEEPLY ANALYZING THE FACTORS THAT INFLUENCE RESEARCHERSÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢ DECISIONS TO EITHER SUPPORT, ADOPT, REJECT, OR OVERLOOK FAIR PRINCIPLES, THE RESEARCH WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL INSIGHTS INTO THE BARRIERS AND MOTIVATORS SPECIFIC TO THESE COMMUNITIES. UNDERSTANDING THESE DYNAMICS WILL ALLOW US TO TAILOR ENGAGEMENT STRATEGIES THAT ADDRESS UNIQUE CHALLENGES FACED BY RESEARCHERS AT MSIS AND HBCUS, ENSURING THAT THE INITIATIVES ARE NOT ONLY RELEVANT BUT ALSO CULTURALLY AND CONTEXTUALLY APPROPRIATE. THIS APPROACH WILL HELP FOSTER A MORE INCLUSIVE AND EQUITABLE ENVIRONMENT FOR THE WIDESPREAD ADOPTION OF FAIR DATA MANAGEMENT AND SHARING PRACTICES.

subaward_description: LIBRARY CARPENTRY IS A COMMUNITY THAT TEACHES LIBRARY AND INFORMATION PROFESSIONALS COMPUTATIONAL SKILLS FOR MANAGING AND EXPLORING DATA. ITS MISSION IS TO EMPOWER THESE PROFESSIONALS TO USE SOFTWARE AND DATA EFFECTIVELY AND ADVOCATE FOR BEST PRACTICES IN RESEARCH DATA MANAGEMENT. WORKSHOPS, LED BY CERTIFIED INSTRUCTORS FROM THE CARPENTRIES, TARGET INDIVIDUALS WITH LITTLE TO NO EXPERIENCE IN COMPUTATIONAL METHODS. LIBRARY CARPENTRY IS WELL-EQUIPPED TO DEVELOP AND DELIVER A WORKSHOP ON RESEARCH DATA MANAGEMENT, AND WILL PROVIDE EXPERTISE, CURRICULUM SUPPORT, AND TRAINING TO THE NIH THROUGH THE CARPENTRIES, A FISCALLY-SPONSORED PROJECT OF COMMUNITY INITIATIVES.

subaward_description:
THE I LEAD PROGRAM IS A LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE DESIGNED TO ENHANCE PARTICIPANTS' SKILLS IN NAVIGATING CHANGE AND COMPETING PRIORITIES. IT FOCUSES ON A VARIETY OF KEY LEADERSHIP TOPICS (E.G., INTEREST-BASED NEGOTIATION, RESULTS-BASED ACCOUNTABILITY, SITUATIONAL LEADERSHIP, EMOTIONAL INTELLIGENCE, AND OTHERS). THE PROGRAM SPANS UP TO 12 MONTHS AND INCLUDES FIVE GROUP TRAINING SESSIONS, EACH 6 HOURS IN LENGTH. THROUGHOUT THE PROGRAM, PARTICIPANTS SHALL REFINE AND APPLY THEIR LEADERSHIP SKILLS THROUGH NINE ONE-ON-ONE COACHING SESSIONS AND NINE FOUR COLLABORATIVE SKILLS TEAM MEETINGS, WHICH SHALL BE CONDUCTED IN SMALL GROUPS.

THE PROGRAM INCLUDES UP TO 25 FEDERAL EMPLOYEES AT GS 14 AND 15 LEVELS, AND T42 (OR EQUIVALENT). DPCPSI OVERSEES THE APPLICATION AND SELECTION PROCESS FOR THE 25 PARTICIPANTS.

THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE TWO COACHES FOR THE I LEAD PROGRAM. YOSI WILL COACH FOUR COACHEES, AND PATTY WILL COACH FIVE COACHEES. SPECIFICALLY, THE CONTRACTOR COACHES SHALL:
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	ATTEND THE TWO-HOUR PROGRAM ORIENTATION SESSION FROM 8-10 ET ON 01/14/25
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	CONDUCT NINE ONE-HOUR INDIVIDUAL COACHING SESSIONS BEGINNING IN JANUARY 2025 FOR EACH COACHEE (36 TO 45 TOTAL SESSIONS)
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	DEBRIEF 360 SURVEY RESULTS WITH EACH COACHEE DURING ONE OF THE COACHING SESSIONS (FMP WILL ADMINISTER THE 360 AND PROVIDE THE COACH THE REPORT)
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	LEAD FOUR GROUP "SKILLS TEAM" MEETINGS WHERE THE COACH MEETS WITH THEIR FOUR COACHEES TO HELP THEM APPLY CONCEPTS FROM THE TRAINING PROGRAM (4 TOTAL HOURS).

THE FOLLOWING CHANGES AND AMENDMENTS ARE MADE TO THE SUBCONTRACT:
1) AMENDMENT TO PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE IS AMENDED AS FOLLOWS:
THE TERM OF THIS AMENDMENT HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERMS AND PERFORMANCE PERIOD OF FEDERAL CONTRACT #75R60220C00011 FROM THE HEALTH RESOURCES AND SERVICES ADMINISTRATION.  THEREFORE, THIS AMENDMENT SHALL BE EFFECTIVE 09/21/2024 THROUGH 09/20/2025 FOR OPTION PERIOD 4 OF THE SUBCONTRACT.
2) AMENDMENT TO SECTION B.2 COMPENSATION COST/PRICE. SECTION B.2 (D) IS REMOVED AND REPLACED AS FOLLOWS:
(E) OPTION PERIOD FOUR (SEPTEMBER 21, 2024 - SEPTEMBER 20, 2025)
THE COST TO THE GOVERNMENT FOR FULL PERFORMANCE OF OPTION PERIOD FOUR UNDER THIS SUBCONTRACT WILL BE $21,910. BUDGET FOR OPTION PERIOD 4 IS ATTACHED TO THIS AGREEMENT AND INCORPORATED AS OUTLINED IN ATTACHMENT
A.1 STATEMENT OF WORK IN ORIGINAL AGREEMENT.
* TASKS FOR OP4:
** TASK 3: ANALYTIC SUPPORT 25%
** TASK 12: PUBLICATIONS 75%
3) ATTACHMENT C. IS REQUIRED TO BE COMPLETED AND SUBMITTED WITH ALL INVOICES FOR OPTION PERIOD 4.  A FILLABLE FORM WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE SUBCONTRACTOR AS A SEPARATE ATTACHMENT.

prime_award_naics_description: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES
subawardee_business_types: PRIVATE UNIVERSITY OR COLLEGE,NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description: GEORGETOWN UNIVERSITY'S CENTER FOR CHILD AND HUMAN DEVELOPMENT WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE UNIVERSAL AND INDIVIDUALIZED TA TO MATERNAL INFANT AND EARLY CHILDHOOD HOME VISITING STATE AND TERRITORY AWARDEES.  IN PARTICULAR, GUCCHD STAFF WILL HOLD REGULAR MEETINGS WITH AWARDEES; HELP AWARDEES ASSESS PRIORITIES AND DEVELOP IMPROVEMENT PLANS; DELIVER TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ASSIGNED REGIONS AND OTHER AWARDEES ON TOPICS RELATED TO THEIR RESPECTIVE AREAS OF EXPERTISE; CREATE NEW ENGAGEMENT TOOLS, AND OTHERWISE CONTRIBUTE TO PROJECT-WIDE RESOURCES; SERVE AS SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS IN COMMUNITIES OF PRACTICE; CONTRIBUTE SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE, AS NEEDED, TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE TARC UNIVERSAL PLAN AND PRODUCTS / ACTIVITIES; AND ASSIST WITH OTHER PROJECT TASKS AS REQUIRED.

prime_award_program_activities_funding_t: 0001: MEDICARE INTEGRITY PROGRAM
prime_awardee_business_types: Foreign Owned,For Profit Organization
prime_award_base_transaction_description: IGF::OT::IGF THE CERT PROGRAM CALCULATES BI-ANNUAL IMPROPER PAYMENT RATES BASED ON THE RESULTS OF THE REVIEWS CONDUCTED. THESE RATES INCLUDE AN OVERALL NATIONAL MEDICARE FFS IMPROPER PAYMENT RATE AND IMPROPER PAYMENT RATES FOR EACH CLAIM TYPE [PART A INPATIENT HOSPITAL PROSPECTIVE PAYMENT SYSTEM (PPS); PART A EXCLUDING INPATIENT HOSPITAL PPS; PART B; AND DURABLE MEDICAL EQUIPMENT, PROSTHETICS, ORTHOTICS, AND SUPPLIES (DMEPOS)].  THE CERT PROGRAM ENSURES A STATISTICALLY VALID RANDOM SAMPLE; THEREFORE, THE IMPROPER PAYMENT RATE CALCULATED FROM THIS SAMPLE IS CONSIDERED TO BE   REFLECTIVE OF ALL OF CLAIMS PROCESSED BY MEDICARE FFS PROGRAM DURING THE REPORT PERIOD. CMS ALSO USES THE CERT PROGRAM TO PERFORM SPECIAL STUDIES AND SUPPLEMENTAL MEASUREMENTS TO DETERMINE THE IMPROPER PAYMENT RATES OF PARTICULAR CLAIM TYPES. CALCULATIONS OF THESE RATES FACILITATE CMS ABILITY TO TAKE APPROPRIATE CORRECTIVE ACTIONS TO REDUCE IMPROPER PAYMENTS.

subaward_description: SERVICE

prime_award_base_transaction_description: PROVIDE DEFINITIVE EVIDENCE ON THE EFFECTIVENESS, SAFETY, AND MECHANISMS OF LOW TITER GROUP O WHOLE BLOOD (LTOWB) AND TRANEXAMIC ACID (TXA) AS RESUSCITATION STRATEGIES FOR THE TREATMENT OF LIFE-THREATENING BLEEDING SECONDARY TO TRAUMATIC INJURY IN CH
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT NANOTECHNOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_business_types: OTHER NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION,1862 LAND GRANT COLLEGE,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description: [THE MATIC-2 TRIAL IS A BAYESIAN, RANDOMIZED, MULTICENTER, ADAPTIVE PLATFORM PHASE III TRIAL. THE TRIAL WILL INCLUDE INJURED CHILDREN WITH HEMORRHAGIC SHOCK ANTICIPATED TO REQUIRE MASSIVE BLOOD TRANSFUSION, WHO WILL BE RANDOMIZED TO RECEIVE EITHER LTOWB OR CT AND TRANEXAMIC ACID OR PLACEBO.  IT'S HYPOTHESIZED THAT THE USE OF LTOWB IS NON-INFERIOR AND/OR SUPERIOR FOR 24-HOUR MORTALITY AND THAT LTOWB DOES NOT INCREASE THE RISK OF ADVERSE EVENTS OR OUTCOMES, SUCH AS THROMBOTIC EVENTS, COMPARED TO CT. IT'S ALSO HYPOTHESIZED THAT THE USE OF TXA IS SUPERIOR FOR 24-HOUR MORTALITY AND DOES NOT INCREASE THE RISK OF ADVERSE EVENTS OR OUTCOMES, SUCH AS THROMBOTIC EVENTS, COMPARED TO PLACEBO.  THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES ARE TO   1.   DETERMINE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF LTOWB TO REDUCE ALL-CAUSE 24-HOUR MORTALITY COMPARED TO CT IN CHILDREN WITH TRAUMATIC LIFE-THREATENING HEMORRHAGE.  2.   DETERMINE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF TXA TO REDUCE ALL-CAUSE 24-HOUR MORTALITY COMPARED TO PLACEBO IN CHILDREN WITH TRAUMATIC LIFE-THREATENING HEMORRHAGE.  SECONDARY OBJECTIVES ARE TO DETERMINE THE EFFECTIVENESS AND SAFETY OF LTOWB AND TXA TO IMPROVE SECONDARY AND EXPLORATORY OUTCOMES (OR ENDPOINTS) IN CHILDREN WITH TRAUMATIC LIFE-THREATENING HEMORRHAGE.   SAFETY OBJECTIVES ARE TO DETERMINE THE EFFECT OF LTOWB AND TXA ON SAFETY RELATED OUTCOMES/ENDPOINTS.   MECHANISTIC OBJECTIVES ARE TO:  1. DEFINE TRAUMA INDUCED COAGULOPATHY (TIC) ACCORDING TO MEASURES OF SHOCK, HEMOSTASIS, AND ENDOTHELIAL AND IMMUNE FUNCTION.  2. TO DETERMINE IF MEASURES OF SHOCK, ENDOTHELIAL, IMMUNE, AND HEMOSTASIS FUNCTION UPON ADMISSION (TIC ENDOTYPE) PREDICTS WHICH HEMOSTATIC RESUSCITATION THERAPIES OR COMBINATIONS OF THERAPIES (LTOWB, CT, LTOWB + TXA, CT+TXA) FOR EACH STUDY GROUP IMPROVES OUTCOMES WITHOUT INCREASING THE RISK OF ADVERSE EVENTS.  3. TO DETERMINE THE MECHANISMS OF HOW HEMOSTATIC RESUSCITATION THERAPIES OR COMBINATIONS OF THERAPIES (LTOWB, CT, LTOWB + TXA, CT+TXA) IMPROVE TIC ENDOTYPES AND OUTCOMES.  PHARMACOKINETIC OBJECTIVES ARE TO EVALUATE THE PK AND PD PROPERTIES OF TXA IN A POPULATION OF CHILDREN WITH LIFETHREATENING TRAUMATIC BLEEDING.  ]

subaward_description: THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE DEFINITIVE EVIDENCE ON THE EFFECTIVENESS, SAFETY, AND MECHANISMS OF LOW TITER GROUP O WHOLE BLOOD (LTOWB) AND TRANEXAMIC ACID (TXA) AS RESUSCITATION STRATEGIES FOR THE TREATMENT OF LIFETHREATENING BLEEDING SECONDARY TO TRAUMATIC INJURY IN CHILDREN. THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THIS CONTRACT INCLUDES CLINICAL ACTIVITIES (THE CONDUCT OF A MULTICENTER RANDOMIZED CLINICAL TRIAL IN CHILDREN) AS WELL AS RELATED REGULATORY ACTIVITIES (OBTAINING IND FROM FDA FOR USE OF EXCEPTION TO INFORMED CONSENT (EFIC) THAT IS REQUIRED FOR THE CLINICAL TRIAL, AND SINGLE IRB APPROVAL TO ENSURE ETHICAL AND APPROPRIATE CONDUCT OF THE CLINICAL TRIAL).

subaward_description:
THE UM TEAM WILL PROVIDE RESEARCH AND EVALUATION EXPERTISE TO THE STUDY INVESTIGATORS AND OTHER PROJECT STAFF MEMBERS. THE UM STAFF WILL ATTEND ALL WEEKLY STAFF MEETINGS AND REQUIRED MEETINGS/TRAININGS WITH THE CDC. THE PROGRAM MANAGER WILL REVIEW AND ASSIST WITH ALL DATA 
COLLECTION ACTIVITIES AND ALL RELATED RESEARCH TASKS, INCLUDING ASSISTING IN THE ANALYSIS OF THE DATA SETS RELATING TO CARDIAC AND CARDIOVASCULAR HEALTH AND PREPARING MANUSCRIPTS RELATED TO THESE MEASURES. THEY WILL ENSURE THAT ALL STAFF MEMBERS AND PERTINENT PARTNERS WHO ADMINISTER INSTRUMENTS FOLLOW ALL CITI HUMAN SUBJECTSÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢ PROTOCOLS, WHICH INCLUDE ELEMENTS OF SUBJECT PROTECTION, INCLUDING THE HISTORY, ETHICS, AND RULES REGARDING PROTECTING SUBJECTS. ALSO, ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL FOLLOW ALL CONFIDENTIALITY PRACTICES. THEY WILL ASSIST WITH ALL LEVELS OF RECRUITMENT  AND  COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT,  STRATEGIC  PLANNING,  TECHNICAL  ASSISTANCE,  AND  PARTNER ENGAGEMENT. THE PROGRAM 
MANAGER WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH ALL STAFF TO MONITOR ALL PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDING RECRUITMENT EFFORTS, DATA COLLECTION, PATIENT FOLLOW-UP, AND THAT INCENTIVES ARE PROVIDED IN THE FORM OF GIFT CARDS AND MEDICAL REPORTS. THE PROGRAM MANAGER WILL ASSIST WITH FOLLOWING ALL PROJECT TIMELINES AND ENSURING THAT PARTICIPANTS ARE CONTACTED FOR ALL FOLLOW-UP ASSESSMENTS AND APPOINTMENTS.
THE PROGRAM MANAGER WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH ALL PROJECT STAFF TO DISCUSS REPORTING FORMS AND DASHBOARDS, RECRUITMENT, SURVEY ADMINISTRATION, DATA COLLECTION, MEDICAL APPTS FOR PARTICIPANTS IN THE PHENOTYPING STUDY, AND OTHER IMPORTANT PROJECT ELEMENTS. THE PROGRAM MANAGER WILL ASSIST IN THE MANAGEMENT OF DATA COLLECTED BY PROJECT STAFF TO REPORT ON THE REQUIRED PERFORMANCE MEASURES, INCLUDING OBJECTIVES. PROVIDE ONGOING FEEDBACK AND REPORTS TO THE PROJECT STAFF AND STAKEHOLDERS ON PRELIMINARY OUTCOMES. CONTINUALLY REVIEW PROGRAM GOALS ON NUMBERS SERVED, COMPLETION RATES, AND BARRIERS TO PROGRAMMING BY ANALYZING REPORTS AND CONDUCTING MEETINGS WITH STAFF. CONTACT PROJECT 
STAFF WEEKLY REGARDING ALL ASPECTS OF THE PROGRAM TO COLLECT AND REVIEW NEW PROCESS DATA, DISCUSS THE REVIEW OF THE PROCESS AND OUTCOME DATA FROM PREVIOUS WEEKS, AND REVIEW THE PROGRAMÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S STATED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES TO SEE IF THEY ARE BEING MET OR IF PROGRAM ADJUSTMENTS ARE NECESSARY TO ACHIEVE THOSE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES. CONDUCT SITE VISITS AND MEETINGS WITH ALL PARTNERS AS PART OF THE MANAGEMENT OF THE PROJECT.
ENSURE PROJECT STAFF REVIEW AND PROVIDE ALL MEDICAL REPORTS TO THE PARTICIPANTS AS PART OF THEIR INCENTIVE PACKAGE. THE PROGRAM MANAGER WILL ASSIST IN MAKING SURE REPORTS ARE SENT IN A TIMELY FASHION. ENTER OUTCOME AND PROCESS DATA INTO ALL PROJECT DASHBOARDS. REVIEW DASHBOARDS REGULARLY TO MONITOR ALL PROJECT-RELATED ACTIVITIES. PERFORM REGULAR DATA CHECKS AND TRANSFER THE DATA TO SPSS TO PERFORM DATA ANALYSIS. REPORT SEMIANNUAL AND ANNUAL FINDINGS ON PROGRAM GOALS, OBJECTIVES, AND OUTCOMES. USE PERFORMANCE MEASURE DATA TO MAKE CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS. AS MENTIONED, EVALUATE THE IMPLEMENTATION AND OUTCOMES OF PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. PROVIDE INPUT TO THE QUARTERLY AND ANNUAL REPORTS SUBMITTED TO THE CDC AND PERFORM A QUARTERLY REVIEW OF DATA TO ASSESS FOR QUALITY AND INTERIM ANALYSES.

CONTINUALLY LOOK FOR MEANS OF COMMUNICATING PROJECT ACTIVITIES, PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVEMENTS, AND LIMITATIONS TO THE MEDICAL, HUMAN SERVICE, AND RESEARCH FIELDS THROUGH PEER-REVIEWED JOURNALS, LOCAL AND NATIONAL PRESENTATIONS AND PUBLICATIONS, PUBLIC FORUMS, SOCIAL MEDIA, ETC. DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A SUSTAINABILITY PLAN TO ENSURE THE CONTINUATION OF PROGRAM EFFORTS BEYOND THE GRANT.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: FY22 BAA TOPIC 7 - UNIV OF WISCONSIN
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT NANOTECHNOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description:
IN COLLABORATION WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN-MADISON AND ESTABLISHED KEY COMMUNITY PARTNERS IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY, THE CITY OF MILWAUKEE HEALTH DEPARTMENT LABORATORY (MHDL) WILL CONDUCT WHOLE GENOME SEQUENCING FOR SARS-COV-2 TO EVALUATE THE IMPACTS OF VACCINATION STATUS, GEOGRAPHIC SETTING, AND SOCIODEMOGRAPHIC FEATURES ON VIRAL TRANSMISSION AND EVOLUTION. MHDLÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S EFFORTS WILL FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING KEY POPULATIONS IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY: URBAN AND UP-TO-DATE ON VACCINATION AT THE TIME OF SAMPLING AND URBAN NOT-UP-TO-DATE.
AS STATED IN THE FULL PROJECT STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW), A PRIMARY DELIVERABLE FOR THIS PROJECT WILL BE ATTEMPTING TO COLLECTIVELY GENERATE 32,000 SARS-COV-2 GENOME SEQUENCES FROM METADATA-TARGETED SPECIMENS FROM THE STATES OF MINNESOTA, MICHIGAN, AND WISCONSIN. FOR MILWAUKEE URBAN AREAS, THIS WILL NOT ONLY ADDRESS SIGNIFICANT REGIONAL AND LOCAL DIFFERENCES IN SARS-COV-2 VACCINATION RATES BUT ALSO WILL ALLOW CONSISTENT SAMPLING FROM UNDERSERVED OR LIMITED ACCESS COMMUNITIES TO UNDERSTAND HOW TRENDS IN VACCINE RATES AND VIRAL DYNAMICS INTERACT OVER TIME. MHDL WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SEQUENCING APPROXIMATELY 2,000 SPECIMENS PER YEAR IN MILWAUKEE COUNTY, INCLUDING BOTH THE AFFLUENT MILWAUKEE COUNTY NEIGHBORHOODS THAT HAVE HIGHER VACCINATION RATES, AND THOSE THAT HAVE LOWER VACCINATION RATES, INCLUDING RESIDENTS LIVING IN POVERTY. MHDL WILL ALSO OBTAIN CLINICAL SPECIMENS FROM 3 MHD CLINIC LOCATIONS, AS WELL AS PROCESS REFERRAL SPECIMENS FROM 3 LOCAL REFERENCE COVID TESTING LABORATORIES IN THE METRO-MILWAUKEE AREA. ADDITIONALLY, SPECIMENS WILL BE RECEIVED FROM TWO OF THE LOCAL UNIVERSITYÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S STUDENT HEALTH CENTERS (UW-MILWAUKEE AND MARQUETTE UNIVERSITY) AND COVID SHELTERS IN MILWAUKEE. PRIMARY SAMPLING GUIDELINES WILL BE THROUGH THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH SERVICES Ã¢Â‚¬Å“COVID-19 HEALTH ALERT # 25: SURVEILLANCE FOR NEW GENETIC VARIANTS OF SARS-COV-2: INFORMATION FOR CLINICIANS,Ã¢Â‚¬Ï¿½ WHICH AUTHORIZES SARS-COV-2 TESTING PROVIDERS TO SHARE RESIDUAL SAMPLES FROM INDIVIDUALS WITH IMMUNE FAILURE, AS WELL AS FROM ITS HIGH-RISK COVID-19 SURVEILLANCE SITES, INCLUDING MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAILS, DETENTION CENTERS, CORRECTIONAL FACILITIES, HOMELESS SHELTERS, GROUP HOMES, AND OTHER COMMUNITY SETTINGS. ALL OF THOSE SITES ARE CURRENTLY MILWAUKEE HEALTH DEPARTMENT LABORATORY COVID-19 SURVEILLANCE SITES.

subaward_description:
SUBCONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE PRIME CONTRACTOR THE SERVICES IN SUPPORT OF THE CONTRACT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH BELOW: 
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	PRIME CONTRACTOR WILL FACILITATE FULL COLLABORATION BETWEEN ALL TEAM MEMBERS INCLUDING SPECIFICATION TEAM, TESTING TEAM, AND CLINICAL TEAM.
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	SERVE AS CLINICAL LEAD ACROSS ALL CQMS AND ECQMS BEING DEVELOPED, RE-TOOLED, OR MAINTAINED UNDER THE EC CONTRACT. THIS INCLUDES EXPERTISE FROM INTERNAL MEDICINE, PEDIATRICS, FAMILY MEDICINE, PSYCHIATRY, OBSTETRICS/GYNECOLOGY), AND CONSULTATION AS NEEDED WITH UP TO 30 CLINICAL SPECIALTIES, TO CONDUCT CLINICAL REVIEWS OF MEASURE CONCEPTS, MEASURE SPECIFICATIONS, AND ANNUAL MEASURE UPDATES FOR BOTH ELECTRONIC CLINICAL QUALITY MEASURES (ECQMS) AND OTHER CLINICAL QUALITY MEASURES (CQMS).

prime_award_base_transaction_description: EBOLA VIRUS AND OTHER INFECTIOUS DISEASES
prime_award_naics_description: FACILITIES SUPPORT SERVICES
subawardee_business_types: MINORITY-OWNED BUSINESS,FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION,VETERAN OWNED BUSINESS,BLACK AMERICAN OWNED
subaward_description:
SUBCONTRACTOR WILL BE TASKED TO PROVIDE RAPID DEPLOYMENT OF TECHNICAL, OPERATIONAL, AND CLINICAL RESEARCH RESOURCES AND EXPERTISE FOR THIS TIME-SENSITIVE INITIATIVE. THE PROTOCOL IS TITLED, ASSESSMENT OF IMMUNE RESPONSE TO EBOLA VIRUS DISEASE AS MODULATED BY VACCINES AND MEDICAL COUNTERMEASURES, AND IS ALSO KNOWN AS PALM 005. THE SCOPE OF WORK INCLUDES BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO: STRATEGIC AND OPERATIONAL PLANNING AND HUMAN RESOURCES MANAGEMENT; INFRASTRUCTURE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE; LOGISTICS AND PROCUREMENT MANAGEMENT; SITE DEVELOPMENT TO ENSURE ALL CLINICAL SITES REMAIN IN A STATE OF PREPAREDNESS AND COMPLIANCE WITH PROTOCOL REQUIREMENTS; INITIATING AND COMPLETING ENROLLMENT AND FOLLOW-UP FOR THE CLINICAL RESEARCH PROTOCOL; OVERALL MANAGEMENT AND OVERSIGHT OF THE CONDUCT OF THE MOBILIZATION, PSYCHOSOCIAL SUPPORT AND COMMUNICATIONS EFFORTS; AND OTHER ACTIVITIES SUCH AS LABORATORY SERVICES AND PHARMACY SUPPORT. THE SPECIFIC SUPPORT TO EBOLA OUTBREAK #14 IN THE EQUATOR PROVINCE IS TO COVER GAPS IN THE SAFE ADMINISTRATION OF INVESTIGATIONAL PRODUCT UNTIL SUPPORT OF OTHER EBOLA RESPONSE PARTNERS HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED IN THIS REGION. THE CURRENT PORTFOLIO OF PALM RESEARCH STUDIES TO SUPPORT IN THIS SOW INCLUDES:
PALM 010 MPOX VACCINE RANDOMIZED CONTROLLED TRIAL INITIATION PHASE
PALM 007 EXTENSION: A SINGLE-ARM, OPEN-LABEL EXTENSION TO THE PALM007 RANDOMIZED CONTROLLED TRIAL FOR FURTHER CLINICAL CHARACTERIZATION OF THE NATURAL HISTORY OF MPOX.

prime_award_program_activities_funding_t: 0006: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES (0885)
prime_award_base_transaction_description: TO IDENTIFY NOVEL ADJUVANT CANDIDATES THAT CAN BE USED TO AUGMENT THE EFFICACY OF HUMAN VACCINES.
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description:
THE ADJUVANT DISCOVERY CONTRACT PROPOSED HEREIN WILL IDENTIFY, CHARACTERIZE, AND ADVANCE NOVEL
SYNTHETIC IL-1R-BASED ADJUVANTS FOR USE IN COMBINATION WITH AN INFLUENZA VACCINE TO INDUCE RAPID AND
SUSTAINED BROADLY PROTECTIVE IMMUNITY TO SEASONAL AND/OR PANDEMIC INFLUENZA VIRUS. THIS PROPOSAL BRINGS
TOGETHER HIGHLY EXPERIENCED RESEARCH TEAMS FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF MONTANA, DUKE UNIVERSITY, THE ICAHN
SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI AND INIMMUNE CORPORATION, EACH WITH UNIQUE EXPERTISE AND PREVIOUS
EXPERIENCE IN NIAID ADJUVANT DISCOVERY AND DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMS. DR. EVANS, DIRECTOR OF THE CTM,
AND COLLEAGUES AT UM WILL LEAD THE DISCOVERY EFFORTS AND COORDINATE ACTIVITIES OF ALL SUBCONTRACTORS. THE
RESEARCH TEAM AT UM WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR HIGH THROUGHPUT IN SILICO SCREENING, PEPTIDE LIBRARY PRODUCTION,
COMPOUNDS SYNTHESIS AND SAR, MECHANISTIC STUDIES, FORMULATION, SAFETY ASSESSMENTS AND EFFICACY STUDIES.
DR. STAATS, PROFESSOR OF PATHOLOGY, ASSOCIATE PROFESSOR OF IMMUNOLOGY AND MEDICINE, DUKE, AND COLLEAGUES
WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THE TEAM FROM UM TO COMPLETE THE HTS SCREENING OF SYNTHETIC PEPTIDE LIBRARIES,
APTAMER LIBRARY PRODUCTION AND SCREENING, CONFIRMATION SCREEN OF SELECTED HITS USING IL-1R REPORTER CELLS,
EVALUATION OF BINDING AND INTERNALIZATION, CRITICALLY EVALUATE THE INTRACELLULAR SIGNALING PATHWAYS OF LEAD IL-
1R AGONISTS AND ASSESS THE ROUTE OF ADMINISTRATION AND SCHEDULE TO OPTIMIZE BOTH PARENTERAL (IM) AND
MUCOSAL (IN, SL) VACCINATION THROUGH ADJUVANT SELECTION AND FORMULATION. DR. KRAMMER, ASSOCIATE
PROFESSOR OF MICROBIOLOGY, AND COLLEAGUES AT THE ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI BRING EXPERTISE
AND CONSIDERABLE KNOWLEDGE IN INFLUENZA VIRUS ANIMAL MODELS AND THE PRODUCTION OF RECOMBINANT INFLUENZA
ANTIGENS. DR. KRAMMER WILL PROVIDE RECOMBINANT INFLUENZA ANTIGENS AND LEAD EFFORTS TOWARDS THE IN VIVO
INFLUENZA CHALLENGE MODELS (MOUSE AND FERRET) FOR EVALUATION OF IL-1 ADJUVANTED INFLUENZA VACCINES. THE
TEAM AT MOUNT SINAI ALSO BRINGS SPECIALIZED EXPERTISE IN THE SEROLOGICAL MECHANISM OF PROTECTION AND A WIDE
ARRAY OF ANTIGENS AND VIRUSES TO ASSESS HETEROSUBTYPIC PROTECTION AGAINST SELECTED SEASONAL AND HIGHLY
PATHOGENIC INFLUENZA VIRUS STRAINS. DR. BAZIN-LEE, VICE PRESIDENT OF DISCOVERY RESEARCH, ALONG WITH HER
COLLEAGUES AT INIMMUNE CORPORATION, WILL OVERSEE ANALYTICAL ASSAY DEVELOPMENT, PHYSIOCHEMICAL
CHARACTERIZATION, STABILITY AND SCALE-UP SYNTHESIS OF LEAD IL-1R ADJUVANTS IDENTIFIED IN RESEARCH AREAS 1-3.

subaward_description:
OPTION 23C: 0258-A485-4609
OPTION 23D: 0258-A486-4609

THE UNIVERSAL INFLUENZA VACCINE TECHNOLOGY LANDSCAPE IS A UNIQUE, OPEN-ACCESS DATABASE OF INFORMATION ON UNIVERSAL, BROADLY PROTECTIVE, AND NEXT-GENERATION INFLUENZA VACCINES, AS DEFINED IN THE INFLUENZA VACCINES R&D ROADMAP, IN CLINICAL AND PRECLINICAL DEVELOPMENT. AS OF MAY 2024, THE LANDSCAPE PROFILED MORE THAN 200 VACCINE CANDIDATES IN THE R&D PIPELINE IN ACADEMIC, GOVERNMENT, AND INDUSTRY LABORATORIES, INCLUDING COVID-INFLUENZA COMBINATION VACCINES IN CLINICAL DEVELOPMENT, ACROSS SIX DIFFERENT VACCINE PLATFORMS. DATA ON EACH VACCINE CANDIDATE ARE SUMMARIZED BY PHASE, PLATFORM, TECHNICAL APPROACH, GOAL, AND STATUS OF DEVELOPMENT. THE LANDSCAPE IS ONLINE AND OPEN ACCESS, AND THE ENTIRE DATASET CAN BE DOWNLOADED AS A CSV FILE. A SMALL GROUP OF SUBJECT-MATTER EXPERTS IN INFLUENZA VACCINE R&D AND/OR VACCINE DATABASE DEVELOPMENT PROVIDES ADVICE ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE LANDSCAPE.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONTINUE DEVELOPING AND MAINTAINING INFORMATION ON THE LANDSCAPE TO INCLUDE AN UP-TO-DATE, COMPREHENSIVE, AND ACCURATE OVERVIEW OF VACCINE CANDIDATES IN PRECLINICAL DEVELOPMENT FOR UNIVERSAL, BROADLY PROTECTIVE, AND NEXT-GENERATION INFLUENZA VACCINES.

SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:
1.	COLLECT AND CURATE INFORMATION ON UNIVERSAL, BROADLY PROTECTIVE, AND NEXT-GENERATION INFLUENZA VACCINES TECHNOLOGIES IN PRECLINICAL DEVELOPMENT FROM A WIDE RANGE OF PUBLICLY AVAILABLE SOURCES. CONTINUE RESEARCH ON UNIVERSAL, BROADLY PROTECTIVE, AND NEXT-GENERATION INFLUENZA VACCINE TECHNOLOGIES; MONITOR KEY SOURCES OF INFORMATION FROM THE SCIENTIFIC LITERATURE, PREPRINT SERVERS, AND INDUSTRY WEBSITES AND NEWS SOURCES; AND CROSSCHECK DATA ON VACCINE TECHNOLOGIES IN THE DATABASE.
2.	UPLOAD NEW OR REVISED INFORMATION ON THE IVR LANDSCAPE WEBSITE ON A WEEKLY BASIS, FOR DISPLAY IN THE SNAPSHOT GRAPHIC AND DATABASE TABLE, AND MONITOR DATA FOR COMPLETENESS AND ACCURACY. 
3.	DISSEMINATE INFORMATION ON R&D OF INFLUENZA CANDIDATE VACCINES IN PRECLINICAL DEVELOPMENT VIA PRESENTATIONS AND PUBLICATIONS IN THE PEER-REVIEWED LITERATURE; ENCOURAGE FEEDBACK FROM DEVELOPERS, RESEARCHERS, AND FUNDING ORGANIZATIONS. 
4.	CONSULT WITH ADVISORY WORKING GROUP MEMBERS FOR GUIDANCE AND REVIEW. COMMUNICATE WITH DEVELOPERS TO VERIFY ACTIVITIES AND ACCURACY OF DATA.
5.	MODIFY THE ONLINE DATABASE FORMAT AS NEEDED, WITH SUPPORT FROM CIDRAPÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S IT CONSULTANTS, AND IN COMMUNICATION WITH NIAID AND CIVICS-SEM.
  
THE LANDSCAPE WILL PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE, UP-TO-DATE RESOURCE ON THE R&D PIPELINE FOR VACCINE CANDIDATES IN PRECLINICAL DEVELOPMENT FOR RESEARCHERS, DEVELOPERS, AND NIAID LEADERSHIP. THE LANDSCAPE SUPPORTS THE NIAID/CIVICS PROGRAMÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S GOAL OF ADVANCING INFLUENZA VACCINE SCIENCE AND IDENTIFYING POTENTIAL VACCINE CANDIDATES THAT MAY OFFER BROAD AND LONG-LASTING PROTECTION AGAINST SEASONAL AND PANDEMIC INFLUENZA.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: THIS STUDY WILL IDENTIFY AND EXAMINE BEST PRACTICES FOR CORONAVIRUS DISEASE 2019 (COVID-19) TESTING AND VACCINATION SERVICES IN UNDERSERVED AND DIFFICULT-TO-REACH POPULATIONS.  THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS EXACERBATED EXISTING HEALTH DISPARITIES AND
prime_award_naics_description: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES
subawardee_business_types: MINORITY-OWNED BUSINESS,FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION,WOMAN-OWNED BUSINESS,NATIVE AMERICAN OWNED,AMERICAN INDIAN OWNED,S CORPORATION
subaward_description:
KAUFFMAN & ASSOCIATES (KAI) WILL PARTNER WITH MATHEMATICA TO DEVELOP CULTURALLY APPROPRIATE OUTREACH MATERIALS FOR AMERICAN INDIAN AND ALASKAN NATIVE (AI/AN) COMMUNITIES, PRESENT THE STUDY TO TRIBAL LEADERSHIP; WHERE NEEDED, ADDRESS SPECIFIC CONCERNS, BUILD TRUST, AND DISCUSS BENEFITS FOR
PARTICIPATION. KAI WILL BRING DEEP KNOWLEDGE AND DIRECT CONNECTION TO TRIBAL COMMUNITIES TO IDENTIFY AND DOCUMENT INTERVENTIONS IMPLEMENTED IN TRIBAL JURISDICTIONS. KAI WILL PARTNER WITH MATHEMATICA TO CONDUCT OUTREACH TO TRIBAL COMMUNITIES AND KAI WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE ENVIRONMENTAL SCAN, NATIONAL SURVEY, AND STATE SITE VISIT TASKS.
TASK 1 - PROJECT MANAGEMENT
TASK 2/3 - EXPERT PANEL
TASK 4 - ENVIRONMENTAL SCAN
TASK 6 - NATIONAL SURVEY
TASK 7 - SITE VISITS
TASK 10 - DISSEMINATION

prime_award_base_transaction_description: CARB-X GLOBAL ANTIBACTERIAL ACCELERATOR OTA
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description: LOCUS BIOSCIENCES IS A CLINICAL-STAGE BIOPHARMACEUTICAL COMPANY DEVELOPING ANTIBACTERIAL THERAPIES USING ENGINEERED BACTERIOPHAGES (CRPHAGE AND DEPOLYMERASE-ENGINEERED), WHICH ARE VIRUSES THAT CAN KILL BACTERIA. THIS PROPOSAL ENABLES THE OPTIMIZATION OF AN ENGINEERED PHAGE COCKTAIL TARGETING K. PNEUMONIAE TO ADVANCE THE PRODUCT TO INITIATE A PHASE 1 CLINICAL TRIAL; A SUBSEQUENT OPTION INCLUDES EXECUTION OF THE CLINICAL TRIAL. THE PROPOSED K. PNEUMONIAE PRODUCT WILL TARGET COMPLICATED URINARY INFECTIONS. LBP-KP01 WILL BE PART OF AN ARSENAL OF COCKTAILS, INCLUDING OUR EXISTING CRPHAGE COCKTAIL TARGETING E. COLI, DESIGNED TO ADDRESS SERIOUS INFECTIONS IRRESPECTIVE OF UNDERLYING DRUG-RESISTANCE WITHIN THE TARGET SPECIES. TOGETHER, THE E. COLI AND K. PNEUMONIAE COCKTAILS HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO TREAT THE MAJORITY OF UTIS.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: PROFESSIONAL ADMINISTRATIVE STAFFING SUPPORT SERVICES FOR ASPR'S CENTER FOR ADMINISTRATION, OFFICE OF HUMAN CAPITAL, PROJECT MANAGEMENT OFFICE.
prime_award_naics_description: OFFICE ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES
subaward_description:
REQUIRING ORGANIZATION
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES (HHS)
ADMINISTRATION FOR STRATEGIC PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE (ASPR)
OFFICE OF ADMINISTRATION (OA)
OFFICE OF HUMAN CAPITAL (OHC)
PROJECT MANAGEMENT OFFICE (PMO)
400 7TH STREET, SW
WASHINGTON, DC 20024
OBJECTIVE
THE OBJECTIVE IS TO ACQUIRE STAFFING SUPPORT SERVICES FOR ASPR/OA/OHC/PMO TO AUGMENT THE HUMAN CAPITAL REQUIREMENTS FOR AN ORGANIZATIONAL TRANSITION FROM THE STAFFING, RECRUITMENT, AND OPERATIONS CENTER (SROC) TO THE ASPR OFFICE OF ADMINISTRATION (OA), OFFICE OF HUMAN CAPITAL (OHC), PROJECT MANAGEMENT OFFICE (PMO).
SCOPE
THE SCOPE SHALL PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL STAFFING SERVICES TO SUPPORT THE TASKS AND MISSION REQUIREMENTS ASSOCIATED WITH ASPR/OA/OHC/PMO IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POSITION REQUIREMENTS OUTLINED IN THIS STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW).
TASKS AND SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS

subaward_description: VAERS IS A MANDATED PROGRAM SPONSORED JOINTLY BY THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC) AND THE US FOOD AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION (FDA). THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT AS AUTHORIZED BY THE NATIONAL CHILDHOOD VACCINE INJURY ACT (NCVIA), P.L. 99- 660, IS TO PROVIDE A SINGLE NATIONWIDE MECHANISM TO REPORT, ANALYZE AND MONITOR VACCINE ADVERSE EVENTS (VAES) THAT OCCUR AFTER RECEIPT OF VACCINES. IT ALSO PROVIDES A VEHICLE FOR DISSEMINATING VACCINE SAFETY INFORMATION TO VACCINES, FAMILY MEMBERS, HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS, VACCINE MANUFACTURERS, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, AND OTHER PARTNERS.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: SHEPHERD 2023 DOMAIN 2-B001 HOUSEHOLD TRANSMISSION
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE SOCIAL SCIENCES AND HUMANITIES
subaward_description:
SCOPE OF WORK - VUMC
THE OVERALL PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING 4 TASKS: DESIGN A MULTI-SITE STUDY OF INFLUENZA TRANSMISSION WITHIN HOUSEHOLDS, ENROLL ELIGIBLE HOUSEHOLDS AND CONDUCT PROSPECTIVE STUDY ACTIVITIES, CONDUCT LABORATORY STUDIES TO CHARACTERIZE SUSCEPTIBILITY AND INFECTION, AND, PROVIDE DATA MANAGEMENT FOR SITUATIONAL AWARENESS AND ANALYSES.
TO ACCOMPLISH THE PROJECTÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S OBJECTIVES, OUR VUMC SITE WILL ENROLL AND FOLLOW APPROXIMATELY 150 HOUSEHOLDS. VUMC WILL SERVE AS A SUBCONTRACTOR TO WASHINGTON UNIVERSITY AND WILL SERVE AS THE DATA COORDINATING CENTER (DCC) AND CENTRAL VIRAL LABORATORY FOR THE NETWORK. TO ENSURE EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT IDENTIFICATION OF INDEX CASES, REGARDLESS OF PRESENCE OF SYMPTOMS AND RAPID ENROLMENT AND COMPLETE FOLLOW-UP OF INDEX CASES AND HOUSEHOLD CONTACTS, WE WILL IMPLEMENT A MODIFIED CASE-ASCERTAINED STUDY DESIGN. WE WILL USE ESTABLISHED HIGH-THROUGHPUT STATE-OF-THE-ART TESTING PLATFORMS TO ACCURATELY IDENTIFY INFLUENZA INFECTIONS AND APPLY A DETAILED ALGORITHM TO DETERMINE AND VERIFY VACCINATION HISTORY. IN ADDITION, WE WILL IMPLEMENT AN INTEGRATED DATA SYSTEM FOR COLLECTION AND MANAGEMENT OF ALL STUDY ELEMENTS, THAT ENSURES REAL-TIME DATA SHARING.

subaward_description: THIS CONTRACT WILL SUPPORT CDC IN ITS EFFORT TO GATHER AND ANALYZE DATA FROM LONGITUDINAL PREGNANT PEOPLE AND INFANT SURVEILLANCE AND BIRTH DEFECTS SURVEILLANCE/REGISTRY SYSTEMS, AS WELL AS PROVIDE SERVICES TO SUPPORT CDC ACTIVITIES RELATED TO NEONATAL ABSTINENCE SYNDROME TO MAKE USE OF EXISTING STATE BIO SURVEILLANCE AND OTHER SURVEILLANCE TOOLS TO IMPROVE VOLUNTARY, DE-IDENTIFIED PRENATAL AND NEWBORN HEALTH DATA. DATA MAY INCLUDE OPIOID-RELATED INFORMATION BEFORE AND DURING PREGNANCY TO REDUCE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH NEONATAL ABSTINENCE SYNDROME AND OPTIMIZE CARE 2. PROVIDE SUBSTANTIAL INTERACTIONS WITH THE JURISDICTIONS TO INCLUDE MONITORING PROJECT PROGRESS AND REVIEWING FINANCIAL REPORTS 3. DEVELOP TOOLS, TEMPLATES, AND REFERENCE INFORMATION FOR STATE, LOCAL AND NATIONAL PARTNERS. 4. ALLOW THE CDC TO DETECT THREATS FASTER AND ARM HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS WITH INFORMATION TO PROTECT PREGNANT PEOPLE AND INFANTS 5. SECURE OPERATIONAL AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT TO PROGRAMS WITHIN NCBDDD 6. PERFORM DATA MANAGEMENT TO COORDINATE WORK EFFORTS AND REPORT STATUS; AND 7. PROVIDE DATA AND DOCUMENT MONITORING AND MANAGEMENT FOR PUBLIC HEALTH PRODUCTS, TOOLS AND RESOURCES FOR PUBLICATION AND DISSEMINATION 8. SUPPORT CDC TASK FORCES/EMERGENCY RESPONSES RELATED TO EMERGING THREATS TO PREGNANT PEOPLE AND INFANTS

prime_award_base_transaction_description: THE PURPOSE OF THIS CONTRACT IS TO OBTAIN SERVICES FOR THE JURISDICTION H (PART A AND B) MEDICARE ADMINISTRATIVE CONTRACTOR (MAC). THE CONTRACTOR WILL PROVIDE SPECIFIED HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFIT ADMINISTRATION SERVICES, INCLUDING MEDICARE CLAIMS PROCESSING AND PAYMENT SERVICES, IN SUPPORT OF THE MEDICARE PROGRAM (ALSO KNOWN AS THE MEDICARE FEE-FOR-SERVICE, OR FFS, PROGRAM) FOR JURISDICTION H.  JURISDICTION H INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING STATES: ARKANSAS, COLORADO, LOUISIANA, MISSISSIPPI, NEW MEXICO, OKLAHOMA, AND TEXAS.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: IGF::OT::IGF IMMUNE EPITOPE AND ANALYSIS PROGRAM
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_dba_name: LA JOLLA INSTITUTE FOR ALLERGY & IMMUNOLOGY
subaward_description:
THE PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY OF LEIDOS AS PART OF THE IEDB & AR PROGRAM IS TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE EXISTING IEDB DATABASE AND CURATION SYSTEMS. IN ADDITION, LEIDOS SHALL ALSO PARTICIPATE IN PERIODIC MEETINGS, PROVIDE PROGRESS REPORTS ON THE WORK AND RESPOND TO IEDB HELP DESK TICKETS IF REQUIRED. AN OVERVIEW OF TASKS TO BE ACCOMPLISHED BY LEIDOS ARE LISTED BELOW:

A.	IMMUNE EPITOPE DATABASE TASKS
1.	ASSIST LJI IN THE MAINTENANCE, CONTINUED IMPROVEMENT AND OPTIMIZATION OF THE EXISTING IEDB DATABASE SYSTEM AND MAKING IT AVAILABLE TO END USERS.  THE SYSTEM SHOULD INCLUDE COLLECTION, STORAGE, ANALYSIS, ARCHIVE AND EXCHANGE OF IMMUNE EPITOPE DATA AND ACCOMPANYING INFORMATION. 

2.	ASSIST LJI IN MAINTENANCE AND ENHANCEMENT OF THE IEDB WEB PORTAL INCLUDING:
A.	FURTHER OPTIMIZATION, DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF UNIFORM, INTELLIGENT WEB-BASED INTERFACES FOR MAKING DATA ACCESSIBLE TO END USERS. THE INTERFACE SHALL MINIMALLY INCLUDE COMPLEX QUERY; SEMANTIC QUERY; DOWNLOAD; EPITOPE SUBMISSION; LINKS TO RELATED RESOURCES; AND REPORTS, MANUSCRIPTS, NEWSLETTERS, AND COMPENDIA.
B.	UPDATE EXISTING FEATURES AND IMPLEMENT NEW FEATURES IN THE IEDB WEB PORTAL AS NEEDED. 
C.	ASSIST IN ESTABLISHING AND TRACKING PERFORMANCE METRICS TO DETERMINE UTILIZATION AND UTILITY OF THE WEB PORTAL WITHIN THE SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY. RELEVANT METRICS SHALL FREQUENCY OF DATA DOWNLOADS, CHARACTERIZATION OF USERS AND USER QUERY STATISTICS. AT A MINIMUM, THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD BE CONDUCTED BI-ANNUALLY (EVERY 2 YEARS).

3.	UPON REQUEST, ASSIST LJI IN THE MAINTENANCE AND UPDATING OF SYSTEM DOCUMENTATION INCLUDING:
A.	DOCUMENT ALL SYSTEM COMPONENTS, SOFTWARE AND DATABASES IN ACCORDANCE WITH INDUSTRY BEST PRACTICES AND IN A MANNER THAT WILL ALLOW ANOTHER CONTRACTOR OR USER TO UNDERSTAND AND UTILIZE THE SYSTEM.
B.	PROVIDE A HIGH LEVEL OVERVIEW OF FUNCTIONS AND FEATURES OF THE SYSTEM, INCLUDING SYSTEM ARCHITECTURE, HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE DESIGN, DATABASE DESIGN AND DATA MODELS. THIS COMPENDIUM OF FUNCTIONS AND FEATURES SHALL BE UPDATED SEMI-ANNUALLY OR AS REQUESTED BY THE COTR OR CONTRACTING OFFICER.
C.	WORK WITH LJI TO ESTABLISH AND DOCUMENT A SCHEDULE OF SYSTEM UPDATES AND RELEASES.

4.	COMPLY WITH SECTION 508 OF THE REHABILITATION ACT (29 U.S.C. 794D), (SEE HTTP://WWW.SECTION508.GOV/) IN TERMS OF DATABASE/WEBSITE USE AND DIRECT EPITOPE/DATA SUBMISSION BY THE BROADER RESEARCH COMMUNITY.

B.	CURATION SYSTEM TASKS
1.	ASSIST LJI IN THE MAINTENANCE, CONTINUED IMPROVEMENT AND OPTIMIZATION OF THE EXISTING IEDB CURATION SYSTEM. THE SYSTEM SHOULD INCLUDE COLLECTION, TRACKING, AND ASSIGNMENT OF PUBLISHED MANUSCRIPTS AND ACCOMPANYING INFORMATION.

C.	MEETINGS AND REPORTS 
PARTICIPATE IN WEEKLY MEETINGS TO COORDINATE SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT EFFORTS. ADDITIONALLY, PROVIDE QUARTERLY AND ANNUAL REPORTS SUMMARIZING WORK PERFORMED.

D.	COMMUNITY OUTREACH
1.	IF REQUESTED, ASSIST WITH ADDRESSING ANY HELP DESK TICKETS RELATED TO ANY IEDB SYSTEMS INFRASTRUCTURE.
2.	ASSIST LJI WITH PREPARING A COMPENDIUM OF THE DATA IN THE IMMUNE EPITOPE DATABASE ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

subaward_description:
OUR LAB WILL WORK THE GROUP AND IN PARTICULAR, DR. HOMAN TO IDENTIFY EPITOPES FROM IMMUNOGENIC
HISTOPLASMA CAPSULATUM ANTIGENS THAT ARE RECOGNIZED BY HUMAN AND MOUSE T CELLS. ONCE
CANDIDATE EPITOPES ARE ASCERTAINED, WE WILL TEST THEM FOR IMMUNOGENICITY WITH VACCINATED MICE
AS WELL AS HUMANS WHO HAVE BEEN EXPOSED TO THIS FUNGUS. HERE IN THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY, -80%
OF RESIDENTS HAVE EVIDENCE OF EXPOSURE (GRANULOMAS ON CHEST X-RAY, + SEROLOGIES). PRIORITY WILL
BE GIVEN TO IDENTIFYING EPITOPES FROM KNOWN ANTIGENS THAT PROMPT A BRISK RESPONSE BY T CELLS AS
ASSESSED BY CYTOKINE GENERATION AND PROLIFERATION. WE WILL WORK WITH OTHERS TO DETERMINE IF THERE
ARE COMMON ANTIGENS AND IF THE EPITOPES ARE SHARED AMONG THE FUNGI WE ARE INVESTIGATING.

subaward_description:
PREM LAKSHMANANE IS A SUBCONTRACT-PI WHO WILL LEAD AND SUPPORT THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF APPLYING OUR MULTIPLEX BEAD-BASED ASSAY TO TEST ANTIBODIES AGAINST ALPHAVIRUS ABS FOR 200 BLOOD SAMPLES (100 SAMPLES/YEAR) TO DOCUMENT PAST ALPHAVIRUS EXPOSURES. THE STUDIES TO BE CONDUCTED AT UNC IN THE LAKSHMANANE LABORATORY UNDER THIS SUBCONTRACT FROM LA JOLLA INSTITUTE FOR IMMUNOLOGY (LJI) ARE DESCRIBED BELOW.

THE LAKSHMANANE GROUP WILL BUILD ON ASSAYS AND EXPERTISE TO OPTIMIZE ASSAY AND TEST THE SAMPLES FOR IGG ABS AGAINST ALPHAVIRUSES (CHIKV, ONNV, MAYV, EEEV, VEEV).  

SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE CONDUCTED TO SUPPORT IGG SEROLOGICAL ASSAYS ARE AS FOLLOWS:

1) TEST SAMPLES (PROVIDED BY LJI) IN ENVELOPE ANTIGEN-BASED MULTIPLEX LUMINEX ASSAY FOR ALPHAVIRUS IGG ABS

2) INTEGRATE DATA AND COORDINATE WITH INVESTIGATORS AT LA JOLLA INSTITUTE FOR IMMUNOLOGY FOR DISCUSSION AND PUBLICATIONS.

subaward_description:
SERVING AS PROXIMAL SPOKES, THE NATIONAL SMART IRB AMBASSADORS ARE ESSENTIAL CONTRIBUTORS TO BI-DIRECTIONAL COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE CTSAS, TINS, IRBS, RESEARCH TEAMS, INSTITUTIONS AND THE SMART IRB TEAM. DURING THE FIRST PHASE OF SMART IRB, THE AMBASSADORS SUCCESSFULLY BUILT TRUST WITH CONSTITUENTS, DROVE AND ENABLED SIGN-ON TO THE SMART IRB AGREEMENT, AND SERVED AS AN ESSENTIAL RESOURCE FOR TRAININGS, WORKFLOW DEVELOPMENT, AND DISSEMINATION OF RESOURCES. 
THE SMART IRB AMBASSADORS WILL CONTINUE TO REPRESENT THEIR HOME INSTITUTIONS AND OTHER  CTSAS AS ASSIGNED AS WELL AS WILL WORK WITH OTHER AMBASSADORS TO BRING POSITIVE CHANGE TO ALL  INSTITUTIONS INVOLVED. IN ADDITION, SMART IRB AMBASSADORS WILL SERVE AS DOMAIN EXPERTS,  RESPECTED BY THEIR PEERS, AND WORK COLLABORATIVELY TO COLLECT FEEDBACK FROM USERS, REPRESENT  SMART IRB ON NATIONAL COMMITTEES, AND DESIGN AND CONDUCT PILOT STUDIES OF POTENTIALLY  HARMONIZED POLICIES AND PROCESSES. IMPORTANTLY, SMART IRB AMBASSADORS WILL ALSO IDENTIFY A CADRE OF EXPERIENCED SUPER USERS TO ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF TRAININGS AND MATERIALS  ORIENTED TOWARD PREPARING STUDY TEAMS FOR A SMOOTH TRANSITION TO SINGLE IRB REVIEW. IN TURN, THE SMART IRB AMBASSADORS WILL BE A KEY COMPONENT TO DEVELOPING MATERIALS FOR, AND ENCOURAGE THE ADOPTION OF, THE SMART IRB RELIANCE LEARNING COMPENDIUM AND THE NATIONAL COMMON REGULATORY PORTFOLIO.

I WILL SERVE AS PROGRAM DIRECTOR OF SMART IRB EDUCATION AND TRAINING COMMITTEE.  
THE COMMITTEE WILL,
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ IDENTIFY AREAS OF NEEDED EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN SIRB UTILIZATION AND REVIEW PROCESSES.
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS IN THE FORM OF EDUCATIONAL MODULES AND WRITTEN DOCUMENTATION ON UTILIZATION OF SMART IRB PROCESSES, AND PROCEDURES.
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ FACILITATE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES IN THE FORM OF LIVE WEBINARS, ON-DEMAND TRAINING VIDEOS, AND IN-PERSON WORKSHOPS FOR INSTITUTIONS THAT HAVE JOINED OR WISH TO JOIN THE SMART IRB NETWORK.
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ PROMOTE COMMUNITY SUPPORT OF THE SMART IRB NETWORK.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK ORDER IS TO CONDUCT TWO (2) EVIDENCE-BASED REVIEWS ON CONDITIONS AS VOTED BY THE COMMITTEE. CONDUCT EVIDENCE-BASED REVIEWS FOR CONDITIONS NOMINATED FOR INCLUSION ON THE RECOMMENDED UNIFORM SCREENING PANEL (RUSP).
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE SOCIAL SCIENCES AND HUMANITIES
subaward_description:
THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES A GAP IN NEWBORN SCREENING, NAMELY HOW TO ASSESS LONG-TERM OUTCOMES
FOR FAMILIES OF CHILDREN WITH AN IDENTIFIED CONDITION. DURING THIS FUNDING PERIOD THE PROJECT TEAM
WILL COMPLETE WORK TO IDENTIFY BROAD OUTCOME DOMAINS THAT ARE IMPORTANT TO FAMILIES. THE TEAM
WILL THEN DRAFT AN INSTRUMENT TO ASSESS THOSE OUTCOMES, CONDUCT COGNITIVE TESTING WITH FAMILIES
AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS, AND CONDUCT PILOT TESTING TO DETERMINE FEASIBILITY, ACCEPTABILITY, AND
USEFULNESS OF THE SCALE. WE WILL PREPARE AND SUBMIT REPORTS, PRESENTATIONS, AND PEER-REVIEWED
JOURNAL ARTICLES TO MEET DISSMENIATION REQUIREMENTS.

SUBCONTRACTOR SHALL PERFORM TASKS AND SHALL DELIVER TO MATHEMATICA DELIVERABLES DESCRIBED IN Ã¢Â‚¬Å“TASKS, WORK AND DELIVERABLES TABLEÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½
-FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SUBCONTRACT Ã¢Â‚¬Å“EDOCÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½ MEANS AND STANDS FOR Ã¢Â‚¬Å“EFFECTIVE DATE OF CONTRACTÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½.
-ALL DELIVERABLES DELIVERED BY SUBCONTRACTOR UNDER THIS SUBCONTRACT MUST BE COMPLIANT WITH SECTION 508 OF THE U.S. REHABILITATION ACT OF 1973.
-ALL DELIVERABLES THAT WILL REACH AN AUDIENCE BEYOND HRSA HAB STAFF MUST BE CLEARED BY HRSA HABÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S OFFICE OF COMMUNICATIONS (OC). THE HRSA HAB OC PROCESS TYPICALLY TAKES THREE-FOUR (3-4) WEEKS. THE SUBCONTRACTOR SHALL PLAN ACCORDINGLY TO ENSURE TIMELY COMPLETION OF DELIVERABLES.

SUBCONTRACTOR SHALL PERFORM THE TASKS AND WORK AND SHALL DELIVER TO MATHEMATICA THE FOLLOWING DELIVERABLES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE BELOW TABLE 2.2.1
TASK 1: KICKOFF MEETING WITH CONTRACTING OFFICERÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S REPRESENTATIVE (COR) 
TASK 2: DESIGN STRATEGY WORKGROUP 
TASK 3: CONDUCT PILOT SITE VISITS 
TASK 5: PRESENTATION OF PROJECT AND PILOT SITE VISIT RESULTS
TASK 6: PROJECT ADMINISTRATION
TASK 7: USE OF PLAIN LANGUAGE GUIDELINES AND OTHER GOVERNMENT LAWS AND REGULATIONS FOR ALL PRODUCTS
TASK 8: FEDERAL RECORDS MANAGEMENT

subaward_description: THE MYERS LABORATORY EXTENSIVELY REDESIGNS NATURAL ANTIBIOTIC SCAÃ‚Â¿OLDS THEN PREPARES THEM BY CHEMICAL SYNTHESIS TO ACCESS NEW ANTIBIOTICS EÃ‚Â¿ECTIVE AGAINST MULTIDRUG-RESISTANT BACTERIAL PATHOGENS. THE STRATEGY PERMITS SCAÃ‚Â¿OLD MODIÃ‚Â¿CATIONS THAT CANNOT BE ACHIEVED BY SEMI- SYNTHESIS AND PROVIDES A MEANS TO OVERCOME EXISTING CLASS-BASED RESISTANCE MECHANISMS AS WELL AS BROADEN THE SPECTRUM OF ACTIVITY. RECENTLY, EXPLORATIONS TO EXPAND AND REDEÃ‚Â¿NE THE LINCOSAMIDE CLASS HAVE DELIVERED A SET OF PARTICULARLY PROMISING LEAD MOLECULES, COLLECTIVELY TERMED THE OXEPANOPROLINAMIDES (OPPS). OPPS OVERCOME RESISTANCE MECHANISMS THAT RENDER >10 OTHER CLASSES OF RIBOSOME-TARGETING ANTIBIOTICS INACTIVE (INCLUDING LINCOSAMIDES, MACROLIDES, AND OXAZOLIDINONES) AND ARE IMPERVIOUS TO RESISTANCE MECHANISMS THAT DISABLE ANTIBIOTICS WITH DIÃ‚Â¿ERENT TARGETS (E.G., CELL-WALL BIOSYNTHESIS INHIBITORS, AND GYRASE AND TOPOISOMERASE INHIBITORS). THE LEAD OPPS ARE POTENT, BROAD-SPECTRUM AGENTS, AND DEMONSTRATE IN VIVO EÃ‚Â¿CACY AGAINST MULTIDRUG-RESISTANT (MDR) GRAM-POSITIVE AND GRAM-NEGATIVE ORGANISMS. OPPS SHOW EXQUISITE POTENCY IN VITRO AGAINST STAPHYLOCOCCUS, STREPTOCOCCUS, AND ENTEROCOCCUS SPP., INCLUDING STRAINS CONSTITUTIVELY EXPRESSING LINCOSAMIDE RESISTANCE DETERMINANTS. OPPS ALSO POTENTLY INHIBIT MANY HIGH-PRIORITY, MDR GRAM-NEGATIVE PATHOGENS IN VITRO INCLUDING NEISSERIA GONORRHOEAE AND ESCHERICHIA COLI. IN VITRO SAFETY PROÃ‚Â¿LING EXPERIMENTS REVEAL THAT OPPS SELECTIVELY INHIBIT BACTERIAL CELL GROWTH AND SUGGEST THAT THEY MAY OÃ‚Â¿ER A LARGE THERAPEUTIC WINDOW. WITH THE SUPPORT OF CARB-X, THIS PROGRAM SEEKS TO PROÃ‚Â¿LE FOUR HIGHLY PROMISING LEAD MOLECULES TO ASSESS THEIR POTENTIAL AS LEAD CANDIDATES FOR THE TREATMENT OF COMMUNITY-ACQUIRED BACTERIAL PNEUMONIA (CABP). THIS PROGRAM WILL EVALUATE THE LEAD OPPS IN A WELL-DEÃ‚Â¿NED SET OF ASSAYS TO FURTHER CHARACTERIZE THEIR SAFETY, EÃ‚Â¿CACY, AND PHARMACOKINETIC PROPERTIES. THESE CHARACTERIZATIONS WILL ENABLE OUR GROUP TO EITHER PROGRESS ONE OR MORE OPPS CLOSER TO NOMINATION AS A PRE-CLINICAL CANDIDATE OR INFORM FUTURE ANALOG DEVELOPMENT TO ADDRESS ANY LIABILITIES EXHIBITED BY THIS CLASS OF ANTIBACTERIAL AGENTS.

prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description: PEPTILOGICS IS A BIOTECHNOLOGY COMPANY THAT UTILIZES AN INNOVATIVE PLATFORM TO DEVELOP NOVEL PEPTIDE THERAPEUTICS TO ADDRESS UNMET MEDICAL NEEDS. OUR PIPELINE INCLUDES A NOVEL CLASS OF ENGINEERED CATIONIC ANTIBIOTIC PEPTIDES. OUR LEAD CANDIDATE, PLG0206, BASED ON NATURALLY OCCURRING ANTIMICROBIAL PEPTIDES, EXHIBITS BROAD-SPECTRUM ACTIVITY AGAINST CLINICALLY IMPORTANT MDR GRAM-POSITIVE (S. AUREUS, INCLUDING MRSA, AND E. FAECIUM, INCLUDING VRE) AND GRAM-NEGATIVE (P. AERUGINOSA, E. COLI, AND A. BAUMANNII) PATHOGENS. PLG0206 EXHIBITS THE ABILITY TO RAPIDLY INACTIVATE BOTH PLANKTONIC AND BIOFILM PATHOGENS. THIS WITH ITS BROAD-SPECTRUM ACTIVITY MAKE IT AN IDEAL DEVELOPMENT CANDIDATE FOR PREVENTING INVASIVE INFECTIONS. PLG0206 TARGETS AND DISRUPTS THE BACTERIAL MEMBRANE, CAUSING RAPID BACTERIAL DEATH VIA CELLULAR CHEMICAL IMBALANCE. SINCE BACTERIAL MEMBRANES ARE A CONSERVED EVOLUTIONARY TARGET, THIS MOA APPEARS TO LIMIT THE RISK FOR RESISTANCE COMPARED TO OTHER ANTIBIOTICS. WITH RAPID BACTERICIDAL AND ANTI-BIOFILM ACTIVITY ON CONTACT, PLG0206 IS BEING DEVELOPED FOR THE PREVENTION OF TRAUMATIC FRACTURE-RELATED INFECTIONS (FRI) VIA LOCAL ADMINISTRATION IN CONJUNCTION STANDARD SURGICAL CARE. FRI IS A SERIOUS, LIFE-THREATENING INFECTION WITH SIGNIFICANT ECONOMIC BURDEN. FRI TREATMENT REQUIRES HOSPITALIZATION AND ONE OR MORE REPEAT SURGICAL PROCEDURES. MICROORGANISMS THAT CAUSE FRI INCLUDE S. AUREUS, COAGULATE-NEGATIVE STAPHYLOCOCCUS SPP., ENTEROCOCCUS SPP., AND AEROBIC GRAM-NEGATIVE BACILLI. THE POTENTIAL INFECTING PATHOGEN IS UNKNOWN AT THE TIME OF TRAUMATIC INSULT AND INITIAL SURGERY. CLINICAL PRACTICE GUIDELINES RECOMMEND 2-5 DAYS OF SYSTEMIC ANTIBIOTICS FOLLOWING TRAUMATIC INJURY TO PREVENT FRI. DESPITE THIS, TRAUMATIC FRACTURES HAVE A HIGH INFECTION RATE (UP TO 40%). FRI OFTEN REQUIRES MULTIPLE SURGICAL PROCEDURES, LEADING TO SUBSTANTIAL MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY WITH AN UP TO 25% 5-YEAR MORTALITY RISK. CURRENT STRATEGIES DO NOT ADEQUATELY PREVENT THE INFECTIONS THAT LEAD TO FRI'S HIGH MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY BURDEN, AND FRI REMAINS AN UNMET MEDICAL NEED AND REQUIRES A DIFFERENT APPROACH TO THAT CURRENTLY EMPLOYED. PLG0206, ADMINISTERED AT THE TIME OF INJURY, THROUGH ITS RAPIDLY ACTING BROAD-SPECTRUM ACTIVITY AGAINST THE PATHOGENS COMMONLY CAUSING FRI HAS THE POTENTIAL TO ADDRESS THIS UNMET NEED. PLG0206 WILL BE ADMINISTERED FOLLOWING TRAUMATIC INJURY IN THE OPERATING THEATER AFTER SURGICAL DEBRIDEMENT AND BONE FIXATION AS A LONG-ACTING CONTROLLED RELEASE FORMULATION. IT IS EXPECTED TO BE MORE EFFECTIVE THAN THE CURRENT STANDARD OF CARE BY PROVIDING LONG-LASTING PATHOGEN-INACTIVATING DRUG LEVELS TO PREVENT INFECTION NIDI (DEVITALIZED AND CONTAMINATED BONE AND SOFT TISSUE AND METAL FIXATION DEVICES) THAT LEAD TO INVASIVE INFECTION. THE EXPECTED LIMITED SYSTEMIC EXPOSURE WITH LOCAL DRUG DEPOT SHOULD ENSURE A GOOD SAFETY PROFILE. THE DEVELOPMENT PLAN WILL ASSESS THE IN VITRO AND IN VIVO RELEASE CHARACTERISTICS OF VARIOUS PLG0206 CONTROLLED-RELEASE FORMULATIONS ALONG WITH PK, TOLERABILITY, AND EFFICACY IN ANIMAL MODELS OF FRI. ADDITIONAL STUDIES WILL IDENTIFY THE MOST EFFECTIVE, WELL-TOLERATED CONCENTRATION TO BE USED IN HUMAN TRIALS TO ESTABLISH SAFETY AND EFFICACY OF LOCAL ADMINISTRATION IN THE PREVENTION OF FRI IN CONJUNCTION WITH CURRENT STANDARD OF CARE.

prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description: VISBY MEDICAL IS THE MAKER OF AN INNOVATIVE INSTRUMENT-FREE, SINGLE USE PCR PLATFORM FOR THE DETECTION OF INFECTIOUS DISEASES. THEIR SEXUAL HEALTH TEST DETECTS CHLAMYDIA, GONORRHEA, AND TRICHOMONAS WITH ~97% ACCURACY IN LESS THAN 30 MINUTES. THIS TEST IS APPROVED FOR USE AT THE POINT OF CARE IN CLIA WAIVED SETTINGS. CARB-X FUNDING WILL ALLOW VISBY TO ADD THE DETECTION OF ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE TO THE SEXUAL HEALTH TEST, BY DEVELOPING OUR ASSAY FOR THE DETECTION OF A MUTATION IN THE GYRA GENE OF N. GONORRHOEAE THAT CONFERS RESISTANCE TO CIPROFLOXACIN. THE CDC LISTS ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE IN N. GONORRHOEAE AS ONE OF THE TOP 5 URGENT THREATS. CURRENT TREATMENT RECOMMENDATIONS RECOMMEND USING ONE OF THE LAST REMAINING ANTIBIOTICS AVAILABLE AGAINST GONORRHEA INFECTIONS. THE NEW VISBY TEST WILL HELP CLINICIANS KNOW WHICH TREATMENT IS APPROPRIATE, SO THAT WE CAN CONSERVE OUR LAST LINES OF ANTIBIOTIC DEFENSE ONLY FOR THE CASES THAT REQUIRE IT. BY MAKING A SIMPLE, RAPID DIAGNOSTIC TEST FOR ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE, VISBY MEDICAL WILL PROVIDE A MUCH-NEEDED TOOL IN THE FIGHT AGAINST ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: CARB-X GLOBAL ANTIBACTERIAL ACCELERATOR OTA
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description: DAY ZERO DIAGNOSTICS IS DEVELOPING A CULTURE-FREE, SEQUENCING-BASED DIAGNOSTIC THAT IDENTIFIES WITHIN HOURS BOTH THE SPECIES AND THE ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE PROFILE OF A BACTERIAL INFECTION. WE HAVE DEVELOPED AN ULTRA-HIGH ENRICHMENT SAMPLE PREPARATION PROCESS (BLOOD2BACÃ¢Â€ŽÂ¢) THAT CAN EXTRACT BACTERIAL WHOLE GENOME SEQUENCES FROM PATIENT BLOOD SAMPLES EVEN WHEN THERE ARE JUST A HANDFUL OF BACTERIAL CELLS PRESENT IN THE SAMPLE. WE HAVE ALSO DEVELOPED A PROPRIETARY MACHINE LEARNING ALGORITHM (KEYNOMEÃ‚Â®) THAT CAN USE THE DNA SEQUENCES TO IDENTIFY A BACTERIAL PATHOGEN AND PREDICT ITS ANTIBIOTIC SUSCEPTIBILITY PROFILE. KEYNOME IS TRAINED ON A LARGE SCALE DATABASE (MICROHMDBÃ‚Â®) THAT CONTAINS THE WHOLE GENOME SEQUENCES OF BACTERIAL PATHOGENS MATCHED TO THEIR KNOWN ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE PROFILE. OUR APPROACH ALLOWS FOR THE SIMULTANEOUS TESTING OF A VAST NUMBER OF BACTERIAL SPECIES AND KNOWN RESISTANCE MARKERS, ALONG WITH THE ABILITY TO IDENTIFY NOVEL RESISTANCE DETERMINANTS AS THEY EMERGE. WITH DAY ZERO DIAGNOSTICS, PHYSICIANS CAN TREAT PATIENTS WITH THE MOST EFFECTIVE DRUG IN HOURS, AVOIDING THE COMPLICATIONS, COSTS, AND FRUSTRATION ASSOCIATED WITH EMPIRIC THERAPY.

subawardee_business_types: PRIVATE UNIVERSITY OR COLLEGE,OTHER NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description: EDC HAS ENGAGED THE NATIONAL INSTITUTE FOR OUT-OF-SCHOOL TIME (NIOST) AT WELLESLEY COLLEGE TO PROVIDE PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE SERVICES FOR THE NATIONAL CENTER ON AFTERSCHOOL AND SUMMER ENRICHMENT (NCASE), SUPPORTING CHILD CARE AND DEVELOPMENT FUND (CCDF) LEAD AGENCIES AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS UNDER A CONTRACT WITH THE OFFICE OF CHILD CARE (OCC) AT THE ADMINISTRATION FOR CHILDREN AND FAMILIES, US DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES. SERVICES PROVIDED THROUGH NCASE WILL SEEK TO EXPAND SUPPLY AND ACCESS TO AFTERSCHOOL AND SUMMER LEARNING AND DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR SCHOOL-AGE CHILDREN, PARTICULARLY THOSE IN LOW INCOME FAMILIES. THE NCASE PARTNERS WILL WORK WITH OCC TO DEVELOP AND SUPPORT ACF'S VISION FOR AFTERSCHOOL AND SUMMER ENRICHMENT THAT BUILDS ON THE OPPORTUNITIES IN THE CCDF PROGRAM AND BUILDS PARTNERSHIPS WITH FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS ACROSS THE COUNTRY IN THE PROVISION OF SCHOOL-AGE SERVICES, INCLUDING EDUCATION AGENCIES.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: SIZE DEPENDENT METRIC ANALYSIS OF COAL MINE DUST
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT NANOTECHNOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_business_types: U.S. STATE GOVERNMENT,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
THE ORIGINAL PROPOSAL OF SIZE-DEPENDENT METRIC ANALYSIS OF RESPIRABLE COAL MINE DUST (RCMD)
WAS SPLIT TWO PHASES, BASE-PHASE AND OPTION PHASES, ACCORDING TO FUNDING AGENT. IN BASE PHASE
THE RESEARCH WORK IS TO PROVIDE PROOF OF CONCEPT FOR DIRECT-ON-FILTER CHARACTERIZATION OF DUSTY
PARTICLES INCLUDING PARTICLE SIZE DISTRIBUTION AND COMPOSITION. THE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH AS A
SUBCONTRACT WILL CARRY OUT FOLLOWING RESEARCH TASKS ACCORDING TO THE PROPOSAL. PROPOSED BUDGET
FOR BASE PHASE IS $25000.
1. BASE PHASE: PROOF OF CONCEPT
TASK A. LITERATURE REVIEW
PARTICIPATE LITERATURE REVIEW ON PREVIOUS WORK ON SURFACE ANALYSIS OF CONTINUOUS PERSONAL
DUST MONITOR (CPDM) TAPERED ELEMENT OSCILLATING MICROBALANCE (TEOM) FILTERS. PROVIDE A
REPORT AND THE PLANNED PROTOCOL FOR DIRECT ON-FILTER ANALYSIS AND INDIRECT DISPERSED-PARTICLE
ANALYSIS. THE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH WILL FOCUS ON REVIEW OF MICRO-XRF ANALYSIS RESEARCH WORK.
TASK B. DIRECT-ON-FILTER CHARACTERIZATION OF DUSTY PARTICLES
FOR DIRECT-ON-FILTER ANALYSIS, SCANNING ELECTRON MICROSCOPE (SEM) AND MICRO X-RAY FLUORESCENCE
(MICRO-XRF) AND OTHER APPROPRIATE METHODS WILL BE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE THE ABILITY TO
CHARACTERIZE THE PARTICLES ON THE CPDM TEOM FILTERS. THE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH WILL FOCUS ON THE
RESEARCH WORK OF DIRECT-ON-FILTER CHARACTERIZATION BY USING MICRO-XRF. THE RESEARCH WORK INCLUDE
THE SAMPLE PREPARATION, PROCEDURE DEVELOPMENT, MICRO-XRF ANALYSIS.
TASK C. INDIRECT DISPERSED-PARTICLE ANALYSIS
THE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH WILL PARTICIPATE THE DEVELOPMENT OF PROCEDURE FOR NONDESTRUCTIVE
DISPERSION OF PARTICLES FROM CPDM TEOM FILTERS.
TASK D. RESULTS ANALYSIS AND FINAL REPORT
A FINAL REPORT OF TAKES WHICH ARE CONDUCTED AT THE UNIVERSITY OF UTAH WILL REPORTED TO THE TEAM
FOR COMPLETE FINAL REPORT ON PROOF OF CONCEPT.2. OPTION PHASE: WILL CONTINUE THE ORIGINAL PROPOSED RESEARCH
TASK E. DUST SAMPLING OF UNDERGROUND COAL MINE SITE
ONE TO FOUR UNDERGROUND COAL MINES WILL BE VISITED BY THE TEAM. CPDM TEOM FILTERS WILL BE
COLLECTED AND CAPPED WITH THE 3D-PRINTED CAPS FROM THE PROOF OF CONCEPT CONTRACT. STUDENTS FROM
THREE UNIVERSITIES WILL TRAVEL TO UNDERGROUND COAL MINE SITES, WORK ALONG WITH EMPLOYEES ON SITE,
AND COLLECT DUST SAMPLES. CPDM/TEOM DUST SAMPLES WILL BE OUR TARGET SAMPLE. DUST-LOADED
TEOM FILTER SAMPLES AFTER EACH SHIFT WILL BE CAREFULLY REMOVED FROM CPDM DEVICES. FILTER SAMPLES
WILL BE PACKED, SEALED, AND TRANSPORTED TO PISÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢ LABORATORIES. ALTERNATIVELY, DUST-LOADED TEOM
FILTERS WILL BE STORED IN SEALED GLASS/PLASTIC TUBES FOR SAMPLE TRANSPORTATION. THE UNIVERSITY OF
UTAH WILL PARTICIPATE AND ORGANIZED THE SAMPLING IN ONE OF COAL MINE IN UTAH.

prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT NANOTECHNOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_name: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA
subawardee_business_types: NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,1862 LAND GRANT COLLEGE,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description: WE WILL WORK WITH UW-MADISON AND OTHER PARTNERS TO COMPARE SARS-COV-2 SEQUENCE DIVERSITY AND VIRAL PHYLODYNAMICS WITHIN AND BETWEEN REGIONS WITH DIFFERENCES IN VACCINE UPTAKE. SPECIFICALLY, WE WILL WORK IN COLLABORATION WITH THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (MDH) TO GENERATE 1000 SEQUENCES PER YEAR FROM VACCINE Ã¢Â‚¬Å“UP-TO-DATEÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½ INDIVIDUALS AND 1000 SEQUENCES PER YEAR FROM UNVACCINATED OR NOT UP-TO-DATE PEOPLE IN RURAL AND URBAN COMMUNITIES IN MN. IN ADDITION, WE WILL EVALUATE THE IMPACT OF VACCINATION STATUS AND GEOGRAPHIC SETTING ON SARS-COV-2 TRANSMISSION AND EVOLUTION IN MN. WE WILL EVALUATE THE IMPACTS OF VACCINATION STATUS, GEOGRAPHIC SETTING, AND SOCIODEMOGRAPHIC FEATURES ON VIRAL TRANSMISSION AND EVOLUTION. WE WILL MODEL TRANSMISSION AMONG 4 GROUPS: URBAN AND UP-TO-DATE ON VACCINATION AT THE TIME OF SAMPLING, URBAN NOT-UP-TO-DATE, RURAL UP-TO-DATE, AND RURAL NOT-UP-TO-DATE. WE WILL INFER HOW TRANSMISSION RATES AMONG THESE GROUPS VARY OVER TIME AND WITH THE EMERGENCE OF NEW VARIANTS. FINALLY, WE WILL WORK WITH MDH (AND OTHER PARTNERS) TO DEVELOP A DATA INFRASTRUCTURE CAPABLE OF MANAGING ASSOCIATIONS BETWEEN PUBLICLY AVAILABLE SEQUENCE DATA AND PROTECTED HEALTH INFORMATION.

subaward_description: ENABLE SARS-COV-2 SEQUENCING AND ANALYSIS FROM VACCINE Ã¢Â‚¬Å“UP-TO-DATEÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½ INDIVIDUALS AND FROM UNVACCINATED OR NOT UP-TO-DATE PEOPLE IN THE DIFFERENT TYPES OF COMMUNITIES REPRESENTED AMONG PARTICIPATING GROUPS. TASK 2. EVALUATE THE IMPACT OF VACCINATION STATUS AND GEOGRAPHIC SETTING ON SARS-COV-2 TRANSMISSION AND EVOLUTION IN THE UPPER MIDWEST. TASK 3. IMPROVE GENOMIC DATA AND METADATA INTEGRATION BETWEEN LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH, STATE PUBLIC HEALTH, ACADEMIC, AND CLINICAL PARTNERS. THE TRUSTEES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA SITE WILL PARTICIPATE IN ALL THREE TASKS ACROSS ALL 3 YEARS. IN YEARS 1-3, DR. MONCLA AND HER TEAM WILL PERFORM PHYLODYNAMIC ANALYSES TO UNCOVER PATTERNS OF TRANSMISSION AND HOW SOURCES OF TRANSMISSION VARY OVER TIME AND SPACE. IN YEAR 1, DR. MONCLA WILL DEVELOP THE PHYLODYNAMIC MODELS WITH EXISTING DATA FROM WISCONSIN. IN YEARS 2 AND 3, DR. MONCLA AND HER TEAM WILL EXPAND THE UTILITY OF THESE MODELS ACROSS A LARGER GEOGRAPHIC AREA AND TO OTHER MIDWESTERN SITES.

subaward_description: VAERS IS A MANDATED PROGRAM SPONSORED JOINTLY BY THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION (CDC) AND THE US FOOD AND DRUG ADMINISTRATION (FDA). THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT AS AUTHORIZED BY THE NATIONAL CHILDHOOD VACCINE INJURY ACT (NCVIA), P.L. 99- 660, IS TO PROVIDE A SINGLE NATIONWIDE MECHANISM TO REPORT, ANALYZE AND MONITOR VACCINE ADVERSE EVENTS (VAES) THAT OCCUR AFTER RECEIPT OF VACCINES. IT ALSO PROVIDES A VEHICLE FOR DISSEMINATING VACCINE SAFETY INFORMATION TO VACCINES, FAMILY MEMBERS, HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS, VACCINE MANUFACTURERS, GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, AND OTHER PARTNERS.

subawardee_name: THE TRUSTEES OF COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IN THE CITY OF NEW YORK
subawardee_business_types: PRIVATE UNIVERSITY OR COLLEGE,NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description:
COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IRVING MEDICAL CENTER SUBCONTRACT SCOPE OF WORK
COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IRVING MEDICAL CENTER WILL SERVE AS A SITE FOR THE RESPIRATORY VIRUS TRANSMISSION NETWORK (RVTN) TO STUDY HOUSEHOLD TRANSMISSION OF INFLUENZA. COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IRVING MEDICAL CENTER WILL RECRUIT APPROXIMATELY 150 PARTICIPANTS WITH ACUTE INFLUENZA INFECTION AND THEIR HOUSEHOLD MEMBERS TO THE STUDY. USING STUDY MATERIALS PROVIDED BY WASHINGTON UNIVERSITY, COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IRVING MEDICAL CENTER INVESTIGATORS WILL PROVIDE PARTICIPANTS WITH SELF-COLLECTION MATERIALS, COLLECT QUESTIONNAIRE DATA, MONITOR PARTICIPANT ACTIVITES, AND RECEIVE COMPLETED SAMPLES. COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IRVING MEDICAL CENTER WILL STORE SAMPLES IN THE COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IRVING MEDICAL CENTER LABORATORY AS DIRECTED BY THE PROTOCOL AND SHIP SAMPLES TO WASHINGTON UNIVERSITY OR OTHER DESIGNATED LABORATORY. THE SITE WILL ENTER DATA IN A TIMELY FASHION INTO THE REDCAP DATABASE.

DR. MELISSA STOCKWELL, PROFESSOR OF PEDIATRICS AND POPULATION AND FAMILY HEALTH, WILL BE THE SITE PI ON THE SUBAWARD. SHE WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ASSURING THAT ALL STUDY ACTIVITIES ARE CARRIED OUT AS OUTLINED IN THE PROTOCOL. SHE WILL OBTAIN AN IRB RELIANCE AGREEMENT WITH WASHINGTON UNIVERSITY AND MAINTAIN APPROVAL. SHE WILL HIRE AND OVERSEE STUDY STAFF TO CARRY OUT THE STUDY ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED ABOVE. SHE WILL ALSO SERVE ON THE STEERING COMMITTEE AS COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IRVING MEDICAL CENTERÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S REPRESENTATIVE AND MAINTAIN FREQUENT CONTACT WITH THE STUDY PI DR. KWON.

prime_award_program_activities_funding_t: 0005: EMERGING AND ZOONOTIC INFECTIOUS DISEASES (0949)
prime_award_base_transaction_description: GENERAL HOSPITAL CORPORATION
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT NANOTECHNOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description:
DR. ROBERT SMITH AND COLLEAGUES AT MAINEHEALTH AND MAINEHEALTH INSTITUTE FOR RESEARCH WILL IDENTIFY PATIENTS
WITH LYME DISEASE IN THE MAINEHEALTH SYSTEM THROUGH REGULARLY SCHEDULED ELECTRONIC MEDICAL HEALTH RECORD
(EPIC) SCANS AND EXTRACT CLINICAL INFORMATION TO PROVIDE DEÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½IDENTIFIED DETAILS OF DISEASE TO A COMBINED DATA BASE
IN CONCERT WITH A COORDINATED APPROACH AT MASSACHUSETTS GENERAL HOSPITAL (MGH) AND TUFTSMEDICINE.
AGGREGATED DATA WILL BE SHARED WITH RESEARCHERS AT THE FEDERAL CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL TO BETTER UNDERSTAND
THE HEALTH BURDEN AND OUTCOMES IN OF LYME DISEASE IN OUR HIGHLY ENDEMIC REGION. MAINEHEALTH INSTITUTE FOR
RESEARCH INVESTIGATORS UNDER DR. SMITHÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S DIRECTION WILL WORK WITH MGH AND TUFTS TEAMS TO CREATE A UNIFIED AND
EFFECTIVE CASE DEFINITION FOR IDENTIFYING PATIENTS WITH LYME DISEASE.
DR. SMITH, WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF INFECTIOUS DISEASE COLLEAGUE DR. STEPHEN RAWLINGS, WILL ASSIST A TRAINED CLINICAL
STUDY COORDINATOR IN CASE IDENTIFICATION AND DATA EXTRACTION. DR. SUSAN ELIAS WILL OVERSEE DATA MANAGEMENT AT
THE MHIR SITE AND COÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½ORDINATE WITH THE TEAMS AT MGH AND TUFTSMEDICINE TO ASSURE STANDARDIZATION. THE FIRST
YEAR OF WORK WILL INVOLVE COORDINATED (MGH, TUFTS, MAINEHEALTH) MODEL DEVELOPMENT, VALIDATION, AND
DEPLOYMENT AS DESCRIBED IN THE FULL PROPOSAL. WE WILL FIRST CREATE A BASELINE MODEL OF SUBJECTS WHO ARE
DIAGNOSED AS HAVING LYME DISEASE BY ICD9/10 CODES. WE WILL THEN WORK TO DERIVE IMPROVED MODELS BY
IDENTIFYING INFORMATIVE DIAGNOSTIC CRITERIA FROM CLINICAL, EPIDEMIOLOGICAL, MICROBIOLOGICAL AND FREE TEXT DATA IN
CASE AND CONTROL VISITS.
WE WILL COMPARE THE PERFORMANCE OF ONE OR MORE IMPROVED MODELS AND SELECT THE BEST PERFORMING ONE. WE
WILL IMPLEMENT THE SELECTED MODEL FOR RECORD REVIEW AT MAINEHEALTH, SUMMARIZE THE RESULTS, AND AGGREGATE
SUMMARY STATISTICS ACROSS SITES. BASED UPON A UNIFIED, EFFECTIVE CASE DEFINITION AND A ROBUST MODEL TO IDENTIFY
CASES OF LYME DISEASE FROM EPIC DATA, WE WILL CONDUCT TARGETED INVESTIGATIONS TO ANSWER SPECIFIC QUESTIONS. WE
WILL IDENTIFY POTENTIAL RECRUITMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR RESEARCH SUBJECTS BASED UPON SPECIFIC CRITERIA (E.G.
NEUROBORRELIOSIS, PREGNANCY, IMPACT OF COÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½INFECTIONS, VACCINATION) DEFINED IN CONSULTATION WITH THE FULL
INVESTIGATOR TEAM AND RELEVANT TECHNICAL TEAM AT CDC. WE WILL ENROLL A SUBSET OF THESE INDIVIDUALS IN CLINICAL
STUDIES TO ADDRESS CURRENT GAPS OR NEW QUESTIONS, INCLUDING THE PERFORMANCE OF NOVEL DIAGNOSTIC ASSAYS, THE
OUTCOMES OF PREGNANCY, AND VACCINE EFFICACY.

subaward_description: TO CONDUCT RESEARCH TASKS TO ADDRESS THE CONTINUOUS AND EMERGING THREATS POSED BY CORONAVIRUS (COV) PANDEMICS. GENERATE REPORTS FOR CYTOF TECHNLOGY DATA ANALYSIS COMPARING THE CIRCULATING IMMUNE INDICATORS OF COV INFECTION IN BOTH ANIMAL MODELS AND HUMAN CLINICAL SAMPLES. GENERATE REPORTS FROM CODEX/PANINI DATA FOR ANALYSIS OF HIGH-PARAMETER TISSUE IMAGING FOR COV-INDUCED PATHOLOGY IN BOTH INFECTED NHPS AND AUTOPSY TISSUES FROM COVID-19 PATIENTS. SHARE DATA ANALYSIS REPORTS WITH STANFORD UNIVERSITY AND PUBLISH RESULTS IN CO-AUTHORED PUBLICATIONS.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: BAA TOXWP 118/CTP-2022-112800 -EVALUATE AND PROMOTE THE USE OF CELL- AND TISSUE-BASED ASSAYS THAT MORE ACCURATELY REPRESENT HUMAN SUSCEPTIBILITY THAN ANIMAL MODELS TO ADVERSE REACTIONS AND PREDICT THRESHOLD OF TOXICOLOGICAL CONCERNS RESULTING FROM EX
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_business_types: PRIVATE UNIVERSITY OR COLLEGE,NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description:
DR. TIROUVANZIAM AND HIS LABORATORY AT EMORY UNIVERSITY COMMITS TO PROVIDING SUPPORT FOR THE FDA GRANT DIRECTED BY DR. SHUICHI TAKAYAMA (THE GEORGIA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY AND EMORY UNIVERISTY, ATLANTA, GEORGIA, USA), ENTITLED: Ã¢Â‚¬Å“IN VITRO ASSESSMENT OF CHEMICAL MIXTURE- INDUCED AIRWAY INFLAMMAAON IN HEALTHY AND DISEASED LUNGSÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½.
THIS PROJECT WILL USE A HIGH-THROUGHPUT IN VITRO AIR-BLOOD BARRIER ARRAY BASED BARRIER BREAKDOWN AND NEUTROPHIL TRANSMIGRATION/ACTIVATION ASSAY TO PREDICT HUMAN ADVERSE REACTIONS TO INHALED SUBSTANCES. DOSE RESPONSE CURVES AND BENCHMARK DOSES (BMD) WILL BE DETERMINED FOR A RANGE OF WELL-KNOWN AND UNKNOWN SUBSTANCES INCLUDING ELECTRONIC NICOTINE DELIVERY SYSTEMS (ENDS) CONSTITUENTS AND MIXTURES. INITIAL YEARS WILL FOCUS ON HIGH-THROUGHPUT E-CIGARETTE VAPOR EXTRACTS (EVE) ANALYSIS, LATER YEARS WILL ALSO ANALYZE E-CIGARETTE AEROSOL DIRECTLY IN A LOWER-THROUGHPUT FORMAT. THE ORGAN-LEVEL FUNCTIONAL READOUTS (TEER & TRANSMIGRATION) RELATE CLOSELY TO CLINICAL/PRE-CLINICAL BRONCHOALVEOLAR LAVAGE (BAL) MEASURES, ARE CONVENIENT IN CONSISTING OF JUST A FEW KEY NUMBERS, YET ARE INTEGRATIVE OF MULTIPLE MOLECULAR AND CELLULAR PATHWAYS AND THUS HIGHLY PHYSIOLOGICALLY-RELEVANT. THIS PROJECT WILL ANALYZE THE EFFECT OF BIOLOGICALLY VARIABILITY WITH REGARDS TO THE SEX OF THE PRIMARY HUMAN NEUTROPHILS AND EPITHELIAL CELLS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO ANALYZE THE IMPACT VAPING PLUS OTHER LUNG INSULTS CAN HAVE WHEN COMBINED TOGETHER BY TESTING EVES IN COMBINATION WITH DEFINED INFLAMMATORY COCKTAILS REFERRED TO AS SYNTHETIC AIRWAY FLUID SUPERNATANT (SASN) (EARLY YEARS) OR COPD ASN (LATER YEARS).
SUPPORT PROVIDED BY THE TIROUVANZIAM LAB AT ERMORY WILL BE IN THE FORM OF: (I) SUPPORT FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PRIMARY MODEL; (II) PERFORMANCE OF PHENOTYPIC AND FUNCTIONAL ASSAYS; (III) SUPPORT FOR DATA ANALYSIS AND INTEGRATION; AND (IV) REPORTING OF RESULTS AND CONTRIBUTION TO SCIENTIFIC ABSTRACTS AND MANUSCRIPTS.
THE TIROUVANZIAM LAB IS PARTICULARLY WELL EQUIPPED FOR SUCH STUDIES AND HAS UNIQUE EXPERTISE IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF IN VITRO ASSAYS RELATED TO AIRWAY NEUTROPHLIC INFLAMMATION, AS EVIDENCED BY PRIOR PUBLICATIONS RELEVANT TO THIS TOPIC. TO ENSURE PROPER IMPLEMENTATION OF THE EXTENSIVE WORK INCLUDED IN THIS STATEMENT, DR. TIROUVANZIAM WILL COMMIT 10% OF HIS EFFORT, 10% OF EFFORT FOR A POSTDOCTORAL BIOINFORMATICIAN AND 20% FOR A RESEARCH SPECIALIST SUPERVISOR IN EACH OF YRS 1-3 OF THIS PROJECT.

subaward_description:
"SAINT LUKEÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S: SUZANNE V. ARNOLD, MD, MHA IS A GENERAL CARDIOLOGIST, A MEMBER OF THE OUTCOMES
RESEARCH GROUP AT SAINT LUKEÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S MID AMERICA HEART INSTITUTE, AND PROFESSOR OF MEDICINE
AT UNIVERSITY OF MISSOURI-KANSAS CITY. DR. ARNOLD HAS LED A NUMBER OF METHODOLOGICAL
STUDIES OF HEALTH STATUS INSTRUMENTS, INCLUDING THE VALIDATION OF THE KCCQ IN PATIENTS
WITH SEVERE AORTIC STENOSIS. SHE HAS LED STUDIES EXAMINING HEALTH STATUS AFTER
TRANSCATHETER VALVE INTERVENTIONS (USING THE KCCQ), AS A PART OF CLINICAL TRIALS AND
OBSERVATIONAL DATASETS. SHE WILL BE THE OVERALL PROJECT PI.
PHILIP G. JONES, MS IS A SENIOR STATISTICIAN AT SAINT LUKEÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S MID AMERICA HEART INSTITUTE
AND HAS >20 YEARS OF EXPERTISE IN ANALYZING HEALTH STATUS DATA IN OBSERVATIONAL STUDIES
AND CLINICAL TRIALS. HE ALSO HAS DONE EXTENSIVE METHODOLOGIC WORK ON HEALTH STATUS
INSTRUMENTS, INCLUDING CO-DEVELOPING THE KCCQ-12 WITH DR. SPERTUS.

DANIELLE M. OLDS, RN, MPH, PHD IS A NURSE SCIENTIST AND MANAGER OF OUTCOMES
RESEARCH AT SAINT LUKEÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S MID AMERICA HEART INSTITUTE. DR. OLDS HAS EXTENSIVE QUALITATIVE
AND QUANTITATIVE EXPERTISE IN DEVELOPING QUALITY MEASURES, INCLUDING CONCEPTUALIZATION,
PILOT TESTING, RELIABILITY AND VALIDITY ASSESSMENTS, AND USABILITY DETERMINATION. SHE HAS
EXPERIENCE CONDUCTING INTERVIEWS, CODING TRANSCRIPTS, AND SYNTHESIZING FINDINGS TO
INFORM MEASURE DEVELOPMENT. SHE WILL LEAD THE QUALITATIVE STUDY AT SAINT LUKEÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S MAHI"

prime_award_program_activities_funding_t: 0001: BENEFIT PAYMENTS, SMI;0001: MEDICARE INTEGRITY PROGRAM;0001: NONRECURRING EXPENSES FUND PROJECTS;0001: PROGRAM OPERATIONS;0002: CDC WIDE ACTIVITIES AND PROGRAM SUPPORT (0943);0004: ADMINISTRATION, SMI;0009: OTHER MANDATORY PROGRAM ACTIVITY;0010: OTHER DISCRETIONARY PROGRAM ACTIVITY;0101: CMS DISCRETIONARY;0805: PROVIDER ENROLLMENT;0806: RECOVERY AUDIT CONTRACTORS;0813: OTHER REIMBURSABLE PROGRAM ACTIVITY
prime_award_base_transaction_description: THE PURPOSE OF THIS CONTRACT IS TO OBTAIN SERVICES FOR THE JURISDICTION H (PART A AND B) MEDICARE ADMINISTRATIVE CONTRACTOR (MAC). THE CONTRACTOR WILL PROVIDE SPECIFIED HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFIT ADMINISTRATION SERVICES, INCLUDING MEDICARE CLAIMS PROCESSING AND PAYMENT SERVICES, IN SUPPORT OF THE MEDICARE PROGRAM (ALSO KNOWN AS THE MEDICARE FEE-FOR-SERVICE, OR FFS, PROGRAM) FOR JURISDICTION H.  JURISDICTION H INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING STATES: ARKANSAS, COLORADO, LOUISIANA, MISSISSIPPI, NEW MEXICO, OKLAHOMA, AND TEXAS.
prime_award_naics_description: DIRECT HEALTH AND MEDICAL INSURANCE CARRIERS
subaward_description: SUBCONTRACTOR PERFORMS PROVIDER ENROLLMENT APPLICATIONS PROCESSING TASKS IN SUPPORT OF THE A/B MAC JURISDICTION H (JH) CONTRACT.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: IMPLEMENTATION OF THE HEDIS MEDICARE HEALTH OUTCOMES SURVEY
prime_award_naics_description: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES
subaward_description: SUBCONTRACTOR WILL PERFORM FIELD TESTING OF THE HOS AND/OR HOS-M SURVEY WITH SELECT NEW SURVEY CONTENT TO ALLOW CMS TO POTENTIALLY ENHANCE AND REFINE EXISTING MEASURES. THE FIELD TEST WILL BE CONDUCTED IN ENGLISH AND SPANISH AND WILL INCLUDE A MAIL-PHONE ARM IN ADDITION TO A WEB-MAIL-PHONE ARM. THE FIELD TEST WILL HAVE MULTIPLE OBJECTIVES: EVALUATING THE MEASUREMENT PROPERTIES OF NEW SURVEY ITEMS, EVALUATING THE EFFECTS OF NEW CONTENT AND A WEB-BASED MODE ON RESPONSE PATTERNS, AND MEASURING SCORES AS COMPARED TO EXISTING HOS SURVEY ITEMS AND PROTOCOLS.

prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT NANOTECHNOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description: SUBCONTRACTOR WILL UPDATE AND MODIFY THE SEER RESEARCH PLUS DATASET TO REPLACE CURRENT SEER DATA IN THE COVID-19 REAL-WORLD DATA INFRASTRUCTURE (CRWDI) TO ENABLE COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF CANCER RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH COVID-19. SUBCONTRACTOR WILL GENERATE A NEW REAL-TIME DATASET ENCOMPASSING EARLY REPORTED CANCERS DIAGNOSES FROM 2022 TO 2024. SUBCONTRACTOR WILL PROVIDE ANALYTIC SUPPORT TO NCI COLLABORATORS AND OTHER CRWDI RESEARCHERS. SUBCONTRACTOR WILL DEVELOP AN NCI DATA PRODUCT BASED ON THE LARGER CRWDI DATA ECOSYSTEM FOCUSING ON LONGITUDINAL ASSESSMENT OF DIFFERENTIAL RISK OF CANCER AMONG COVID-19 PATIENTS.

subaward_description: THIS SCOPE OF WORK FOR THIS SUBCONTRACT IS TO PROVIDE SENIOR PROJECT MANAGEMENT SUPPORT TO ALL ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF A RWD INFRASTRUCTURE THAT WILL LEVERAGE RWD ACROSS MULTIPLE ORGANIZATIONS TO ENABLE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COMBINED, LINKED, DE-IDENTIFIED INFRASTRUCTURE THAT WOULD BE AVAILABLE TO THE BROADER RESEARCH COMMUNITY TO BEGIN TO ANSWER MANY OF THESE QUESTIONS RELATED TO DURABILITY OF PROTECTION AMONG VACCINATED VERSUS NATIVELY ACQUIRED INFECTION; DURATION OF PROTECTION AMONG HIGH-RISK SUBPOPULATIONS SUCH AS CANCER PATIENTS AND/OR OTHER IMMUNOCOMPROMISED POPULATIONS. THE PROPOSED INFRASTRUCTURE WOULD CONSIST OF A PHASED APPROACH COMBINING LONGITUDINAL DATA IN A COMMON PLATFORM THAT WOULD INTEGRATE CLINICAL LABORATORY DATA ON SARS-COV-2 (BOTH PCR AND SEROLOGIC TESTS), VACCINATION STATUS OF PATIENTS INCLUDED, CLINICAL INFORMATION ON HOSPITALIZATION, SEVERITY OF ILLNESS, AND COMORBID CONDITIONS TO ENABLE A TIERED SYSTEM OF DATA ASSETS. IN ADDITION, TO PROVIDE SENIOR PROJECT MANAGEMENT SUPPORT TO ALL ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE EXPANSION OF REAL WORLD DATA PROJECT ASSESSING THE IMPACT OF SARS-COV-2 INFECTION ON CANCER INCIDENCE WITH AN EMPHASIS ON UNDERSTANDING THE ROLE OF SEROLOGICAL RESPONSE PROJECT.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: TO TITLE: A NOVEL MRNA VACCINE TO PREVENT TRIPLE NEGATIVE BREAST CANCER  IDIQ TITLE: PREVENT CANCER PRECLINICAL DRUG DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM: PRECLINICAL EFFICACY AND INTERMEDIATE ENDPOINT BIOMARKERS
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_dba_name: BOARD OF REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF OKLAHOMA HEALTH SCIENCES CENTER
subaward_description:
THE OVERALL OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DEVELOP A NOVEL, MULTIVALENT MRNA VACCINE AND TO TEST IN VIVO, IN
SYNGENEIC AND SPONTANEOUS TNBC MOUSE MODELS, THE VACCINEÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S EFFICACY IN PREVENTING TNBC DEVELOPMENT
AND PROGRESSION. THE THREE CANDIDATE ANTIGENS ARE TOP2A, CYCLIN E2 (CCNE2) AND KIF15.
THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES OF THE CURRENT TASK ORDER ARE AS FOLLOWS:
(1) DESIGN, SYNTHESIS, CHARACTERIZATION, AND OPTIMIZATION OF THE MONOVALENT TOP2A, CCNE2 AND KIF15
MRNA VACCINES.
(2) EVALUATION OF IMMUNOGENICITY, EFFICACY, AND PRELIMINARY TOLERABILITY OF THE MONOVALENT MRNA VACCINES
(INDIVIDUALLY OR GIVEN THREE TOGETHER), IN COMPARISON WITH THE RESPECTIVE PEPTIDE VACCINES IN SYNGENEIC
MICE. DIFFERENT IMMUNIZATION ROUTES, DOSES AND SCHEDULES SHALL BE EVALUATED.
(3) OPTIONAL TASK: UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF OBJECTIVES (1) AND (2), AND AT THE REQUEST OF THE NCI,
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL DESIGN, SYNTHESIZE, CHARACTERIZE, AND OPTIMIZE THE TRIVALENT MRNA VACCINE FOR
TUMOR PREVENTION EFFICACY IN A SPONTANEOUS MOUSE MODEL OF TNBC.

TASK 5 WILL PROVIDE TARGETED AND NON-TARGETED METABOLITE PROFILING FOR PLASMA OR SERUM SAMPLES FROM INDIVIDUALS INCLUDED IN DESIGNATED NHLBI TRANS-OMICS FOR PRECISION MEDICINE (TOPMED) PROGRAM PROJECT STUDIES.  DR. BOERWINKLE AND THE UTHEALTH GROUP WILL: 
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH DR. GIBBS AND THE BCM HGSC ON DATA INTEGRATION, DATA FORMATS, QUALITY CONTROL AND QUALITY ASSURANCE, AND OTHER ISSUES DESIGNATED BY NHLBI.
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH METABOLON AND THE BCM HGSC TO GENERATE A MANUAL OF OPERATIONS (MOO) PROVIDING DETAILED STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES FOR ALL STEPS IN THE WORKFLOW. 
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	OVERSEE THE GENERATION OF METABOLITE PROFILE DATA BY METABOLON, INC., ENSURING THAT ALL WORK PRODUCT CONFORMS TO THE SPECIFICATIONS IN THE CONTRACT STATEMENT OF WORK (SEE ATTACHMENT 2A NOTICE OF AWARD WITHIN THIS AGREEMENT), INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, METHODS AND PROTOCOLS, DATA QUALITY, AND DATA CLASSIFICATION.  
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	OVERSEE THE SECURE TRANSMISSION OF PROJECT DATA TO THE PROJECT STUDIES, THE TOPMED DATA COORDINATING CENTER (DCC) AND/OR THE TOPMED INFORMATICS RESEARCH CENTER (IRC).  
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	CONTRIBUTE TO CONTRACT REPORTING REQUIREMENTS AND OTHER AD HOC REQUESTS FROM THE TOPMED PROGRAM.
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	PROVIDE BCM HGSC NECESSARY INFORMATION FOR PROJECT INVOICING, IN A FORMAT TO BE COLLABORATIVELY DETERMINED BY BCM HGSC AND UTHEALTH.

BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES USED AS PART OF IMMUNE PROFILING STUDIES OF HUMAN INFECTION AND VACCINATION. THIS

DESCRIBE IMMUNE EXPOSURES.

subaward_description: CELLULAR IMMUNITY, LARGELY REGULATED BY CD4+ T CELLS, IS REQUIRED IN CONTROL OF INFECTION WITH THE PATHOGENIC FUNGUS BLASTOMYCES DERMATITIDIS. WE PROPOSE TO  IDENTIFY HUMAN CD4+ T CELL EPITOPES OF B. DERMATITIDIS. WE WILL INVESTIGATE SYNTHETIC PEPTIDES FROM VARIOUS "FAST TRACK" ANTIGENS, INCLUDING CALNEXIN, BAD1, BYS1, PRA1, ZRT1, AND BL-ENG2, AS WELL AS NINE PRODUCTS REPORTED TO BE TRANSCRIPTIONALLY INCREASED DURING INFECTION IN MACROPHAGES IN VITRO AND MICE DURING PULMONARY INFECTION. ADDITIONAL GENE PRODUCTS REPORTEDLY UPREGULATED IN THOSE MODELS MAY ALSO BE STUDIED. SYNTHETIC PEPTIDES OF THE PRODUCTS ABOVE WILL BE SCREENED INITIALLY FOR THEIR IMMUNOGENICITY/RECOGNITION IN HLA-DR4 TRANSGENIC MICE AND THOSE OR RELATED PEPTIDES FURTHER ANALYZED/CONFIRMED FOR RECOGNITION BY HUMANS THAT HAVE BEEN INFECTED WITH B. DERMATITIDIS. IMMUNE RESPONSES IN THE MICE AND IN HUMANS WILL BE MEASURED BY STANDARD ASSAYS FOR CYTOKINE AND CELLULAR RESPONSE. AT THE END OF THIS PROJECT, WE WILL HAVE IDENTIFIED HUMAN CD4+ T CELL EPITOPES OF ANTIGENS FROM B. DERMATITIDIS AND DEPOSITED INFORMATION ABOUT THESE PEPTIDE SEQUENCES INTO THE IMMUNE EPITOPE DATABASE (IEDB.ORG).

subaward_description:
THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IDENTIFY T-CELL EPITOPES OF PATHOGENIC FUNGI INCLUDING SPECIES IN THE
GENERA OF BLASTOMYCES, COCCIDIOIDES, CRYPTOCOCCUS, AND HISTOPLAMA. THE SUBCONTRACT SITE AT
UTSA WILL CONDUCT THE PROPOSED EXPERIMENTS FOR THE IDENTIFICATION AND CONFIRMATION OF
COCCIDIOIDES T CELL EPITOPES. THE NEWLY IDENTIFIED T-CELL EPITOPES CAN BE USED IN AN ARRAY OF
BASIC IMMUNOLOGICAL RESEARCH TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE FUNGUS-HOST INTERACTION AS WELL AS
TRANSLATIONAL APPLICATIONS INCLUDING DEVELOPMENT OF VACCINES AND DIAGNOSTIC REAGENTS FOR
COCCIDIOIDES INFECTION. DR. HUNG WILL DIRECT ALL EXPERIMENTS AT UTSA AND COLLABORATE WITH DR. STU
LEVITZ AND OTHER COLLABORATORS ON THIS PROJECT TO COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING TASKS:
1. COMPILE A SET OF FAST TRACK PROTEINS THAT HAVE BEEN PREVIOUSLY IDENTIFIED AND EVALUATED AS
COCCIDIOIDES ANTIGENS FOR VACCINE AND SEROLOGICAL DIAGNOSIS.
2. ASSIST IN THE DOWN SELECTION OF COCCIDIOIDES ANTIGENS AND POTENTIAL T-CELL EPITOPES THAT
ARE PREDICTED BY BIOINFORMATICS ANALYSIS.
3. CONDUCT T-CELL ACTIVATION ASSAYS TO EVALUATE IMMUNOREACTIVITY OF THE PREDICTED T-CELL
EPITOPES FROM THE NEWLY PREDICTED EPITOPES USING HUMAN LEUKOCYTE ANTIGEN (HLA-DR4)
TRANSGENIC MICE THAT ARE VACCINATED WITH THE FAST TRACK OR NEWLY IDENTIFIED COCCIDIOIDES
ANTIGENS.
4. HUNG'S LABORATORY WILL PREPARE SAMPLES FOR EVALUATION CD4+ T CELLS RESPONSE OF THE
VACCINATED AND CONTROL MICE. SAMPLES WILL BE SHIPPED TO UMMS FOR CYTOKINE ASSAYS
INCLUDING TH1 AND TH17 RESPONSES WILL BE USED TO DELINEATE THE PROTECTIVE IMMUNITY
ELICITED BY THE VACCINE.
5. HUNG'S LABORATORY WILL PREPARE HUMAN PERIPHERAL BLOOD MONOCYTIC CELLS (PBMCS) FROM
BLOOD SAMPLES DONATED BY PATIENTS WHO HAVE RECOVERED FROM PULMONARY
COCCIDIOIDOMYCOSIS. DR. NEIL AMPEL WILL COLLECT THOSE BLOOD SAMPLES AND SHIP THEM TO
HUNG'S LABORATORY. EACH PREDICTED EPITOPES WILL BE INCUBATED WITH HUMAN PBMCS
SEPARATELY TO STIMULATE T-CELL RESPONSE. THE CULTURE SUPERNATANTS WILL BE COLLECTED FOR
CYTOKINE ASSAYS.
6. HUNG WILL COMMUNICATE WITH DR. STUART LEVITZ AND OTHER COLLABORATORS IN THIS PROJECT.
HUNG'S LABORATORY WILL ALSO ASSIST IN ANALYZING DATA AND WRITING SCIENTIFIC REPORTS.
7. THE NEWLY IDENTIFIED AND CONFIRMED HUMAN T-CELL EPITOPES OF COCCIDIOIDES WILL BE
DEPOSITED INTO IEDB EPITOPE DATABASED FOR SHARING WITH THE RESEARCH COMMUNITY.
