prime_award_base_transaction_description: IMMUNE MECHANISMS OF PROTECTION AGAINST MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS CENTER (IMPAC-TB)
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description:
STATEMENT OF WORK: DEFINING THE ROLE OF CD8 T CELLS INDUCED BY A NOVEL LIPOSOMAL NANOPARTICLE MRNA VACCINE IN PREVENTING MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS INFECTION.
THE GOAL OF IMPAC-TB IS TO IDENTIFY MECHANISMS OF PROTECTIVE IMMUNITY AGAINST TB, AND OUR OVERALL STRATEGY FOR THE CASCADE IMPAC-TB ANIMAL PROGRAM IS TO START WITH GOLD-STANDARDS OF VACCINE-MEDIATED PROTECTION (I.E, CMV/TB AND IV BCG IN NHP; BCG IN MICE) AND THEN DISSECT HOW PROTECTION IS MEDIATED. THE AKAGERA MRNA VACCINE REPRESENTS A NEW GOLD STANDARD FOR PREVENTION OF INFECTION Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ THE BEST VACCINE-MEDIATED PROTECTION EVER OBSERVED IN MICE. TO ACHIEVE OUR GOAL OF IDENTIFYING MECHANISMS OF TB IMMUNITY, CASCADE IMPAC-TB WOULD LIKE TO IDENTIFY THE ANTIGENS AND T CELL SUBSETS THAT MEDIATE THE PROTECTION PROVIDED BY THE NEW AKAGERA MRNA VACCINE, WHICH SHOWS THE BEST VACCINE-MEDIATED PROTECTION EVER OBSERVED IN MICE. 

THE SPECIFIC WORK TO BE PERFORMED IS DETAILED BELOW. UNDER ALL THREE AIMS, AKAGERA MEDICINES WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR CREATING THE MRNA VACCINE CONSTRUCTS REQUIRED FOR EACH EXPERIMENT. IN ADDITION, SCIENTISTS AT AKAGERA MEDICINES WILL ALSO MEET REGULARLY WITH SCIENTISTS AT SCRI TO EVALUATE PROGRESS, DESIGN NEW CONSTRUCTS, AND TROUBLE-SHOOT, AS NECESSARY. 

AIM 1: IDENTIFY PROTECTIVE ANTIGENS IN THE AKAGERA MRNA VACCINE. 
AKAGERA MEDICINES WILL PREPARE SEPARATE MRNA VACCINE CONSTRUCTS FOR 4 ORFS (TB10.4, MTB39, AND ESAT-6 WHICH ARE THE MOST IMMUNOGENIC ANTIGENS IN THE MRNA VACCINE, AND MTB32, WHICH ALONG WITH MTB39 IS PART OF THE M72 VACCINE). THESE WILL BE SENT TO SCRI FOR TESTING IN MICE, TO COMPARE THE PROTECTIVE EFFICACY OF THE PARENTAL MRNA VACCINE, EACH OF THESE 4 CONSTRUCTS INDIVIDUALLY, POOLED ADMINISTRATION OF TB10.4, MTB39, ESAT-6 MRNA CONSTRUCTS, AND THAT SAME POOL WITH THE ADDITION OF MTB32. SCRI WILL MEASURE THE THREE METRICS OF IMMUNITY THAT WERE PREVIOUSLY DEFINED IN THE ULD MODEL: REDUCTION OF LUNG BACTERIAL BURDENS, PREVENTION OF DISSEMINATION TO THE CONTRALATERAL LUNG, AND PREVENTION OF DETECTABLE INFECTION. COLONIES WILL BE COLLECTED, DNA ISOLATED, AND BAR-CODES AMPLIFIED AND SEQUENCED TO DETERMINE THE NUMBER OF FOUNDING MTB STRAINS IN EACH LUNG. BECAUSE THE GROUP SIZES WILL HAVE TO BE REDUCED TO 15 MICE (RATHER THAN OUR MORE STANDARD 20) TO ACCOMMODATE THE NUMBER OF VACCINES TESTED SIMULTANEOUSLY, THE EXPERIMENT WILL BE REPEATED FOUR TIMES TO ASSURE REPRODUCIBILITY AND STATISTICAL RIGOR. IF PROTECTION CONFERRED BY THE THREE OR FOUR POOLED ANTIGENS IS NOT SIMILAR TO THAT CONFERRED BY THE PARENT VACCINE, AKAGERA MEDICINES WILL SYNTHESIZE ADDITIONAL ANTIGENS UNTIL A COCKTAIL OF ANTIGENS THAT CONFERS SIMILAR PROTECTION IS FOUND.
AIM 2: IDENTIFY AND ELIMINATE CD8 EPITOPES FROM MRNA VACCINE CONSTRUCTS. 
THIS AIM WILL FOCUS ON EACH ANTIGEN THAT CONFERRED SOME DEGREE OF PROTECTION AGAINST ESTABLISHING SUSTAINED INFECTION IN AIM 1. ANTIGENS THAT DID NOT PREVENT DETECTABLE INFECTION WILL NOT BE EXAMINED FURTHER IN AIM 2. IN PRIOR CD8 EPITOPE MAPPING STUDIES, TB10.4 IS KNOWN TO HAVE TWO EPITOPES, TB10.4 ON THE H-2B BACKGROUND (C57BL/6) AND TB10.4 ON THE H-2D BACKGROUND (BALB/C), AND MTB32A IS KNOWN TO HAVE ONE EPITOPE ON THE H-2B BACKGROUND (C57BL/6) (MTB32). THUS, IF THESE ANTIGENS ARE FOUND TO CONTRIBUTE TO PREVENTION OF INFECTION IN AIM 1, AKAGERA MEDICINES WILL MAKE A TRUNCATED TB10.4 OR MTB32A CONSTRUCT THAT LACKS THE RESPECTIVE CD8 EPITOPES, BUT WHICH WOULD STILL CONTAIN KNOWN CD4 EPITOPES. FOR MTB39 AND ESAT6, THE CD8 EPITOPES HAVE NOT BEEN MAPPED, BUT IF EITHER MTB39 OR ESAT-6 WERE SHOWN IN AIM 1 TO CONTRIBUTE TO PREVENTING INFECTION, AKAGERA WOULD GENERATE OVERLAPPING PEPTIDES FOR EACH ANTIGEN AND MAP THE EPITOPE(S) RESPONSIBLE USING STIMULATIONS ASSAYS WITH SPLENOCYTES FROM IMMUNIZED B6XBALB/C F1 MICE. AFTER IDENTIFYING THE EPITOPES, AKAGERA MEDICINES WOULD GENERATE NEW CONSTRUCTS THAT SPECIFICALLY LACKED THE CD8 EPITOPES, EITHER VIA TRUNCATION OR POINT MUTATION OF AMINO ACID RESIDUES PREDICTED TO BE CRITICAL FOR THE RESPONSE. 	
MICE WOULD BE I

prime_award_base_transaction_description: IMMUNE MECHANISMS OF PROTECTION AGAINST MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS CENTER (IMPAC-TB)
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_business_types: U.S. STATE GOVERNMENT,1862 LAND GRANT COLLEGE,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
THE PURPOSE OF THIS SUBAWARD IS TO STUDY HOW THE BASELINE STATE AND FUNCTION OF ALVEOLAR MACROPHAGES CAN BE ALTERED BY VACCINATION AND OTHER HOST FACTORS, IN THE CONTEXT OF MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS INFECTION. THE PROPOSED STUDIES WILL INVESTIGATE THE MECHANISMS THAT DRIVE INNATE CELL REPROGRAMMING BY VACCINATION AND ITS IMPACT ON THE HOST IMMUNE RESPONSE AND BACTERIAL CONTROL. THE SUBAWARD WILL ALSO PERFORM A CROSS-SPECIES ANALYSIS OF ALVEOLAR MACROPHAGES BY ANALYZING EPIGENETIC STATES ACROSS MOUSE AND HUMAN SAMPLES AND LINKING MACROPHAGE EPIGENETIC STATES TO TRANSCRIPTIONAL RESPONSES.

1)	ANALYZE EPIGENETIC PROFILES GENERATED BY ATAC-SEQ AND TRANSCRIPTIONAL PROFILES GENERATED BY RNA-SEQ FOR UNTREATED VERSUS INTERFERON-TRAINED MURINE ALVEOLAR MACROPHAGES. 

2)	PERFORM ATAC-SEQ EPIGENETIC PROFILING ON FROZEN HUMAN ADHERENT BAL SAMPLES FROM ACTIVE TB, RESISTER, HEALTHY CONTROLS, AND SUBCLINICAL TB INDIVIDUALS. PROFILING INCLUDES: CELL PREPARATION, TRANSPOSITION REACTION AND PURIFICATION, PCR AMPLIFICATION, LIBRARY PURIFICATION, AND LIBRARY QC.

3)	COMPARE AND CONTRAST MOUSE AND HUMAN ALVEOLAR MACROPHAGE TRANSCRIPTIONAL AND EPIGENETIC PROFILES.

4)	GENERATE BULK RNA-SEQUENCING SAMPLES FOR MTB-INFECTED B6 AND C3H ALVEOLAR MACROPHAGES FOLLOWING SA161 HIGH DOSE AEROSOL INFECTION. 

5)	PERFORM IN VITRO MTB INFECTIONS AND IN VIVO AEROSOL INFECTIONS AFTER AM TRANSFER USING WT, SP140-/-, AND SP140-/-IFNAR-/- MURINE EX VIVO ALVEOLAR MACROPHAGE (MEXAM) PRIMARY CELL LINES TO STUDY ALVEOLAR MACROPHAGE RESPONSE TO VACCINATION AND INTERFERON EXPOSURES.

subawardee_name: REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA
subawardee_business_types: NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,1862 LAND GRANT COLLEGE,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description:
THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE IMPAC-TB PROGRAM IS TO INFORM THE RATIONAL DESIGN OF AN EFFECTIVE TB VACCINE BY IDENTIFICATION OF IMMUNE RESPONSES THAT ARE CAPABLE OF CONTROLLING AND POTENTIALLY EVEN ERADICATING MTB. WE WILL ACHIEVE THIS GOAL BY IDENTIFYING AND DISSECTING PROTECTIVE PATHWAYS IN NATURAL AND VACCINE-INDUCED IMMUNITY THROUGH INTEGRATED ANALYSES OF TISSUE-SPECIFIC AND SYSTEMIC IMMUNITY IN MICE, NON-HUMAN PRIMATES (NHP), AND HUMANS.
1.	THE GALE LABORATORY WILL CONDUCT RNA-SEQ ASSAYS FOR THE NHP IMMUNOLOGIC STUDIES. IN YEAR 6, THE GALE LABORATORY WILL PERFORM RNA-SEQ ASSAYS ON NHP SAMPLES COLLECTED FROM EXP #1, EXP #2, AND EXP #4. TASKS INCLUDE 1) RECEIVING TISSUE HOMOGENATE SAMPLES RECEIVED AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA FROM LOUIS PICKER (OHSU), 2) ISOLATING RNA FROM THESE SAMPLES AND PERFORMING RNA QC, 3) CONSTRUCTING RNA-SEQ LIBRARIES AND LIBRARY QC USING THE ISOLATED RNA, AND 4) GENERATING RNA SEQUENCE DATA FROM THE RESULTING MRNA-SEQ LIBRARIES.
2.	THE GALE LABORATORY WILL CONDUCT COMPUTATIONAL DATA ANALYSIS AND MODELING ON THE RNA-SEQ DATA SETS. IN YEAR 6, THE GALE LAB WILL ANALYZE NHP WHOLE BLOOD RNA-SEQ DATA SETS THAT WERE GENERATED AT UNIVERSITY OF WASHINGTON (GALE LAB) DURING YEAR 5. THIS ANALYSIS WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO INITIAL DATA QC, GENERATION OF NORMALIZED EXPRESSION MATRICES, DIFFERENTIAL GENE EXPRESSION ANALYSIS, FUNCTIONAL ANALYSIS, CO-EXPRESSION ANALYSIS AND WHEN APPROPRIATE RULE-BASED MODELING.

subaward_description:
OPTION SAMPLE AND DATA 6 Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ GALE

THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE IMPAC-TB PROGRAM IS TO INFORM THE RATIONAL DESIGN OF AN EFFECTIVE TB VACCINE BY IDENTIFICATION OF IMMUNE RESPONSES THAT ARE CAPABLE OF CONTROLLING AND POTENTIALLY EVEN ERADICATING MTB. WE WILL ACHIEVE THIS GOAL BY IDENTIFYING AND DISSECTING PROTECTIVE PATHWAYS IN NATURAL AND VACCINE-INDUCED IMMUNITY THROUGH INTEGRATED ANALYSES OF TISSUE-SPECIFIC AND SYSTEMIC IMMUNITY IN MICE, NON-HUMAN PRIMATES (NHP), AND HUMANS.
THE TASKS COVERED IN OUR OPTION 6 BUDGET ARE DESIGNED TO AUGMENT THE TASKS THAT WE ARE PERFORMING THROUGH OUR YEAR 6 BASE BUDGET. SPECIFICALLY:  
1.	THE GALE LABORATORY WILL CONDUCT RNA-SEQ ASSAYS FOR THE NHP IMMUNOLOGIC STUDIES. OUR YEAR 6 BASE BUDGET COVERS PERFORMING RNA-SEQ ASSAYS ON THE MAJORITY OF THE SAMPLES FROM NHP EXPERIMENTS BUT NOT ALL OF THEM. UNDER OUR OPTION 6 BUDGET, WE WILL PROCESS THE REMAINING SAMPLES FROM THESE STUDIES. TASKS INCLUDE 1) RECEIVING THESE ADDITIONAL SAMPLES AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA FROM THE PICKER LAB (OHSU), 2) ISOLATING RNA FROM THESE SAMPLES AND PERFORMING RNA QC, 3) CONSTRUCTING RNA-SEQ LIBRARIES AND PERFORMING LIBRARY QC USING THE ISOLATED RNA, AND 4) GENERATING RNA SEQUENCE DATA FROM THE RESULTING MRNA-SEQ LIBRARIES.
2.	THE GALE LABORATORY WILL CONDUCT COMPUTATIONAL DATA ANALYSIS AND MODELING ON RNA-SEQ DATA SETS. OUR YEAR 6 BASE BUDGET COVERS DATA ANALYSIS ON THE MAJORITY OF THE SAMPLES FROM NHP EXPERIMENTS BUT NOT ALL OF THEM. UNDER OUR OPTION 6 BUDGET, WE WILL PERFORM DATA ANALYSIS ON DATA GENERATED FROM THE REMAINING SAMPLES. THIS ANALYSIS WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO INITIAL DATA QC, GENERATION OF NORMALIZED EXPRESSION MATRIXES, DIFFERENTIAL GENE EXPRESSION ANALYSIS, FUNCTIONAL ANALYSIS, CO-EXPRESSION ANALYSIS AND WHEN APPROPRIATE RULE-BASED MODELING.

subaward_description:
THIS STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW) OUTLINES THE ACTIVITIES THAT FRED HUTCHINSON CANCER CENTER (FHCC EDLEFSEN) WILL BE PERFORMING. NOTE THAT THE TASK NUMBERS BELOW REFLECT THE NUMBERING OF THE OVERALL ACTIVITIES IN THE PRIME CONTRACT.

ALTHOUGH THIS SOW DETAILS THE COMPLETE SUITE OF PROPOSED WORK, THE TASKS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS CONTRACT ITERATION ARE LIMITED TO THE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES OUTLINED BELOW, DELIVERABLES FOR THIS CONTRACT PERIOD ARE HIGHLIGHTED. 

YEAR 6 (BASE) Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ EDLEFSEN 

IN YEAR 6, THE EDLEFSEN GROUP AT FRED HUTCHINSON CANCER CENTER (FRED HUTCH) WILL PROVIDE DATA QUALITY ASSURANCE PROCESSES AND ENSURE THE TIMELINESS AND ACCURACY OF STATISTICAL ANALYSES AND THE EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION OF RESULTS. FRED HUTCH WILL DEVELOP REPRODUCIBLE RESEARCH ANALYSIS SOFTWARE AND NOVEL ANALYTICAL METHODS. IN ADDITION, FRED HUTCH WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE DESIGN AND PROPER STATISTICAL CONDUCT OF ALL AIMS, AND ASSOCIATED DATA. DR. EDLEFSEN WILL COLLABORATE WITH AN INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR BASED IN GDANSK, POLAND, TO PROVIDE BIOINFORMATICS EXPERTISE ON THE PROJECT. FRED HUTCH IS CONDUCTING THESE ACTIVITIES ON AN ONGOING BASIS AND CONDUCTING ACTIVITIES MEETING THESE DESCRIPTIONS IN ALL YEARS OF THE CONTRACT.

subaward_description:
TITLE: IMMUNE MECHANISMS OF PROTECTION AGAINST MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS CENTER (IMPAC-TB)

DESCRIPTION:
AS PART OF THE HARVARD IMMUNE MECHANISMS OF PROTECTION AGAINST MYCOBACTERIUM
TUBERCULOSIS (IMPACTB) CENTER, THE LABORATORY OF GALIT ALTER WILL LEAD AND PERFORM WORK UNDER THE PROGRAM'S CROSS-CUTTING PROFILING TECHNOLOGY: SYSTEMS SEROLOGY.

SPECIFICALLY, SUBRECIPIENT WILL:
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ PERFORM SYSTEMS SEROLOGY PROFILING ON CLINICAL COHORTS AND ANIMAL STUDIES FROM
THE IMPACTB PROGRAM, TO PROBE THE POTENTIAL BIOLOGICAL ROLE OF ANTIBODIES IN DRIVING ANTI-MICROBIAL CONTROL, AS WELL AS GENERATE AND ENGINEER NOVEL MONOCLONAL ANTIBODIES TO FURTHER DISSECT THE MECHANISTIC ROLE OF ANTIBODIES IN BACTERICIDAL ACTIVITY.

AS PART OF THE HARVARD IMMUNE MECHANISMS OF PROTECTION AGAINST MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS (IMPACTB) CENTER, THE LABORATORY OF GALIT ALTER WILL LEAD AND PERFORM WORK UNDER THE PROGRAM'S CROSS-CUTTING PROFILING TECHNOLOGY: SYSTEMS SEROLOGY.

subaward_description:
THIS STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW) OUTLINES THE ACTIVITIES THAT COLORADO STATE UNIVERSITY (CSU) WILL BE PERFORMING THROUGHOUT THE PROPOSED WORK PERIOD. NOTE THAT THE TASK NUMBERS BELOW REFLECT THE NUMBERING OF THE OVERALL ACTIVITIES IN THE PRIME CONTRACT.

THROUGH THE EXECUTION OF THIS CONTRACT, WE WILL EXAMINE BASIC INDUCTION OF INNATE AND ADAPTIVE IMMUNITY FROM VACCINATION, INCLUDING STUDIES THAT ADDRESS NONTUBERCULOUS MYCOBACTERIA (NTM) INTERFERENCE, RNA VACCINE DELIVERY, PRIME-BOOST REGIMENS (INCLUDING BCG PRE-EXPOSURE), TRANSCRIPTOMIC HOST SIGNATURES,  SYSTEMS BIOLOGY AND DURABLE IMMUNE MEMORY FOR THE FURTHER ADVANCEMENT OF THE EFFORT TO DESIGN AND EVALUATE AN EFFICACIOUS VACCINE AGAINST MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS (M.TB). 

THE WORK UNDER THIS CONTRACT MAY INCLUDE THE POSSIBLE DISTRIBUTION OF DE-IDENTIFIED HUMAN SUBJECT PERIPHERAL BLOOD MONONUCLEAR CELLS (PBMC), SERUM, AND OTHER CLINICAL SAMPLES TO SCRI AND THE PHOENIX PARTNERS. NHP-DERIVED SAMPLES AND/OR DOWNSTREAM DATA MAY BE SHARED WITH THE PARTNERS ON THIS

subaward_description:
THIS STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW) OUTLINES THE ACTIVITIES THAT COLORADO STATE UNIVERSITY (CSU) WILL BE PERFORMING THROUGHOUT THE PROPOSED WORK PERIOD. THE TASK NUMBERS BELOW REFLECT THE NUMBERING OF ACTIVITIES IN THE M72-SPECIFIC PACKAGE OF THE PRIME CONTRACT.

THROUGH THE EXECUTION OF THIS CONTRACT, WE WILL EXAMINE BASIC INDUCTION OF INNATE AND ADAPTIVE IMMUNITY FROM VACCINATION, INCLUDING STUDIES THAT ADDRESS BCG PRIME AND BOOSTS WITH M72 COMBINED WITH 3 DIFFERENT ADJUVANT SYSTEMS. IMMUNOGENICITY, AND POST-INFECTION ANALYSIS WITH MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS (M.TB) ERDMAN WILL BE EVALUATED IN AN EFFORT TO DESIGN AND EVALUATE AN EFFICACIOUS VACCINE AGAINST MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS (M.TB).

THE WORK UNDER THIS CONTRACT MAY INCLUDE THE POSSIBLE DISTRIBUTION OF DE-IDENTIFIED HUMAN SUBJECT PERIPHERAL BLOOD MONONUCLEAR CELLS (PBMC) AND OTHER CLINICAL SAMPLES TO SCRI AND THE PHOENIX PARTNERS. 

OPTION 2.M72 ACTIVITIES
TASK 2.M72. EVALUATE IMMUNOGENICITY AND POD EFFICACY OF M72 COMBINED WITH DIFFERENT ADJUVANT FORMULATI

subaward_description:
THIS STATEMENT OF WORK (SOW) OUTLINES THE ACTIVITIES THAT FRED HUTCHINSON CANCER CENTER (FHCC) WILL BE PERFORMING. NOTE THAT THE TASK NUMBERS BELOW REFLECT THE NUMBERING OF THE OVERALL ACTIVITIES IN THE PRIME CONTRACT.

ALTHOUGH THIS SOW DETAILS THE COMPLETE SUITE OF PROPOSED WORK, THE TASKS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS CONTRACT ITERATION ARE LIMITED TO THE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES OUTLINED BELOW, DELIVERABLES FOR THIS CONTRACT PERIOD ARE HIGHLIGHTED. 

THROUGH THE EXECUTION OF THIS CONTRACT, WE WILL EXAMINE BASIC INDUCTION OF INNATE AND ADAPTIVE IMMUNITY FROM VACCINATION, INCLUDING STUDIES THAT ADDRESS NONTUBERCULOUS MYCOBACTERIA (NTM) INTERFERENCE, RNA VACCINE DELIVERY, PRIME-BOOST REGIMENS (INCLUDING BCG PRE-EXPOSURE), TRANSCRIPTOMIC HOST SIGNATURES, SYSTEMS BIOLOGY AND DURABLE IMMUNE MEMORY FOR THE FURTHER ADVANCEMENT OF THE EFFORT TO DESIGN AND EVALUATE AN EFFICACIOUS VACCINE AGAINST MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS (M.TB)

THE WORK UNDER THIS CONTRACT MAY INCLUDE THE POSSIBLE DISTRIBUTION OF DE-IDENTIFIED HUMAN SUBJECT PERIPHERAL BLOOD MONONUCLEAR CELLS (PBMC), SERUM, AND OTHER CLINICAL SAMPLES TO SCRI AND THE PHOENIX PARTNERS. NHP SAMPLES AND/OR DOWNSTREAM DATA MAY BE SHARED WITH THE PARTNERS ON THIS CONTRACT. 

OPTION 3 ACTIVITIES: EVALUATE OPTIMIZED M.TB VACCINE CANDIDATES FOR SAFETY, IMMUNOGENICITY AND EFFICACY IN THE NHP MODEL OF TB

TASK 3.5 TRANSCRIPTOMIC ANALYSIS OF NHP SAMPLES. 
FHCC WILL EXECUTE GENE EXPRESSION PROFILING WITH RNASEQ/NANOSTRING ASSAYS ON NHP SAMPLES GENERATED IN OPTION 3 AT UKHSA. TRANSCRIPTOMIC ANALYSIS WILL BE FOCUSED ON IDENTIFYING A PERIPHERAL BLOOD SURROGATE ENDPOINT FOR THE M.TB ERDMAN ULDA CHALLENGE OUTCOMES. THE INITIAL UNBIASED RNA SEQUENCING APPROACH WILL USE WHOLE-BLOOD SAMPLES FROM PRE- AND POST-CHALLENGE TIME POINTS. SPECIFICALLY, WE WILL LOOK FOR TRANSCRIPTS THAT ARE CORRELATED WITH M.TB COLONY FORMING UNITS (CFU) AND M.TB QPCR ASSAYS FROM BRONCHOALVEOLAR LAVAGE (BAL), THE PRIMARY CHALLENGE OUTCOMES. IN ADDITION TO ABSOLUTE ABUNDANCE AT POST-CHALLENGE TIME POINTS, WE WILL ALSO LOOK FOR CHANGES IN TRANSCRIPT ABUNDANCE RELATIVE TO THE DAY OF CHALLENGE AS A POTENTIAL CORRELATE OF CHALLENGE OUTCOME. AS WE BUILD A MODEL TO PREDICT CHALLENGE OUTCOME FROM THESE GENE EXPRESSION MEASURES WE WILL SPECIFICALLY CONSIDER TRANSCRIPTS THAT HAVE PREVIOUSLY BEEN IDENTIFIED AS PREDICTORS OF PROGRESSION TO TB DISEASE, SUCH AS TYPE I IFN-RELATED GENES WHOSE EXPRESSION INCREASES DURING DISEASE PROGRESSION. THE HUMAN EXPRESSION SIGNATURES WILL BE EVALUATED IN NHPS AND VICE VERSA; ADDITIONALLY, A JOINT MODEL WILL BE DEVELOPED, ALLOWING FOR DIFFERENCES IN NHP AND HUMAN ASSOCIATIONS, WHILE IDENTIFYING A COMMON GENE SIGNATURE. ONCE TRANSCRIPTS OR GENES HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED, A TARGETED CROSS-SPECIES NANOSTRING PANEL WILL BE DEVELOPED FOR EVALUATION IN THE SMALL ANIMAL MODELS AS WELL AS IN FUTURE NHP AND CLINICAL TRIALS. WE PLAN TO DEVELOP A NANOSTRING NCOUNTER GENE PANEL WHICH CAN ACCOMMODATE UP TO 800 GENES AND WOULD BE SIGNIFICANTLY MORE COST EFFECTIVE THAN RNA SEQUENCING. ALTERNATIVELY, DEPENDING ON THE COMPLEXITY OF THE GENE PANEL, IT COULD BE DEVELOPED AS A 96 TRANSCRIPT/GENE (INCLUDING HOUSEKEEPING GENES) QPCR BIOMARK FLUIDIGM ASSAY. 
TASK 3.7 COMPARE IMMUNE PROFILES IN NHP, SMALL ANIMAL MODELS AND HUMANS TO IDENTIFY CORRELATES OF PROTECTION. 
SUBTASK 3.7.4 INTEGRATED ANALYSIS AND DYNAMICAL SYSTEMS MODELING OF EXPERIMENTAL IMMUNOLOGY DATA ACROSS ALL SPECIES
EXPERIMENTAL DATA WILL BE TRANSFERRED TO THE STATISTICAL CENTER AND A FORMAL INTER-SITE AND INTER-SPECIES VARIABILITY ASSESSMENT WILL BE PERFORMED. VARIABILITY WILL BE DETERMINED USING COEFFICIENTS OF VARIATION (CV), MEAN AND STANDARD DEVIATION OF RESPONSES. DESIRED CUT-OFFS FOR ACCEPTABLE CVS WILL BE PRE-SPECIFIED FOR EACH ASSAY. EFFORT IN THE BASE PERIOD WILL HAVE BEEN MADE TO STANDARDIZE THE ASSAYS AND HARMONIZATION ASSESSMENTS WILL HAVE BEEN REPEATED IF CVS DID NOT MEET THE CUT OFF.  
IMMUNOGENICITY AND SYSTEMS BIOLOGY: INNATE AND ADAPTIVE IMMUNITY, INCLUDING EX-V

subaward_description:
THE UNIVERSITY OF KANSAS (KU), UNDER THE DIRECTION OF SCOTT LOVELL, PH.D., WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING WORK (OPTION QUANTITY 2) TO ADDITIONALLY SUPPORT THE BASIC PROJECT REQUIREMENT OF THE SSGCID CONTRACT (CONTRACT NR 75N93022C00036) FROM SEPT 1, 2024 THROUGH AUG 31, 2025. KU WILL PARTICIPATE IN ONE OPTION QUANTITY EFFORT (OQ 2) TO CONDUCT STUDIES FOCUSED ON SOLVING THE STRUCTURE OF MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS PROTEINS IMPORTANT FOR DRUG DISCOVERY. SOME OF THIS WORK WILL BE PERFORMED IN COLLABORATION WITH THE STRUCTURE-GUIDED DRUG DISCOVERY COALITION.

A.	OPTION QUANTITY EFFORTS 

KU WILL USE OPTION QUANTITY RESOURCES (OQ 2) TO WORK ON A PROJECT FOCUSED ON SOLVING THE STRUCTURE OF MYCOBACTERIUM TUBERCULOSIS TARGETS. THE FOCUS OF THIS WORK IS TO PERFORM RESCUE EFFORTS ON TARGETS THAT ARE IMPORTANT THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW DRUGS AGAINST M. TUBERCULOSIS. KU STAFF WILL SUGGEST TRUNCATIONS AND OTHER STRATEGIES FOR RESCUE EFFORTS, PERFORM CRYSTALLIZATION TRAILS, AND SOLVE STRUCTURES FOR THIS PROJECT.

subaward_description:
THE UNIVERSITY OF KANSAS (KU), UNDER THE DIRECTION OF SCOTT LOVELL, PH.D., WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING WORK (OPTION QUANTITY 6) TO ADDITIONALLY SUPPORT THE BASIC PROJECT REQUIREMENT (9/1/2024-8/31/2025) OF THE SSGCID CONTRACT (CONTRACT NR 75N93022C00036). KU WILL LEAD ONE OPTION QUANTITY EFFORT (OQ 6) TO CONDUCT STUDIES ON TICK BORNE DISEASES.

A.	OPTION QUANTITY EFFORTS 

KU WILL USE OPTION QUANTITY RESOURCES (OQ 6) TO WORK ON A PROJECT FOCUSED ON LOLA FROM ORGANISMS THAT CAUSE TICK-BORNE DISEASES SUCH AS F. TULARENSIS AND E. RUMINANTIUM. THE FOCUS OF THIS WORK IS TO ANALYZE COMPOUNDS TARGETING THE LOLA PROTEIN USING SURFACE PLASMON RESONANCE AND TO ULTIMATELY OBTAIN A STRUCTURE(S) WITH LIGAND(S) BOUND.

subaward_description:
THE UNIVERSITY OF KANSAS (KU), UNDER THE DIRECTION OF SCOTT LOVELL, PH.D., WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING WORK TO SUPPORT THE BASIC PROJECT REQUIREMENT (9/1/2024-8/31/2025). KU WILL ACCEPT PROTEIN AND OTHER SAMPLES PRIMARILY GENERATED BY OTHER SSGCID SITES AND PREPARE THEM FOR X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY STRUCTURE DETERMINATION STUDIES, CONDUCT CRYSTALLIZATION EXPERIMENTS, COLLECT DIFFRACTION DATA, AND PERFORM STRUCTURE SOLUTION. KU WILL ALSO SUPPORT VARIOUS SPECIAL PROJECT STUDIES AS NEEDED AND LEAD ONE FUNCTIONAL STUDY.  
 
A.	STRUCTURE DETERMINATION OF PROTEINS OR PROTEIN COMPLEXES BY X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY:  
 
KU WILL ACCEPT PROTEIN SAMPLES PRIMARILY RECEIVED FROM THE OTHER TEAM SITES FOR X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY STRUCTURE DETERMINATION STUDIES AND CONDUCT HIGH THROUGHPUT CRYSTALLIZATION EXPERIMENTS, INCLUDING CRYSTALLIZATION TRIALS, OPTIMIZATION, DATA COLLECTION AND INTERPRETATION. WHEN NECESSARY, KU WILL CONDUCT CO-CRYSTALLIZATION SCREENS OF THE TARGET IN COMPLEX WITH SMALL MOLECULES AND LIGANDS. KU WILL IDENTIFY AND HARVEST CRYSTALS THAT ARE SUITABLE FOR DIFFRACTION SCREENING AND CONDUCT LARGE SCALE CRYSTAL DIFFRACTION SCREENS, COLLECT DIFFRACTION DATA AND MONITOR QUALITY METRICS OF THE SUITABLE CRYSTALS. WHERE APPROPRIATE, KU WILL ALSO LIAISE WITH KUMCÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S CRYOEM CENTER TO HELP SOLVE STRUCTURES BY CRYOEM.
 
KU WILL PERFORM STRUCTURE SOLUTION, MODEL REFINEMENT AND VALIDATION FOR X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY. A STRUCTURE DETERMINATION PROJECT WILL BE CONSIDERED COMPLETE WHEN THE REFINEMENT AND VALIDATION OF THE FINAL STRUCTURE MODELS DO NOT PROVIDE ANY CLEAR SIGNAL OF WHERE THE MODEL CAN BE IMPROVED OR WHEN 3D STRUCTURE QUALITY PARAMETERS SATISFY THE MINIMUM QUALITY REQUIREMENTS ESTABLISHED AND AGREED UPON IN COORDINATION WITH THE CENTER FOR STRUCTURAL BIOLOGY OF INFECTIOUS DISEASES. 
 
KU WILL SUPPORT HIGH VALUE TARGETS (HVTS), COMMUNITY REQUEST PROJECTS (CRP), HIGHEST IMPACT PROJECTS (HIP) AND OTHER SPECIAL STUDIES WITHIN THE SSGCID PIPELINE, AS DECIDED BY THE SSGCID SCIENTIFIC LEADERSHIP TEAM (SLT). 

B.	FUNCTIONAL STUDIES

KU WILL LEAD ONE FUNCTION STUDY, ENTITLED Ã¢Â‚¬Å“STRUCTURE AND FUNCTIONAL STUDIES OF RSBU FROM CHLAMYDIA,Ã¢Â‚¬Ï¿½ WITH THE GOAL TO PERFORM STRUCTURAL AND FUNCTIONAL ANALYSIS OF THE RSBU PROTEIN FROM C. TRACHOMATIS.

 
C.	QUALITY CONTROL, DATA COLLECTION AND REPORTING: 
 
KU WILL ESTABLISH AND CONDUCT QUALITY CONTROL PROCEDURES AS NECESSARY TO ENSURE THE PRODUCTION OF HIGH-QUALITY DATA. KU WILL ENSURE THAT THE STATUS OF ALL WORK PERFORMED FOR SSGCID IS UPDATED IN A TIMELY FASHION, THROUGH THE CENTRAL TARGET TRACKING DATABASE (CTTDB), TRACKING SPREADSHEETS AND/OR ANY OTHER TRACKING SYSTEM REQUIRED BY THE PROJECT. KEY STAFF MEMBERS FROM KU WILL PARTICIPATE IN SSGCID PROJECT MEETINGS AND NIAID-REQUIRED MEETINGS TO ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF THE PROJECT. KU STAFF WILL CONTRIBUTE TO QUARTERLY AND SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS AND ANY OTHER NIAID REQUIRED REPORTS AS NEEDED AND IN A TIMELY FASHION AND WILL CONDUCT THE PROJECT WORK WITH THE AIM OF PRODUCING IMPACTFUL PUBLICATIONS. 

 IT IS EXPECTED THAT SIXTY STRUCTURES WILL BE SOLVED THROUGH THIS WORK.

subawardee_business_types: U.S. STATE GOVERNMENT,1890 LAND GRANT COLLEGE,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING,VETERINARY COLLEGE
subaward_description:
THE WASHINGTON STATE UNIVERSITY GROUP (WSU), UNDER THE DIRECTION OF GARRY BUCHKO, PH.D., WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING WORK TO SUPPORT THE BASIC PROJECT REQUIREMENTS.  WSU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SOLVING AT LEAST ONE NMR STRUCTURE DURING THIS YEAR OF THE CONTRACT (SEPT 1, 2024 THROUGH AUG 31, 2025), WHICH MAY SUPPORT VARIOUS SPECIAL PROJECT STUDIES USING NMR-BASED METHODS (E.G.: DYNAMIC STUDIES, CHEMICAL SHIFT PERTURBATION, ENZYME KINETICS, SOLID-STATE NMR, STD-NMR). WSU MAY ALSO SUPPORT VARIOUS SPECIAL PROJECT STUDIES AS NEEDED, USING NMR-BASED METHODS (E.G.: DYNAMIC STUDIES, CHEMICAL SHIFT PERTURBATION, ENZYME KINETICS, SOLID-STATE NMR, STD-NMR) FOR PROJECTS OF SPECIAL INTEREST TO THE CENTER OR THROUGH COMMUNITY REQUESTS.

A.	STRUCTURE DETERMINATION BY NMR: 

WSU (DR. BUCHKO) WILL DETERMINE THE SOLUTION STRUCTURE OF AT LEAST ONE PROTEIN USING NUCLEAR MAGNETIC RESONANCE (NMR)-BASED METHODS. THESE TARGETS WILL ORIGINATE FROM NIAID CATEGORY A-C INFECTIOUS DISEASE ORGANISMS, AS WELL AS EMERGING AND RE-EMERGING DISEASE, AND ONCE APPROVED BY NIAID WILL ENTER INTO THE SSGCID PIPELINE FOR TRACKING THE WSU/PNNL-NMR WORK. THE NMR SPECTROSCOPY WILL BE MAINLY DEDICATED TO PROTEINS SMALLER THAN ~25-30 KDA THAT FAIL TO PRODUCE DIFFRACTION QUALITY CRYSTALS. THE CANDIDATE TARGETS WILL PRIMARILY BE IDENTIFIED BY THE SEATTLE CHILDRENÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S RESEARCH TARGET SELECTION GROUP, HOWEVER, DR. BUCHKO WILL ALSO IDENTIFY RELEVANT COLLABORATORS WHO ARE WILLING TO NOMINATE TARGETS TO THE NMR PIPELINE AND COLLABORATE TO PUBLISH ANY RESULTS PRODUCED BY SSGCID. WSU MAY BE ASKED TO LEAD AND SUPPORT SEVERAL HIGH VALUE TARGETS (HVT), COMMUNITY REQUEST PROJECTS (CRP), HIGHEST IMPACT PROJECTS (HIP) AND OTHER SPECIAL STUDIES WITHIN THE SSGCID PIPELINE, AS DECIDED BY THE SSGCID SCIENTIFIC LEADERSHIP TEAM.

CANDIDATES SUITABLE FOR FURTHER EXAMINATION WILL BE IDENTIFIED FROM 1H-15N HSQC SPECTRA COLLECTED ON 15N-LABELED PROTEIN PREPARED BY WSU. STANDARD TRIPLE RESONANCE EXPERIMENTS WILL BE PERFORMED TO ASSIGN THE BACKBONE AND SIDE CHAIN 1H, 13C, AND 15N RESONANCES OF THE PROTEIN. ONCE THE RESONANCE ASSIGNMENTS ARE COMPLETE, NOE DATA CRUCIAL FOR OBTAINING DISTANCE RESTRAINTS WILL BE COLLECTED. NOE ASSIGNMENTS AND STRUCTURE CALCULATIONS WILL BE PERFORMED ITERATIVELY USING COMBINED AUTOMATED AND MANUAL METHODS. THE QUALITY OF THE FINAL SET OF STRUCTURES WILL BE ASSESSED AND ONCE THE FINAL ENSEMBLE OF STRUCTURES IS FOUND TO BE SATISFACTORY, THE COORDINATES OF THE ENSEMBLE WILL BE DEPOSITED IN THE PROTEIN DATA BANK (PDB; HTTP://WWW.PDB.ORG) AND IMMEDIATELY RELEASED TO THE WORLD. AT THE SAME TIME, ALL 1H, 13C, AND 15N CHEMICAL SHIFT DATA WILL BE DEPOSITED WITH THE BIOMAGNETIC RESEARCH BANK (BMRB; HTTP://WWW.BMRB.WISC.EDU/). MANUSCRIPTS THAT INCLUDE A DESCRIPTION OF THESE STRUCTURES WILL BE PUBLISHED IN AS TIMELY A FASHION AS IS POSSIBLE.


B.	QUALITY CONTROL, DATA COLLECTION, AND REPORTING:

WSU WILL ESTABLISH AND CONDUCT QUALITY CONTROL PROCEDURES AS NECESSARY TO ENSURE THE PRODUCTION OF HIGH-QUALITY DATA. WSU WILL ENSURE THAT THE STATUS OF ALL WORK PERFORMED FOR SSGCID IS UPDATED IN A TIMELY FASHION, THROUGH THE CENTRAL TARGET TRACKING DATABASE (CTTDB), TRACKING SPREADSHEETS, AND/OR ANY OTHER TRACKING SYSTEM REQUIRED BY THE PROJECT. DR. BUCHKO WILL PARTICIPATE IN SSGCID PROJECT MEETINGS AND NIAID-REQUESTED MEETINGS AS REQUIRED TO ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF THE PROJECT. DR. BUCHKO WILL CONTRIBUTE TO QUARTERLY AND SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS AND ANY OTHER NIAID REQUIRED REPORTS AS NEEDED AND IN A TIMELY FASHION. THE MAJOR AIM OF THE PROJECT WORK WILL BE IMPACTFUL PUBLICATIONS.

DARTMOUTH COLLEGE, UNDER THE DIRECTION OF OLUWATOYIN ASOJO, PH.D., WILL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING WORK TO SUPPORT THE BASIC PROJECT REQUIREMENT (9/1/2024-8/31/2025). 
 
A.	STRUCTURE DETERMINATION OF PROTEINS OR PROTEIN COMPLEXES BY X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY:  
 
 DARTMOUTH WILL TRAIN UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS IN THE USE OF STRUCTURAL BIOLOGY TO CHARACTERIZE THE FUNCTION OF SELECTED TARGETS. THE STUDENTS WILL WRITE MANUSCRIPTS DESCRIBING THE STRUCTURE AND (PREDICTED) FUNCTION OF SELECTED PROTEINS. IF POSSIBLE, ONE OR TWO STUDENTS WILL PARTICIPATE IN RESEARCH PROJECTS FOCUSED ON CHARACTERIZING THE FUNCTION OF TARGET(S) USING A VARIETY OF LABORATORY METHODS. 
 
 DARTMOUTH WILL SUPPORT HIGH VALUE TARGETS (HVTS), COMMUNITY REQUEST PROJECTS (CRP), HIGHEST IMPACT PROJECTS (HIP) AND OTHER SPECIAL STUDIES WITHIN THE SSGCID PIPELINE, AS DECIDED BY THE SSGCID SCIENTIFIC LEADERSHIP TEAM (SLT).
 
B.	QUALITY CONTROL, DATA COLLECTION AND REPORTING: 
 
 DARTMOUTH WILL ESTABLISH AND CONDUCT QUALITY CONTROL PROCEDURES AS NECESSARY TO ENSURE THE PRODUCTION OF HIGH-QUALITY DATA. DARTMOUTH WILL ENSURE THAT THE STATUS OF ALL WORK PERFORMED FOR SSGCID IS UPDATED IN A TIMELY FASHION, THROUGH THE CENTRAL TARGET TRACKING DATABASE (CTTDB), TRACKING SPREADSHEETS AND/OR ANY OTHER TRACKING SYSTEM REQUIRED BY THE PROJECT. KEY STAFF MEMBERS FROM DARTMOUTH WILL PARTICIPATE IN SSGCID PROJECT MEETINGS AND NIAID-REQUIRED MEETINGS TO ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF THE PROJECT. DARTMOUTH STAFF WILL CONTRIBUTE TO QUARTERLY AND SEMI-ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS AND ANY OTHER NIAID REQUIRED REPORTS AS NEEDED AND IN A TIMELY FASHION AND WILL CONDUCT THE PROJECT WORK WITH THE AIM OF PRODUCING IMPACTFUL PUBLICATIONS.

subawardee_business_types: SELF-CERTIFIED SMALL DISADVANTAGED BUSINESS,FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION,MANUFACTURER OF GOODS
subaward_description:
MERIDIAN LIFE SCIENCE (Ã¢Â‚¬Å“MERIDIANÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½) WILL PROVIDE CONTRACT TESTING SERVICES FOR LOT RELEASE AND STABILITY TESTING OF CGMP BIOLOGICAL SAMPLES DERIVED FROM NEWCASTLE DISEASE VIRUS (NDV). THE SCOPE INCLUDES IN-HOUSE EGG INFECTIOUS DOSE (EID50) TESTING FOR CLARIFIED ALLANTOIC FLUID (CLARIFIED HARVEST) AND VACCINE DRUG PRODUCT (DP), AS WELL AS MANAGEMENT OF OUTSOURCED TESTING SPECIFIED BY MOUNT SINAI, SUCH AS PH, BIOBURDEN, AND STERILITY TESTING. EACH LOT OF MATERIAL SUBMITTED WILL FOLLOW A TESTING PLAN WITH THIRTEEN MILESTONES. SHORT-TERM STABILITY OF THE DP WILL BE EVALUATED OVER 24 HOURS AT 2Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ8Ã‚Â°C THROUGH SIX TIMEPOINTS, WHILE LONG-TERM STABILITY OF CLARIFIED HARVEST AND DP WILL BE ASSESSED OVER THREE YEARS AT Ã¢Â€°Â¤-65OC WITH ANNUAL TESTS FOR INFECTIOUS TITER, PH, AND BIOBURDEN (CLARIFIED HARVEST) AND EIGHT TIMEPOINTS FOR INFECTIOUS TITER ALONGSIDE ANNUAL PH AND STERILITY TESTING (DP).

MERIDIANÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S TESTING SERVICES WILL ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS, DELIVERING HIGH-QUALITY DATA TO SUPPORT LOT RELEASE AND STABILITY MONITORING. THESE ANALYSES PLAY A CRITICAL ROLE IN MAINTAINING THE QUALITY AND EFFICACY OF NDV-DERIVED PRODUCTS, PROVIDING DETAILED INSIGHTS INTO PRODUCT STABILITY WHEN STORED REFRIGERATED OR FROZEN.

prime_award_program_activities_funding_t: 0006: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES (0885)
prime_award_base_transaction_description: DEVELOPMENT OF UM-1098: A NOVEL SYNTHETIC TH17 INDUCING ADJUVANT AND DELIVERY SYSTEM
prime_award_naics_description: COMPUTER SYSTEMS DESIGN SERVICES
subaward_description:
THE VACCINE RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT TEAMS AT UNIVERSITY OF MONTANA (PI-EVANS), INIMMUNE (PI-BURKHART & MILLER), AND MOUNT SINAI (PI-KRAMMER) HAVE AN ESTABLISHED COLLABORATION FOR DEVELOPING LATE-STAGE ADJUVANTS AND FORMULATIONS WITH SUBUNIT ANTIGENS FROM INFLUENZA VIRUS (HA AND NA). THESE STUDIES HAVE DEMONSTRATED REMARKABLE PROTECTION AGAINST CHALLENGE WITH BOTH HOMOLOGOUS AND HETEROSUBTYPIC VIRUSES FOLLOWING IM OR IN VACCINATION WITH LEAD CANDIDATE VACCINES ADVANCING TO IND WITH CIVICS. WE PROPOSE TO EXPAND THIS WORK PERFORMED UNDER CIVICS AND ADJUVANT DEVELOPMENT CONTRACTS TO DEVELOP AND ADVANCE A DURABLE CROSS-PROTECTIVE ADJUVANTED H5N1 AND H5N2 SUBUNIT VACCINES. 
 
H5 AND N1 ANTIGENS FROM RECENT RELEVANT STRAINS AND CHALLENGE MODELS ARE ALREADY DEVELOPED AND AVAILABLE AT MOUNT SINAI. ADVANCED (CGMP PRODUCED) THERMOSTABLE ADJUVANTS AND FORMULATIONS ARE AVAILABLE FROM UM AND INIMMUNE. WE PROPOSE TO EVALUATE TRAC-478 (IM), SAS (IM), AND MUCOADHESIVE, TRAC-478, SAS, INI-2004 AND INI-4001 LIPOSOMES (INTRANASAL) FOR IMMUNOGENICITY WITH H5, N1/2 AND A COMBINATION H5+N1/2 ANTIGENS. COMPREHENSIVE EVALUATION OF VACCINE SAFETY AND IMMUNOGENICITY WILL BE CONDUCTED IN MICE, INCLUDING THE EVALUATION OF HUMORAL AND CELL MEDIATED IMMUNITY AS WELL AS VACCINE DURABILITY, DOSE SPARING, AND HETEROSUBTYPIC IMMUNITY ACROSS A RANGE OF H5N1 VARIANTS. LEAD CANDIDATE VACCINES WILL BE EVALUATED FOR PROTECTION USING AN ESTABLISHED H5N1 CHALLENGE MODEL IN MICE. THE PROJECT WILL SELECT A SINGLE LEAD VACCINE CANDIDATE FOR TRANSITION TO HUMAN CLINICAL EVALUATION. PROCESS DEVELOPMENT, SCALE-UP, CGMP MANUFACTURING AND GLP TOXICOLOGY TESTING OF THE LEAD VACCINE CANDIDATE IS INCLUDED IN OPTIONAL BUDGET PERIODS (YEARS 2 AND 3). THE FUNDING WOULD PROVIDE A PHASE I READY VACCINE WITH STRONG IND ENABLING PRECLINICAL POC AND SAFETY DATA. A NOVEL VACCINE INDUCING DURABLE HETEROSUBTYPIC IMMUNITY ACROSS A BROAD RANGE OF H5N1 VARIANTS IS CRITICAL FOR PANDEMIC PREPAREDNESS AS STOCKPILE OF THIS VACCINE WILL REMAIN EFFECTIVE ACROSS MANY YEARS OF ANTIGENIC DRIFT.

prime_award_program_activities_funding_t: 0006: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES (0885)
prime_award_base_transaction_description: VACCINE ADJUVANT DISCOVERY PROGRAM
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN BIOTECHNOLOGY (EXCEPT NANOBIOTECHNOLOGY)
subaward_description:
THE ADJUVANT DISCOVERY CONTRACT WILL IDENTIFY, CHARACTERIZE, AND ADVANCE NOVEL SYNTHETIC CLR-BASED ADJUVANTS FOR USE IN COMBINATION WITH BACTERIAL AND FUNGAL ANTIGENS TO INDUCE A SAFE AND DURABLE TH17 AND/OR TH17/TH1 IMMUNITY. THIS PROPOSAL BRINGS TOGETHER HIGHLY EXPERIENCED RESEARCH TEAMS FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF MONTANA, INIMMUNE CORPORATION, UNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO, AND UNIVERSITY OF TEXAS AT SAN ANTONIO, EACH WITH UNIQUE EXPERTISE AND PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE IN THE DISCOVERY AND DEVELOPMENT OF INNOVATIVE VACCINES AND ADJUVANTS. DRS. EVANS AND RIEL, AND COLLEAGUES AT UM WILL LEAD THE DISCOVERY EFFORTS AND COORDINATE ACTIVITIES OF ALL SUBCONTRACTORS. THE RESEARCH TEAM AT UM WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR COMPOUNDS LIBRARY SYNTHESIS, SAR STUDIES, MECHANISM OF ACTION STUDIES, RECEPTOR IDENTIFICATION, EARLY LIFE IMMUNITY (CORD BLOOD AND NEONATAL MICE), FORMULATION, MULTIVALENT DISPLAY, SAFETY ASSESSMENTS AND IMMUNOGENICITY STUDIES. DR. RASHEED AND COLLEAGUES AT INIMMUNE CORPORATION WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THE TEAM FROM UM TO COMPLETE THE PRIMARY HTRF HIGH THROUGHPUT SCREEN OF COMPOUND LIBRARIES AND ASSIST WITH MEDICINAL CHEMISTRY SAR AND ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY WITH LEAD SCAFFOLDS. DR. KHADER AND COLLEAGUES AT UCHICAGO WILL PROVIDE M72 ANTIGEN IN SUFFICIENT QUANTITY AND QUALITY TO SUPPORT FORMULATION OPTIMIZATION AND PRE-CLINICAL IMMUNOLOGY. THE TEAM AT UCHICAGO WILL ALSO CONDUCT MURINE VACCINATION AND MTB CHALLENGE STUDIES IN C57BL/6 MICE AND EVALUATE ADJUVANT SAFETY AND MECHANISMS OF CLR-MEDIATED EFFICACY, PROTECTION, AND DURABILITY. THE TEAM AT UCHICAGO ALSO BRINGS SPECIALIZED EXPERTISE IN THE MECHANISM OF PROTECTION AND A WIDE ARRAY OF ANTIGENS AND MULTIOMICS APPROACHES FOR EVALUATING NOVEL ADJUVANTS. DR. CHIUNG-YU HUNG AND COLLEAGUES AT UTSA ARE EXPERTS IN FUNGAL DISEASE MODELS AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF VACCINES FOR INVASIVE FUNGAL DISEASE. DR. HUNG WILL PROVIDE RCPA1 ANTIGEN IN SUFFICIENT QUANTITY AND QUALITY TO SUPPORT FORMULATION OPTIMIZATION AND PRE-CLINICAL IMMUNOLOGY AND CONDUCT MURINE COCCIDIOIDES VACCINATION AND CHALLENGE STUDIES IN BOTH C57BL/6 AND HUMAN HLA-DR4 TRANSGENIC MICE.

INDEPENDENTLY, AND NOT AS AN AGENT OF THE GOVERNMENT, THE SUBCONTRACTOR (INIMMUNE) SHALL FURNISH ALL NECESSARY SERVICES, QUALIFIED PROFESSIONAL, TECHNICAL, AND ADMINISTRATIVE PERSONNEL, MATERIAL, EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES, NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED BY THE GOVERNMENT UNDER THE TERMS OF THIS CONTRACT, AS NEEDED TO PERFORM THE TASKS SET FORTH BELOW.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: LONG-ACTING ANTIVIRAL IMPLANT FOR THE TREATMENT OF HCV
prime_award_naics_description: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE PHYSICAL, ENGINEERING, AND LIFE SCIENCES (EXCEPT NANOTECHNOLOGY AND BIOTECHNOLOGY)
subawardee_name: RECTOR & VISITORS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA
subawardee_business_types: NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,STATE CONTROLLED INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING
subaward_description:
THE GOAL OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO DEVELOP A LONG-ACTING DIRECT-ACTING ANTIVIRAL (DAA) TREATMENT FOR HEPATITIS C VIRUS (HCV).
THIS WILL INVOLVE DEVELOPING A THERMOSENSITIVE HYDROGEL IMPLANT FORMULATION LOADED WITH DAAS, CHARACTERIZING LONGTERM
RELEASE AND ANTIVIRAL EFFICACY, AND EVALUATING SAFETY AND PHARMACOKINETICS. AS A PART OF THIS EFFORT, LUNA LABS WILL
SUBCONTRACT YOUNG HAHN, A PROFESSOR AT THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA, TO EVALUATE IMPLANT FORMULATION CANDIDATES IN VITRO
FOR EFFICACY AGAINST HCV. DR. HAHN WILL ALSO LEAD A PRELIMINARY IN VIVO PHARMACOKINETICS STUDY IN UNINFECTED MICE TO
DEMONSTRATE SUSTAINED BIOAVAILABILITY OF DAAS FOR ANIMALS TREATED WITH LUNA LABSÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢ IMPLANT AS COMPARED TO AN ORAL
CONTROL. FINALLY, PLANS INVOLVING FURTHER IN VITRO SCREENING AND IN VIVO HUMANIZED-LIVER MOUSE MODELS WILL BE DEVELOPED
FOR PHASE II. THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE COVERED BY THIS STATEMENT OF WORK WILL BE APPROXIMATELY 12 MONTHS IN LENGTH
FOR THE PHASE I PERIOD.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: SMART IRB GOVERNANCE, ADMINISTRATION, AND OPERATIONS SUPPORT
prime_award_naics_description: ALL OTHER PROFESSIONAL, SCIENTIFIC, AND TECHNICAL SERVICES
subaward_description:
HARVARD UNIVERSITY FUNDS EFFORT FOR SMART IRB AMBASSADORS AT SEVERAL PARTICIPATING CTSA HUBS (VIA SUBAWARDS).  THE AMBASSADOR WILL ENSURE REGIONAL COVERAGE AND WILL SERVE AS THE PRIMARY RESOURCE FOR TRAINING TO LOCALLY IMPLEMENT THE SMART IRB AGREEMENT AND SOPS AND TO ASSIST IN THE DISSEMINATION, IMPLEMENTATION AND HARMONIZATION OF THE SMART IRB MODEL ACROSS CTSA HUBS AND THEIR AFFILIATES. THIS APPROACH PROVIDES AN OPPORTUNITY FOR ALL TO PARTICIPATE IN THE ONGOING DEVELOPMENT OF SMART IRB, AND FULLY LEVERAGES EXPERTISE ACROSS THE NCATS CONSORTIUM. 
IT IS EXPECTED THAT THE AMBASSADOR WILL: 
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ UNDERGO AN IN-PERSON TRAINING BY MEMBERS OF THE SMART IRB EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TO LEARN ABOUT THE SMART IRB MODEL AND ROLE AS AMBASSADOR
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ WORK WITH THE SMART IRB REGULATORY TEAM LEADS TO PRIORITIZE ACTIVITIES AND ASSIGNMENTS
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ WORK WITH ASSIGNED CTSA HUBS AND AFFILIATES TO SIGN THEM ONTO THE SMART IRB AGREEMENT
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ EDUCATE CTSA HUBS ON THE SMART IRB MODEL (INCLUDING THE AGREEMENT, SOPS, AND WORKFLOWS) VIA GROUP WEBINARS AND INDIVIDUALIZED SESSIONS
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ PARTICIPATE IN BIWEEKLY TO MONTHLY CALLS TO PROVIDE UPDATES ON PROGRESS AND SHARE STRATEGIES TO ADDRESS ISSUES RELATED TO THE ADOPTION OF THE SMART IRB MODEL OR SINGLE IRB REVIEW
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ HELP TROUBLESHOOT ANY PROBLEMS INSTITUTIONS EXPERIENCE SIGNING ONTO AND OPERATIONALIZING THE SMART IRB AGREEMENT, WHICH COULD INCLUDE WORKING WITH THE SMART IRB EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND NCATS FOR ASSISTANCE
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF AND PROVIDE FEEDBACK REGARDING MATERIALS AND WORKFLOWS THAT SUPPORT SINGLE IRB REVIEW, TO BE SHARED WITH CTSA HUBS VIA THE SMART IRB WEBSITE AND OTHER MECHANISMS
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ ACT AS A Ã¢Â‚¬Å“HELP DESKÃ¢Â‚¬Ï¿½ FOR QUESTIONS RECEIVED VIA THE SMART IRB WEBSITE
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ PARTICIPATE IN THE DESIGN AND APPLICATION OF THE FACILITATION SERVICE AS REQUIRED
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ PROVIDE FEEDBACK TO THE SMART IRB INFORMATICS GROUP REGARDING WORKFLOWS FOR AND USER ACCEPTANCE OF IT PLATFORMS DEVELOPED TO SUPPORT JOINING THE SMART IRB MASTER AGREEMENT AND RELIANT REVIEW PROCESS 
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ ASSIST THE SMART IRB EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, AS NEEDED, IN THE UTILIZATION OF THE SMART IRB MODEL IN AT LEAST 2 MULTISITE CTSA PROGRAM CLINICAL STUDIES TO PILOT SMART IRB TOOLS
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢ PARTICIPATE IN SMART IRB EFFORTS TO HARMONIZE POLICIES, PROCESSES AND TERMS OF ART RELATED TO IRB RELIANCE

subaward_description:
BASED ON MY CURRENT WORKLOAD AS AN AMBASSADOR AND KNOWING WHAT CHANGES ARE COMING IN THE FUTURE FOR SMART IRB, I AM PREDICTING THAT I WILL BE INVOLVED IN THE FOLLOWING FOR THE NEXT 3 YEARS: 
- PRESENTING AT THE MAY 2023 AAHRPP CONFERENCE 
- TENTATIVE PRESENTING AT THE DECEMBER 2023 PRIMR CONFERENCE 
- IN 2024 THERE WILL BE A NEW SMART IRB AGREEMENT, VERSION 3, THAT WE ARE PREDICTING WILL REQUIRE A LOT OF WORK TO GET INSTITUTIONS TO SIGN ON TO THIS ONE. AMBASSADORS WILL BE DOING A LOT TO ASSIST INSTITUTIONS IN SIGNING THIS VERSION. VERSIONS 1 AND 2 WILL NOT BE COMPATIBLE WITH VERSION 3. WORK IS STILL BEING DONE ON THIS AGREEMENT AND WILL PROBABLY NOT BE AVAILABLE PUBLICLY UNTIL THE END OF 2023. 
- SMART TALKS Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ AMBASSADORS ARE REQUESTED TO PRESENT AT SMART TALKS ABOUT 2/YEAR. WE ATTEND ALL OTHER ONES AND ASSIST IN THE Q&AS. THE TOTAL NUMBER OF SMART TALKS ARE 9/YEAR. 
- SMART IRB BOOTCAMP Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ THE LAST 2 YEARS WE HAVE HELD A BEGINNER BOOTCAMP ON RELIANCE AND SMART IRB RESOURCES. THIS BOOTCAMP IS HELD ONCE A YEAR OVER THE COURSE OF 2 DAYS. AMBASSADORS PRESENT ON DIFFERENT TOPICS IN THIS BOOTCAMP. 
O THIS EFFORT WILL CONTINUE FOR THE NEXT 3 YEARS. 
O IN ADDITION, IN 2024 WE ARE AIMING TO HOLD AN ADVANCED BOOTCAMP. 
- CURRENTLY CO-LEADING THE SMART IRB HARMONIZATION GROUP ON LOCAL CONTEXT Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ
MAY TAKE AN ADDITIONAL ~ 30 HOURS FOR THE REST OF 2023. I WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
O PUTTING THIS OUT FOR PUBLIC COMMENT
O MAKING REVISIONS TO THE HARMONIZATION RECOMMENDATIONS AS REQUESTED BY SMART IRB TEAM AND THE PUBLIC COMMENT O ONCE IT IS FINAL AND READY FOR PUBLISHING, WE WILL HAVE A SMART TALK ON THIS SPECIFICALLY AND DISCUSS THE FINDINGS OF THE GROUP 
- OTHER SMART IRB HARMONIZATION GROUPS THAT AMBASSADORS ARE REQUESTED TO BE A PART OF WILL BE AN ADDITIONAL 2-3 OVER THE NEXT 3 YEARS. GENERALLY THESE MEETINGS ARE HELD EVERY OTHER WEEK FOR 1 HOUR FOR ABOUT 6-9 MONTHS. 
- MONTHLY MEETINGS WITH THE OTHER AMBASSADORS AND THE SMART IRB TEAM 
- REQUESTS TO ASSIST WITH SIGNING ON TO THE AGREEMENT Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ ON AVERAGE I RECEIVE 
ABOUT 4 REQUESTS A MONTH THAT TAKE ABOUT 30 MINUTES PER REQUEST TO HELP THAT INSTITUTION SIGN ON TO THE AGREEMENT AND WALK THEM THROUGH THE STEPS. THIS MAY TAKE PLACE OVER EMAIL, PHONE, OR ZOOM MEETINGS.

subaward_description: SUPPORT ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE CHILD CARE AND EARLY EDUCATION POLICY RESEARCH CONSORTIUM, INCLUDING VIRTUAL CONVENINGS THROUGHOUT THE YEAR (ROUGHLY ONCE PER MONTH) AND A BIANNUAL MEETING. SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR VIRTUAL CONVENINGS WILL INCLUDE DEFINING TOPIC/FOCUS OF MEETING, PREPARING AGENDAS AND MEETING MATERIALS, COORDINATING WITH PRESENTERS AND FACILITATING MEETING, AS WELL AS DISSEMINATING MEETING MATERIALS FOLLOWING THE CONVENING. SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR THE BIANNUAL MEETING WILL INCLUDE ESTABLISHING A PLANNING PROCESS, SUPPORTING PLANNING GROUPS, DRAFTING/UPDATING PLANNING GUIDANCE AND OTHER MEETING MATERIALS (E.G. PROGRAM AGENDA, ACF PROJECT BRIEF MATRIX, MEETING EVALUATION FORM, WELCOME LETTER, SESSION MATERIALS), PROVIDING ONSITE MEETING SUPPORT, FACILITATING WRAP UP OF MEETING AND ARCHIVING OF MATERIALS ON RESEARCH CONNECTIONS.

prime_award_base_transaction_description: STRATEGIC SERVICES IN SUPPORT OF A DATA MANAGEMENT CENTER OF EXCELLENCE (DMCOE)
prime_award_naics_description: ALL OTHER PROFESSIONAL, SCIENTIFIC, AND TECHNICAL SERVICES
subawardee_business_types: OTHER NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION,1862 LAND GRANT COLLEGE,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION
subaward_description: THE MISSION OF THE NIH OFFICE OF DATA SCIENCE STRATEGY IS TO ENHANCE BIOMEDICAL DATA SCIENCE BY LEADING AND COORDINATING EFFORTS ACROSS NIH TO MODERNIZE DATA RESOURCES, DEVELOP A SKILLED DATA SCIENCE WORKFORCE, AND BUILD STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS FOR ADVANCING TECHNOLOGIES AND METHODS. NIH EMPHASIZES THE MANAGEMENT AND SHARING OF RESEARCH DATA ACCORDING TO THE FAIR PRINCIPLES, ENSURING DATA IS FINDABLE, ACCESSIBLE, INTEROPERABLE, AND REUSABLE. ACHIEVING THESE PRINCIPLES RELIES ON WELL-DOCUMENTED SEMANTIC RESOURCES LIKE STANDARDS AND ONTOLOGIES. WHILE TOP-DOWN APPROACHES TO CREATING THESE RESOURCES MAY FAIL, COMMUNITY-DRIVEN, CO-DEVELOPED RESOURCES ARE MORE LIKELY TO BE WIDELY ADOPTED. THIS APPROACH BENEFITS KEY NIH STAKEHOLDERS, INCLUDING NIH-FUNDED BIOMEDICAL RESEARCHERS, DATA AND COMPUTER SCIENTISTS, AND EARLY CAREER RESEARCHERS AND STUDENTS, PARTICULARLY THOSE FROM UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS AND MINORITY-SERVING INSTITUTIONS.

prime_award_naics_description: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES
subaward_description: THE ADJACENT POSSIBLE (TAP) WILL PLAN AND FACILITATE TWO VIRTUAL MEETINGS IN SUMMER 2024 TO GATHER FEEDBACK ON THE RESEARCH AGENDA AND IMPLEMENTATION PLAN FROM EXPERTS IN THE FIELD (INCLUDING YOUTH IF POSSIBLE). AS PART OF THIS PLANNING, TAP WILL PREPARE FOR THE EVENT BY ATTENDING APRIL AND MAY MEETINGS THAT ARE FACILITATED BY CHILD TRENDS (AS AVAILABLE) AND BE FAMILIAR WITH IMPORTANT DOCUMENTS SUCH AS TAKE ACTION FOR ADOLESCENTS Ã¢Â‚¬Â€Œ A CALL TO ACTION FOR ADOLESCENT HEALTH AND WELL-BEING, THE METHODS AND OUTPUT OF THE AI MODEL SCANNING THE LITERATURE, MEETING NOTES, AND DRAFTS OF THE RESEARCH AGENDA AND IMPLEMENTATION PLAN AS THEY ARE COMPLETED.

Ã¢Â€”Ï¿½ PROVIDING CLARIFICATION IN INTERPRETING THE IG REQUIREMENTS,

THE SUBCONTRACTOR SHALL DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN SUPPORTING TECHNICAL DOCUMENTATION AND TEST ARTIFACTS (E.G., TEST DATA, ETC.) FOR THE DEVELOPED TOOLING AS DIRECTED BY THE PRIME AND THE ONC. THE LIST OF TOOLING DEVELOPMENT ITEMS TO SUPPORT THIS TASK IS BELOW:

prime_award_base_transaction_description: AHRQ QUALITY INDICATORS ANALYSIS AND SUPPORT
prime_award_naics_description: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES
subawardee_business_types: OTHER NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION,1862 LAND GRANT COLLEGE,EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION,VETERINARY COLLEGE
subaward_description:
SUBCONTRACTOR SHALL PERFORM THE FOLLOWING TASKS:
TASK 1. PARTICIPATE IN PROJECT MEETINGS, COLLABORATE, AND MEET WITH EXTERNAL ORGANIZATIONS, SUPPORT AND PARTICIPATE IN CONFERENCE CALLS AND THE KICKOFF MEETING WITH AHRQ AND ASSIST IN PREPARING PROGRESS REPORTS.
TASK 4. ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE VISION TO REFINE THE QIS. THIS INCLUDES REVIEWING ENVIRONMENTAL SCANS, PARTICIPATING IN THE REFINEMENT PRIORITIZATION AND VISIONING PROCESS, SYSTEMATICALLY TRACKING TA REQUESTS AND RESPONSES, PLANNING HOW TO MODIFY OR UPDATE SETNAMES AND OTHER CODING TERMINOLOGIES DUE TO CODING UPDATES. UPDATE SETNAMES TO INCORPORATE FISCAL YEAR CODING CHANGES AND REFINEMENTS; CONSTRUCT OR MODIFY SETNAMES SPECIFIC TO THE QIS. REVIEW EXPERT SETNAME-INDICATOR CROSSWALK AND THE MASTER SETNAME-MACRO CROSSWALK. CONTEMPORANEOUSLY UPDATE INDIVIDUAL SETNAME FILES AND SETNAME REFINEMENTS FILES MAINTAINED ON THE BOX PLATFORM THROUGH END OF THE DEVELOPMENT EFFORT FOR BASE YEAR. PROVIDE INPUT INTO THE SETNAME PROCESS AND ALL QUALITY CONTROL CHECKS. REVIEW FINAL SETNAME FILES AND CHANGE LOG PREPARED BY MATHEMATICA BEFORE DELIVERY TO AHRQ.
TASK 5. ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF REVISED SPECIFICATIONS FOR QI MEASURES THROUGH THE REFINEMENTS TESTING PROCESS. THIS INCLUDES LEADING ANY SETNAME-BASED REFINEMENTS, REVIEWING RESULTS FOR NON-SETNAME REFINEMENT TESTS, AND REVIEWING ANY DOCUMENTATION OR MATERIALS THAT ARE UPDATED TO ACCOUNT FOR IMPLEMENTED REFINEMENTS.
TASK 6. PROVIDE AD-HOC SUPPORT AS NEEDED TO CLARIFY QUESTIONS ON RISK ADJUSTMENT MODELS, SIGNAL VARIANCES, AND COMPOSITE WEIGHTS. REVIEW AND COMMENT ON RISK ADJUSTMENT AND EMPIRICAL METHODS REPORTS.
TASK 8.   REVIEW AND COMMENT ON SCIENTIFIC ACCEPTABILITY REPORTS.
TASK 9. ALPHA OR BETA TEST PUBLIC USE SAS SOFTWARE. REVIEW AND COMMENT ON TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS, LOG OF UPDATES AND REVISIONS, AND OTHER USER DOCUMENTS.
TASK 10. RESPOND TO APPROXIMATELY 50 TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) REQUESTS IN THE BASE YEAR, REVIEW QUARTERLY TA REPORTS, AND DEVELOP FAQ DOCUMENTS FOR TA RESPONSES.
TASK 11. CONDUCT ANNUAL PRIVACY TRAINING AND UPDATE DATA USE AGREEMENTS, AS REQUIRED BY MATHEMATICAÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S PROJECT DIRECTOR.
TASK 12. SUPPORT THE TESTING OF NEW MEASURES THROUGH EXPERT PANELS, CLINICAL AND CODING REVIEW, AND REVIEW OF ANALYSES. ASSIST IN WRITING SUMMARY REPORT.
TASK 13. ADVISE ON THE ENVIRONMENTAL SCAN, LEAD MEASURE VALIDATION, COLLABORATE ON PREVENTABILITY WEIGHTS, RISK ADJUSTMENT, AND BETA RELEASE, AND ENSURE MEASURES' CLINICAL USEFULNESS AND ACCURACY THROUGH DETAILED CHART REVIEWS AND VALIDATION USING DATA SOURCES LIKE THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA HEALTH DATA WAREHOUSE.

3) AMENDMENT TO ATTACHMENT C.
ATTACHMENT C OF THE SUBCONTRACT IS REVISED AS OUTLINED BELOW. NO OTHER WORK SHALL BE UNDERTAKEN EXCEPT THAT AS INTENDED FOR OPTION PERIOD 4 DURING THIS TIME.

prime_award_naics_description: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES
subaward_description:
IN YEAR 5 OF THIS PROJECT, CHANGE MATRIX, LLC WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE UNIVERSAL AND INDIVIDUALIZED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO MATERNAL INFANT AND EARLY CHILDHOOD HOME VISITING STATE AND TERRITORY AWARDEES. CHANGE MATRIX STAFF WILL ALSO HELP TO IDENTIFY GRANT AWARDEE PRIORITIES, SERVE AS THE CO-LEAD FOR THE PROGRAMMATIC WORKSTREAM, FACILITATE THE TA PRIORITIES SCAN WORKGROUP, CONTRIBUTE SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE, AS NEEDED, TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE TARC UNIVERSAL PLAN AND PRODUCTS / ACTIVITIES, ASSIST
WITH THE CREATION AND REFINEMENT OF TOOLS, ATTEND REGULAR MEETINGS, SUBMIT REGULAR REPORTS, AND PERFORM OTHER SERVICES AS REQUIRED.

subaward_description:
"WORK TO BE PERFORMED BY MULTICARE IS INCLUDED AS EXHIBIT 1, SCOPE OF WORK:
THE SCREENING FOR COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENT TOPIC INCLUDES A TOPIC REFINEMENT, SYSTEMATIC EVIDENCE REVIEW, AND MANUSCRIPT FOR PUBLICATION IN A PEER-REVIEWED JOURNAL.
ASSIGNED RESOURCES. THE SUBCONTRACTOR PERSONNEL ASSIGNED TO PROVIDE SERVICES AND DELIVERABLES UNDER THIS SUBCONTRACT TO ARE, AS FOLLOWS:
JANELLE GUIRGUIS-BLAKE, MD WILL SERVE AS THE LEAD INVESTIGATOR OF THE SCREENING FOR COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENT TOPIC. KAISER PERSONNEL WILL PROVIDE ADEQUATE PROJECT MANAGEMENT, SCIENTIFIC EXPERTISE, AND ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT DR. GUIRGUIS-BLAKE THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES.
CONTRACTOR'S DELIVERABLES, MILESTONES, SCHEDULE, AND BUDGET
DELIVERABLES	DELIVERY
SCHEDULE
DRAFT RESEARCH PLAN	JANUARY 2025
FINAL RESEARCH PLAN	JUNE 2025
DRAFT SYSTEMATIC EVIDENCE REVIEW FOR TASK FORCE MEETING	JANUARY 2026
TRAVEL TO DC TO PRESENT FINDINGS AT THE USPSTF MEETING	MARCH 2026
DRAFT SYSTEMATIC EVIDENCE REVIEW FOR PUBLIC COMMENTS	SEPTEMBER 2026
FINAL MANUSCRIPT TO SUBMIT TO A PEER-REVIEWED JOURNAL	DECEMBER 2026
FINAL SYSTEMATIC EVIDENCE REVIEW	APRIL 2027
"

subaward_description:
OBJECTIVE:
THE OBJECTIVE IS TO PROVIDE STAFFING SUPPORT SERVICES FOR ASPR/CA/OF PER THE INDEFINITE DELIVERY INDEFINITE QUANTITY
(IDIQ) CONTRACT.
SCOPE OF WORK
THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL STAFFING SERVICES TO SUPPORT THE TASKS AND MISSION REQUIREMENTS FOR ASPR/OA/OF
IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POSITION REQUIREMENTS OUTLINED IN THIS STATEMENT OF WORK.
APPLICABLE DOCUMENTS
THE ASPR PTMSSS IDIQ CONTRACT AND ALL RELATED MODIFICATIONS.
LCAT POSITION DESCRIPTIONS
THE SUBCONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE ALL LABOR, MATERIALS, AND SUPERVISION TO PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL STAFFING SERVICES SUPPORT FOR
THE ASPR/OA/OF.
MID-LEVEL FINANCIAL ANALYST
SUPPORT LOCATION: ASPR HQ
POSITION TYPE: HYBRID CONTRACTOR, REQUIRES ONBOARDING AND ISSUANCE OF GFE/GFI
EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATION:
MASTER Ã¢Â‚¬ËŒS DEGREE IN BUSINESS, FINANCE, OR RELATED FIELD OR EQUIVALENT, AS APPROVED BY THE CONTRACTING OFFICER. 8-12 YEARSÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢
EXPERIENCE WITH BUDGET DEVELOPMENT OR FINANCIAL ANALYSIS SUPPORT TO FEDERAL AGENCIES AND COMMERCIAL INDUSTRY.
OVERALL DUTIES AND DELIVERABLES:
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· PROVIDES DIRECT SUPPORT TO AGENCY-LEVEL AND PROGRAM OFFICE BUDGET DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES. REVIEWS AND
COORDINATES FUNDING MEMOS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· DEVELOPS AND UPDATES SPEND PLANS. TRACKS FUNDING AND OBLIGATIONS, CREATING REPORTS AND BUILDING REQUISITIONS IN FINANCIAL SYSTEMS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· BUILD REQUISITIONS WITH ASPRÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S FINANCIAL TRACKING SYSTEM (INCEP) AND/OR FINANCIAL SYSTEM OF RECORD (UFMS).
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· RESEARCHING THE STATUS OF OBLIGATIONS, AS WELL AS PERFORM A BROAD RANGE OF QUERIES, IN BOTH SYSTEMS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· REVIEW AND TRACK APPORTIONMENTS BY BUILDING TRACKING SHEETS AND WORKING CLOSELY WITH OMB.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· DETERMINE, TRACK AND ISSUE ALLOTMENTS, ORGANIZE AND UPDATE ALLOTMENT TABLES.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· REVIEW APPORTIONMENTS AND OBLIGATIONS BY CATEGORY B LINES AND MULTIPLE FUNDS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· TRACK AND MONITOR APPROPRIATIONS FROM OMB.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· REVIEW AND TRACK APPORTIONED AND UN-APPORTIONED FUNDS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· ENTER IN UFMS APPORTIONMENTS AS BUDGET RESOURCES FOR ENACTED FUNDS, AND PROCESS ALLOTMENTS IN UFMS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· PREPARE SF 132 AND RECONCILE AND REVIEW SF 133.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· FORWARD SPEND PLAN TO OMB, INCLUDING DE-OBLIGATIONS, CARRY OVER FOR RECOVERIES.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· COORDINATE WITH FORMULATION BRANCH ON BUDGETS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· COORDINATE WITH PROGRAM OFFICES AND FORMULATION ON SPEND PLAN.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE BUDGET EXECUTION PROCESS. SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING:
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· ASSIST IN DEVELOPMENT OF SPEND PLANS TO INCLUDE ESTIMATES, JUSTIFICATION OF ASSUMPTIONS, RESEARCH, AND ANALYSIS (BY
QUARTER), BY MAJOR OBJECT CLASSÃ¢Â‚¬Â€�TRAVEL, TRAINING, SUPPLIES, EQUIPMENT, ETC., AND BY PROGRAMS).
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· SUPPORT THE REVIEW OF REQUISITIONS WITHIN INCEP, PREPARATION OF REQUISITIONS WITHIN IPROC, AND ASSOCIATED RESEARCH
IN BOTH SYSTEMS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· PROFICIENCY IN DHHSÃ¢Â‚¬Â„¢S FINANCIAL BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE SYSTEM (FBIS).
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· AS REQUIRED, SUPPORT THE RECONCILIATION BETWEEN INCEP AND THE INFORMATION IN AWARD DOCUMENTS AND THE UNIFIED
FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (UFMS).
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· SUPPORT THE PREPARATION OF MID-YEAR AND QUARTERLY REVIEWS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· SUPPORT YEAR-ENDS CLOSE OUT ACTIVITIES.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· SUPPORT THE PREPARATION AND MAINTENANCE, ANALYSIS, AND MONITORING OF VARIOUS REPORTS
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· SUPPORT FOR PREPARATION OF AD HOC BRIEFINGS AND STATUS REPORTS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· COMPARISONS OF ALLOTMENTS WITH COMMITMENTS, OBLIGATIONS, AND EXPENDITURES TO AID IN DETERMINING CARRYOVER
AMOUNTS, FINANCIAL ISSUES, AND RESOLUTION REPORTS.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· FAMILIARITY WITH MS EXCEL AND WORD.
ASPR/OFFICE OF FINANCE BUDGET FORMULATION TEAM:
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· POLICY ANALYST TO DEVELOP ANNUAL AND MULTIYEAR BUDGETS FOR MEDICAL COUNTERMEASURE PROCUREMENT.
Ã¯Â€ŠÂ· IN COORDINATION WITH THE STRATEGIC NATIONAL STOCKPILE (SNS) COLLEAGUES, DEVELOP ANNUAL BUDGET OF ASPR/SNS
INCLUDING MEDICAL COUNTERMEASURE PROCUREMENT AGAINST CHEMICAL, BIOLOGICAL, RADIOLOGICAL, AND NUCLEAR (CBRN)
THREATS AND EMERGING INFECTIOUS DISEASES (E.G., EBOLA, ZIKA, PANDEMIC INFLUENZA). THIS INCLUDES DRAFTING AND
EDITING BUDGET NARRATIVE, ASSEMBLING SPEND PLAN, COORDINATING CLEARANCE OF SUPPLEMENTARY DOCUMENTS, QUESTIONS,
AND TALKING POINTS. ALSO, ASSIST WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE PUBLIC HEAL

subaward_description:
THE NATIONAL OPINION RESEARCH CENTER (NORC) WILL COLLABORATE WITH AMERICAN INSTITUTES FOR RESEARCH (AIR) ON TASK 4: SUPPORT QHP CERTIFICATION AND ANY OPERATIONS RELATED THERETO. NORC WILL COLLABORATE WITH AIR IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS, AS NEEDED:
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	COLLABORATE WITH AIR ON MEETING SUPPORT TO INCLUDE ATTENDING AD HOC AND REGULARLY SCHEDULED MEETINGS AND TAKING MEETING NOTES.
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	COLLABORATE WITH AIR ON PRESCRIPTION DRUG (RX) REVIEWS TO SUPPORT THE CCIIO MPMG CONTRACT NEEDS.
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	SUPPORT AIR WITH OPERATIONAL TASKS ON AN AS NEEDED BASS. THIS MAY INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO SUPPORT RELATED TO QHP CERTIFICATION TASKS.
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	PROVIDE POLICY EXPERTISE RELATED TO CCIIO PRIORITY TOPICS.

subaward_description:
THE GEORGE WASHINGTON UNIVERSITY (GW) WILL COLLABORATE WITH AMERICAN INSTITUTES FOR RESEARCH (AIR) ON TASK 4: SUPPORT QHP CERTIFICATION AND ANY OPERATIONS RELATED THERETO AND TASK 11: ESSENTIAL HEATH BENEFITS (EHB) POLICY, OPERATIONS, AND ANALYSIS. GW WILL COLLABORATE WITH AIR IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS, AS NEEDED:
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	SUPPORT AIR WITH POLICY AND REGULATORY ANALYSES AS NECESSARY TO SUPPORT CCIIO CONTRACT TASK NEEDS
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	SUPPORT DEVELOPING WHITE PAPERS, POWERPOINT PRESENTATIONS, AND ISSUE BRIEFS RELATED TO STATUTORY, REGULATORY, AND SUB-REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS AND IMPLICATIONS OF RELEVANT POLICY AREAS RELATED TO THE HEALTH INSURANCE EXCHANGES
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	HELP IDENTIFY INNOVATIVE POLICY SOLUTIONS FOR THE AIR TEAM TO SUPPORT QHP CERTIFICATION OPERATIONS.
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	SUPPORT OPERATIONAL TASK NEEDS RELATED TO QHP CERTIFICATION TASKS WHICH MAY INCLUDE TRANSPARENCY IN COVERAGE AND INTEROPERABILITY.

subaward_description:
THE GEORGE WASHINGTON UNIVERSITY (GW) WILL COLLABORATE WITH AMERICAN INSTITUTES FOR RESEARCH (AIR) ON TASK 4: SUPPORT QHP CERTIFICATION AND ANY OPERATIONS RELATED THERETO AND TASK 11: ESSENTIAL HEATH BENEFITS (EHB) POLICY, OPERATIONS, AND ANALYSIS. GW WILL COLLABORATE WITH AIR IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS, AS NEEDED:
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	SUPPORT AIR WITH POLICY AND REGULATORY ANALYSES AS NECESSARY TO SUPPORT CCIIO CONTRACT TASK NEEDS
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	SUPPORT DEVELOPING WHITE PAPERS, POWERPOINT PRESENTATIONS, AND ISSUE BRIEFS RELATED TO STATUTORY, REGULATORY, AND SUB-REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS AND IMPLICATIONS OF RELEVANT POLICY AREAS RELATED TO THE HEALTH INSURANCE EXCHANGES
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	HELP IDENTIFY INNOVATIVE POLICY SOLUTIONS FOR THE AIR TEAM TO SUPPORT QHP CERTIFICATION OPERATIONS.
Ã¢Â‚¬Â¢	SUPPORT OPERATIONAL TASK NEEDS RELATED TO QHP CERTIFICATION TASKS WHICH MAY INCLUDE TRANSPARENCY IN COVERAGE AND INTEROPERABILITY.

prime_award_program_activities_funding_t: 0045: RURAL HEALTH
prime_awardee_name: GEORGIA STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION, INC.
prime_awardee_parent_name: GEORGIA STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION INC
prime_award_base_transaction_description: FORHP80 C 4778. COMMUNITY-BASED DIVISION DIRECT SERVICES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.
prime_award_naics_description: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES
subawardee_business_types: FOR PROFIT ORGANIZATION,WOMEN-OWNED SMALL BUSINESS,WOMEN-OWNED BUSINESS,BUSINESS OR ORGANIZATION,SUBCHAPTER S CORPORATION
subaward_description:
OVERALL RESPONSIBILITIES:
• PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES FOR 5 HRSA RURAL HEALTH GRANTEES IN THE DIRECT SERVICES
PROGRAM, 2 QUALITY GRANTEES AND 3 OUTREACH GRANTEES. ALL WORK WILL BE PROVIDED BY CATHERINE
LIEMOHN, PRINCIPAL.
RURAL HEALTH NETWORK DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM
TASK 3: EXECUTE TA
PROVIDE TA TO 5 DIRECT SERVICES GRANTEES. TARGETED TA INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING:
O SCHEDULE REGULAR MEETINGS WITH GRANTEES: SET UP THE MEETING, INVITE GRANTEE AND
FORHP PROJECT OFFICER TO PARTICIPATE. CONDUCT HOUR-LONG, MONTHLY CALLS WITH
RHND GRANTEES. BEFORE BEGINNING CALLS WITH EACH GRANTEE, TA PROVIDERS WILL
REVIEW ALL DOCUMENTATION RELATED TO EACH GRANTEE. TA PROVIDERS WILL SUBMIT CALL
AGENDAS FIVE DAYS IN ADVANCE OF EACH CALL TO BOTH THE GRANTEE AND PO AND WILL
INCLUDE WORK PLAN PROGRESS, CURRENT ISSUES AND CHALLENGES, TA SUPPORT NEEDS,
REVIEW OF DELIVERABLES, AND ANY RELEVANT FORHP OR TA ANNOUNCEMENTS.
O TAKE NOTES OF THE CALL ON TEMPLATE PROVIDED AND SUBMIT THEM ELECTRONICALLY TO THE
PO AND GRANTEE WITHIN FIVE DAYS.
O UPLOAD FINAL MEETING SUMMARIES TO ONE DRIVE, NO LATER THAN FIVE (5) BUSINESS DAYS
AFTER EACH CALL. GHPC WILL COMPILE ALL SUMMARIES FOR SUBMISSION TO THE COR.
O LOG MONTHLY MEETINGS CONDUCTED INTO HTTPS://GHPC-CHSD.ORG/LOGIN/.
TASK 3: TAAPS:
COMPLETE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTION PLANS FOR THREE OUTREACH GRANTEES IN THE 2025 COHORT AFTER
USING THE FIRST MONTHLY CALL AS AN INTAKE CALL.
O INFORMED BY INTRODUCTORY CALLS WITH GRANTEES, THE TA TEAM WILL DOCUMENT GRANTEE
NEEDS AND SUPPORTS USING A TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTION PLAN (TAAP). BUILDING
ON AN ESTABLISHED TEMPLATE AND PROCEDURES DEVELOPED FOR OTHER FORHP GRANTEES,
THE TAAP WILL INCLUDE BACKGROUND INFORMATION ON THE GRANTEE PROGRAM AND
NETWORK, PERCEIVED STRENGTHS AND POTENTIAL BARRIERS, GRANTEE NEEDS, TA STRATEGIES,
EXPECTED OUTCOMES, AND TIMELINE. IN ADDITION, ESTABLISH THE ROUTINE MONTHLY CALL
TIME AND DOCUMENT IT IN THE TAAP.
O TA PROVIDERS WILL ELECTRONICALLY SUBMIT DRAFT TAAPS AND CALL SUMMARIES
PREVIOUSLY DRAFTED TO GHPC, GRANTEES AND POS WITHIN THREE WEEKS OF EACH CALL.
THE ASSOCIATED PO AND GRANTEE WILL REVIEW THE TAAP AND SUBMIT REVISIONS TO THE
TA PROVIDER. WITHIN FIVE DAYS OF RECEIVING REVISIONS, THE TA PROVIDER WILL
ELECTRONICALLY SUBMIT THE REVISED TA PLAN TO THE PO AND GRANTEE AS A FINAL TAAP.
O UPLOAD CALL SUMMARIES AND FINAL TAAPS TO ONE DRIVE. GHPC WILL COMPILE ALL
SUMMARIES FOR SUBMISSION TO THE COR.
O LOG FINAL TAAPS INTO CHSDTEAM.COM.
TASK 7 SITE VISITS:
THIS INCLUDES INDIVIDUAL SITE VISITS FOR 2 QUALITY GRANTEES, 3 OUTREACH GRANTEES AND 2 REVERSE SITE
VISITS. TRAVEL WILL BE REIMBURSED SEPARATELY WITH PROPER DOCUMENTATION AND A TRAVEL BUDGET IS
PROVIDED.
SUBCONTRACT UNDER A FEDERAL
CONTRACT ATTACHMENT 4
STATEMENT OF WORK
SUBCONTRACT NO. SP00016743-07

subaward_description:
ANDERSON SMITH CONSULTING INC.
PROVIDE CONSULTING SERVICES TO SUPPORT OPERATIONALIZATION OF THE CHSD TEAM'S CONTINUOUS LEARNING
PRACTICE AND RELATED ADVANCEMENTS OF ITS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE APPROACH IN THE FOLLOWING CAPACITY.
TINA SMITH WILL PROVIDE CAPACITY BUILDING, SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE AND OTHER ASSISTANCE IN THE
DEVELOPMENT OF AN EVALUATION AND PRACTICE STRATEGY FOR THE COMMUNITY HEALTH SYSTEMS DEVELOPMENT
TEAM. IN COLLABORATION WITH THE EVALUATION WORK GROUP, PARTICIPATE IN PLANNING AND ADMINISTRATION OF
TARGETED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE EVALUATION ACTIVITIES, SENSE-MAKING SESSIONS, AND DEVELOPMENT OF
ASSOCIATED TA PRACTICE IMPROVEMENTS FOR DIRECT SERVICES CONTRACT.
THIS WORK WILL OCCUR DURING THE 2024-2025 SUBCONTRACT PERIOD AND BE REALIZED PRIMARILY THROUGH TEAM
MEETINGS VIA PHONE, ZOOM OR IN PERSON. TEAM MEETINGS MAY INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO BI-WEEKLY
EVALUATION WORK GROUP MEETINGS, BI-WEEKLY TA LEAD MEETINGS, FULL TEAM AND INDIVIDUAL MEETINGS.
EVALUATION
- PROVIDE GUIDANCE ON APPROACH AND LEARNING AGENDA FOR EVALUATION OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THAT
INCLUDES:
O REVIEW OF INSTRUMENTS – ENSURING INSTRUMENTS TRACK WITHIN AND ACROSS GRANT COHORTS;
FEEDBACK ON QUALITY OF QUESTIONS AND SURVEY VALIDITY, INCLUDING BEST PRACTICES FOR A
DEVELOPMENTAL APPROACH TO EVALUATION OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.
 COUNTERPARTS: EVALUATION WORKING GROUP
 MODE: REVIEW OF DRAFT INSTRUMENTS, ATTENDANCE AT WORKING GROUP MEETINGS
O DESIGN DIRECT SERVICES FOCUS GROUP DISCUSSION SESSION, DEVELOP QUESTIONS FOR GUIDE,
CONDUCT FOCUS GROUPS THAT TAKE PLACE IN ATLANTA AREA, AND SUPPORT ANALYSIS OF RESULTS
 COUNTERPARTS: TA EVALUATOR AND EVALUATION WORKING GROUP
 MODE: REVIEW OF MID-CYCLE EVALUATION RESULTS, MEETING DESIGN AND FACILITATION
PROMPTS, ATTENDANCE AT WORKING GROUP MEETINGS, MEETINGS WITH TA EVALUATOR
 POTENTIAL ACTIVITIES:
• FOCUS GROUPS AT DIRECT SERVICES MEETING IN MARCH (END OF COHORT QUALITY
FG, MID-COURSE COHORT WITH DELTA, CARE COORDINATION);
• NEW PROJECT DIRECTOR FOCUS GROUPS AT OUTREACH AND DS (CROSS COHORT,
DIRECTORS WITH 18 MONTHS OR LESS OF EXPERIENCE)
• “HIGH PERFORMING” OR REPEAT GRANTEE FOCUS GROUP AT DS AND/OR OUTREACH
MEETINGS
O CONDUCT EVALUATION ACTIVITIES WITH FORHP STAFF, INCLUDING PROJECT OFFICERS, COR AND OTHER
CBD LEADERSHIP- TA EVALUATION SURVEY
- PROVIDE INPUT ON LEARNING FROM GRANTEE-LEVEL DATA COLLECTED BY HRSA AND ASSIST IN THE
DEVELOPMENT OF DISCUSSION GUIDES FOR TA-GRANTEE CONVERSATIONS FOR 5 GRANT PROGRAMS, SYNTHESIS
OF DATA FOR GRANTEE NEEDS WITH TA EVALUATOR
O COUNTERPARTS: TA LEADS AND TA EVALUATOR
O MODE: MEETINGS TO FACILITATE ANALYSIS OF TA EVALUATION DATA GENERATED

PROVIDE CONSULTING SERVICES TO SUPPORT OPERATIONALIZATION OF THE CHSD TEAM'S CONTINUOUS LEARNING

METHODOLOGIES, AND HELPING TO INTEGRATE PRACTICE DEVELOPMENT ACROSS GRANTEE COHORTS.

INTO TEAM PROCESS, INCLUDING MAPPING OUT SMALL TESTS OF CHANGE FOR EMBEDDING PRACTICE
DEVELOPMENT.
O COUNTERPARTS: AMANDA PHILLIPS MARTINEZ AND ROXANNE ELLIOT

STEPS FOR TA PROGRAM IN SUPPORT OF BOTH THE FUNDER AND THE GRANTEE.

PROVIDE CONTENT SUPPORT FOR A NETWORK SERVICES GRANTEE GUIDE ON COLLABORATIVE, DATA-DRIVEN

TASK 7 SITE VISITS:
THIS INCLUDES ON-SITE VISIT FOR 5 QUALITY GRANTEES AND 1 REVERSE SITE VISIT. TRAVEL WILL BE
REIMBURSED SEPARATELY WITH PROPER DOCUMENTATION.
TASK 6 AND 11: GRANT PROGRAM DELIVERABLES
TA PROVIDER WILL REVIEW THE FOLLOWING GRANTEE DELIVERABLES AND OFFER FEEDBACK ON GRANTEE’S
MONTHLY CALL:
• QUALITY PIMS REPORTS FOR 10 GRANTEES
• QUALITY NCC ANNUAL REPORT FOR 10 GRANTEES
• QUALITY DATA DASHBOARD REPORT FOR 10 GRANTEES
• QUALITY DRAFT SUSTAINABILITY PLAN FOR 10 GRANTEES
• TRIMESTER REVIEWS AND UPDATES OF TAAPS: 3 REVIEWS X 10 GRANTEES

prime_award_base_transaction_description: FORHP80 C 3088. TA RURAL HEALTH NETWORK PLANNING (RHNP) AND RURAL HEALTH NETWORK DEVELOPMENT (RHND) PROGRAMS.
prime_award_naics_description: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES
subawardee_business_types: FOR PROFIT ORGANIZATION,BUSINESS OR ORGANIZATION,SUBCHAPTER S CORPORATION
subaward_description:
TASK 3: EXECUTE TA
PROVIDE TA TO 10 RURAL HEALTH NETWORK DEVELOPMENT GRANTEES. TARGETED TA INCLUDES THE
FOLLOWING:
O SCHEDULE REGULAR MEETINGS WITH GRANTEES: SET UP THE MEETING, INVITE GRANTEE
AND FORHP PROJECT OFFICER TO PARTICIPATE. CONDUCT HOUR-LONG, MONTHLY CALLS
WITH RHND GRANTEES. BEFORE BEGINNING CALLS WITH EACH GRANTEE, TA PROVIDERS
WILL REVIEW ALL DOCUMENTATION RELATED TO EACH GRANTEE. TA PROVIDERS WILL
SUBMIT CALL AGENDAS FIVE DAYS IN ADVANCE OF EACH CALL TO BOTH THE GRANTEE AND
PO AND WILL INCLUDE WORK PLAN PROGRESS, CURRENT ISSUES AND CHALLENGES, TA
SUPPORT NEEDS, REVIEW OF DELIVERABLES, AND ANY RELEVANT FORHP OR TA
ANNOUNCEMENTS. THE FIRST CALL OF EACH QUARTER WILL INCLUDE A WORK PLAN UPDATE
FROM GRANTEE.
O TAKE NOTES OF THE CALL ON TEMPLATE PROVIDED AND SUBMIT THEM ELECTRONICALLY TO
THE PO AND GRANTEE WITHIN FIVE DAYS.
O UPLOAD FINAL MEETING SUMMARIES TO ONE DRIVE, NO LATER THAN FIVE (5) BUSINESS
DAYS AFTER EACH CALL. GHPC WILL COMPILE ALL SUMMARIES FOR SUBMISSION TO THE
COR.
O LOG QUARTERLY INVENTORY OF TA ACTIVITIES
O LOG MONTHLY MEETINGS CONDUCTED INTO HTTPS://GHPC-CHSD.ORG/LOGIN/.
TASK 7 SITE VISITS:
THIS INCLUDES SITE VISIT FEES FOR 5 TOTAL SITE VISITS, INCLUDING 4 RURAL HEALTH NETWORK DEVELOPMENT
INDIVIDUAL GRANTEE VISITS AND 1 REVERSE SITE VISIT. TRAVEL WILL BE REIMBURSED SEPARATELY WITH PROPER
DOCUMENTATION.
TASK 6 AND 11: GRANTEE DELIVERABLES
TA PROVIDER WILL REVIEW THE FOLLOWING GRANTEE DELIVERABLES AND OFFER FEEDBACK ON
GRANTEE’S MONTHLY CALL:
• NCC REPORT
• DATA DASHBOARD
• PIMS REPORT (YEAR 2)
• ANNUAL TAAP UPDATES (UPDATE EXISTING WRITTEN DOCUMENT AND UPLOAD TO SHARED DRIVE)

subaward_description:
PER WHI POLICY, EVENTS ELIGIBLE FOR INVESTIGATION FOR HEART FAILURE WILL BE IDENTIFIED BY WHI STAFF.  MEDICAL RECORDS WILL BE OBTAINED FOR ELIGIBLE HOSPITALIZATION AND SENT TO WHI REGIONAL CENTERS FOR INITIAL VERIFICATION AND DETERMINATION OF COMPLETENESS. ELECTRONIC COPIES OF ASSEMBLED MEDICAL RECORDS ARE SENT TO THE COORDINATING CENTER AT THE UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA. THE UNC COORDINATING CENTER RECEIVES LOGS AND VERIFIES RECEIPT OF MEDICAL RECORDS. UNC COORDINATING CENTER WILL USE A WEB-BASED DATA ENTRY SYSTEM FOR THE WHI HEART FAILURE DATA ABSTRACTION AND FOR CAPTURING THE PHYSICIAN ADJUDICATOR CLASSIFICATION. TRAINED MEDICAL RECORDS ABSTRACTORS WILL REVIEW RECORDS AND COMPLETE HEART FAILURE DATA COLLECTION TOOL.  
ESTIMATE OF THE NUMBER OF HEART FAILURE ELIGIBLE CASES TO BE INDENTIFIED BY WHI AND SENT TO THE UNC COORDINATING CENTER FOR ABSTRACTION AND CLASSIFICATION: 
YEAR 1  =  402
YEAR 2  =  382
YEAR 3  =  363
YEAR 4  =  346
YEAR 5  =  329

subaward_description:
STATESIDE WILL COLLABORATE WITH AMERICAN INSTITUTES FOR RESEARCH (AIR) ON TASK 11: ESSENTIAL HEATH BENEFITS (EHB) POLICY, OPERATIONS, AND ANALYSIS. STATESIDE WILL COLLABORATE WITH AIR IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS, AS NEEDED:
•	PROVIDE POLICY EXPERTISE RELATED TO CCIIO PRIORITY TOPICS.
•	SUPPORT AIR WITH STATE-MANDATED RELATED RESEARCH REQUESTS FROM CCIIO, INCLUDING ANALYSES TO DETERMINE WHETHER MANDATES REQUIRE DEFRAYAL. 
•	SUPPORT AIR WITH STATE-MANDATE RELATED DELIVERABLES BASED ON CCIIO’S REQUESTS, SUCH AS DEVELOPING MANDATE TRACKERS, JUSTIFICATION TEMPLATES, AND OTHER DELIVERABLES, AS REQUESTED BY CCIIO.
•	SUPPORT AIR WITH PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO STATES REGARDING MANDATE QUESTIONS. THIS SUPPORT COULD INCLUDE ATTENDING CALLS WITH STATES, PROVIDING NOTE-TAKING SUPPORT, AND DRAFTING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE DOCUMENTS. 
•	SUPPORT AIR WITH POLICY AND REGULATORY ANALYSES AS NECESSARY TO SUPPORT CCIIO CONTRACT TASK NEEDS
•	ATTEND MEETINGS WITH CCIIO AND AIR, AS REQUESTED.

subaward_description:
MILLIMAN WILL COLLABORATE WITH AMERICAN INSTITUTES FOR RESEARCH (AIR) ON TASK 4: SUPPORT QHP CERTIFICATION AND ANY OPERATIONS RELATED THERETO. MILLIMAN WILL COLLABORATE WITH AIR IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS, AS NEEDED:
•	SUPPORT ANNUAL ACTUARIAL VALUE CALCULATOR (AVC) TESTING, UPON REQUEST BY CCIIO, TO EXTERNALLY VALIDATE ASSUMPTIONS AND CHANGES TO AVC FUNCTIONS.
•	PROVIDE ACTUARIAL SUPPORT AND "INSTITUTIONAL MEMORY" REGARDING ANNUAL DEVELOPMENT OF THE AVC TO INFORM CCIIO’S FUNCTIONAL AND POLICY DECISIONS RELATED TO UPDATES APPLIED TO THE AVC.
•	PROVIDE TECHNICAL GUIDANCE REGARDING DATA SOURCES AND YEARS TO BE USED, TO INCLUDE INSIGHTS INTO VALIDITY AND LIMITATIONS OF BHI AND EDGE DATA.
•	PROVIDE TECHNICAL GUIDANCE TO THE REVIEW WORKGROUP IN ANALYZING EDGE QUANTITY AND QUALITY DATA
•	PROVIDE RISK ADJUSTMENT COMMENTARY/SUPPORT FOR THE RISK ADJUSTMENT WORKGROUP (E.G., FOR PENDING CHANGES).
•	PROVIDE TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO INFORM FUTURE MODELING CONSIDERATIONS, AS REQUESTED BY CCIIO.

subaward_description:
TO SUPPORT THE PREVENTION COMMUNICATIONS BRANCH (PCB) HIV COMMUNICATIONS PROGRAM, RTI INTERNATIONAL (RTI) WILL DEVELOP PRODUCTS, CONTENT, AND STRATEGIES TO REACH AND SUPPORT PROVIDER AND CLINICAL PARTNER AUDIENCES.  THEY WILL ALSO LEAD THE PLANNING AND COORDINATION OF ALL METRICS COLLECTION, MONITORING AND REPORTING RELATED TO THIS CONTRACT. 
RTI INTERNATIONAL WILL: 
ASSIGN POINTS OF CONTACT/SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS/DEPUTY TASK MANAGERS AND SUPPORT TEAM MEMBERS AS NEEDED. 
ATTEND AND PARTICIPATE IN INTERNAL AND CLIENT MEETINGS. 
PLAN, IMPLEMENT, AND REPORT ON TASK ACTIVITIES, AS DIRECTED BY CLIENT. 
OTHER RELATED WORK TO START UP CONTRACT AS DIRECTED BY FHI 360, IN RESPONSE TO CLIENT DIRECTION AND GUIDANCE.
